They advertise their link in service as being this great benefit, but what it means is you need to spend $18 a day for online service in your room or you lug your computer down to the lobby with the worn furniture to work. The ballyhooed TV wake up service did not work at all; thank God I set up a back up with my iPad of I would've missed meetings. I stay at different kinds of hotels -- a month before I stayed at a comfort inn near Olympia, WA, and had a MUCH better experience for MUCH less money. if you are looking for a quality experience, do NOT choose this hotel. They should be ashamed of allving this a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience varies”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay, the reason why there are so many mixed reviews is when you get here, you think the hotel is only the one in the main picture; HOWEVER, there are really two hotels here, and your experience will vary greatly depending on which tower you are staying. The main one is clean, spacious, and staff is friendly, I can't speak for the other one, but just read some of the reviews and you'll get an idea. The tower I stayed in had great facilities, room was large and the best part was the views from the balcony, SPG status gets you the floor second to the top and free internet which is wired not wifi. Lounge is on the top floor and key card is needed, status gets you free breakfast, otherwise it's like $14, pretty basic, all continental mostly, cereal, fruit, muffins etc. no hot food. Getting down to the gaslamp cost exactly $13 from the hotel, it's not that bad, but there isn't really anything around, the Westin is a better choice if you want to stay downtown, it's probably a 5min walk to the gas lamp from there. Overall, I was very satisfied with the stay, facility was great, clean, quiet, and spacious, staff was friendly and attentive and the shuttle comes and goes very often, just remember, your stay depends on which tower you stay in, I believe mine was the marina tower and the iffy one is called the bayview tower. You should definitely ask where you'll be put before confirming.

Reviews.Title: “Next to airport- literally.”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarrie
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be a 3 star. The rooms, bed/linens/bathroom- everything are average. It felt like we were driving to the airport and bam -we were at our hotel. Yes we could see planes taking off out our window- so if you like planes this is perfect. I had to request a new room because our bedspread was stained and there was mold in the bathtub. Second room was a downgrade but at least it was clean and they gave us a breakfast voucher. Great bargain if you get it on priceline- but don't buy the rack rate. Overpromise, underdeliver. Btw- Coffee was stale in the room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service. Looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: linda t
Reviews.Content: This is the second year my sister and I have stayed in the hotel. Have always found the staff very helpful and they take the time to greet ,make you feel welcome.During this stay San Diego had the power outage. It lasted from about 10 hours. The staff went into motion to see everyone was comfortable during this time. We had breakfast every morning in the resturant. Was greeted by Ronnie who was the resturant manager, he took time fo ask about our visit and let us know about things in the area to do. We also requested the same room we had as the last visit. They did everything to accomdate our stay. Great Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average but with Security Concerns”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on a business trip for a conference. The room was fine and, were I not working most of the time, I might have been able to enjoy the small balcony. The bed was not particularly comfortable and the use of a bottom flat sheet that slipped up from the end uncovering the scratchy mattress pad underneath made for poor sleep quality. The shower was OK - the water was hot but the water pressure was not great. The staff as part of the conference was very good and responsive. My biggest complaint is that I came back to my room one evening to find the door open. I decided to go in when I saw that a light was on but was certainly concerned about the possibility of an intruder. I called the front desk right away and they sent up a security guard. I checked and it did not seem as if anything was taken. The security guard took some data from the door lock and confirmed that the last key used was from housekeeping. I was just fortunate that my room was a bit further down the hall that a passer-by didn't take advantage of the door being left open. This is a huge concern for me and while the conference customer service was good and the room was OK, it is unlikely that I will stay at this property again unless I have to for business reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rudolf51
Reviews.Content: San Diego Sheraton Marina Tower is situated on Habour Island. Amazing views of the bay and marina. Great location ! This is also a great location if you like to walk or run. The hotel is close to the airport, but you won't notice. The hotel was very clean and the staff was super friendly. Breakfast was one of the best we ever had. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nautical & Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tamgerine
Reviews.Content: Thie hotel was very well-equipped with restaurants, spa services, and a great gift store. Beautiful walking areas all around the hotel, in the marina and bay area. My room had a nautical theme that was sweet. Bed was comfortable and cozy. Couldn't get WiFi working, but took it as a sign that work should be done for the day, as I had been up for almost 2 days on this trip! The air conditioning was on full blast and it couldn't be adjusted. When I called to inquire about it, they were quick to handle the situation, and brought me complimentary fruit tray as apology for the half hour intrusion. The service man was wonderful, friendly yet professional and very thoughtful. Great location for airport convenience, bad location for downtown convenience.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but miles from the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: isobelb52
Reviews.Content: We booked here, via a 'travel' website which said that it was 5 minutes from Gaslamp. No such thing!! To get into the centre of San Diego we had to catch the hotel bus to the airport and get public transport into town (and do the reverse to return). The hotel, like any big chain, is comfortable but impersonal and staff weren't very sure about whether the trolley tour stopped at the hotel or when. Given that it's a daily occurence (at 9.50am for the Bay Tower) I thought this was rather strange

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haihong H
Reviews.Content: The view from this hotel is very beautiful, food is not so good, but there are many nice restaurant nearby. Generally it worth staying .

Reviews.Title: “Two Towers - one Great One not”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: Be carefull which tower they put you in -- they are about 1/2 mile apart -- one has every facility you could want --the one I stayed in the "Marina" was lacking in almost every regard. Good room and good location but that is it. No decent restaurant. No wi-fi in the rooms, no decent place to sit and get a drink. Gift shop is minimal and generally closed. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TXTraveler512
Reviews.Content: I had selected this hotel because of the close to airport location and thought we might have a nice view. We were just returning from a cruise and wanted a day to sight see in San Diego. We were on the marina side so the view didn't turn out as well as I had hoped. The room was nice and we spent quite a bit more time in the hotel than anticipated because my husband was not feeling well. We had to walk quite a way to find something to eat and ended up at what was really a coffee shop. Overall, I thought it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All rooms have a view!”
Reviews.Author: Glors
Reviews.Content: We were on the 10th floor - with wonderful views of the marina and the city. other rooms had views of the marina and the ocean. we were very happy with the quality of the room and the service. free internet in the lobby, however $26 parking each day was fairly hefty. only 15 minutes away from san diego zoo and around 15 minutes - the other way to sea world - great location and very easy to get around, especially with a GPS - we drove from san francisco to san simeon to anaheim to san diego - the roads are very well sign posted and the main attractions are easy to find. the prices in the hotel restaurants are very pricey - but nothing is close by - you have to drive to get to a cheaper place to eat. Spend more time in san diego - go and see the city, as well as the zoo, safari park and sea world - san diego is a lovely city and worthy of a day or 2 just getting around in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan0121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a mini getaway and it was wonderful. Excelent customer service, great location and the pools, grounds and views were amazing. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sustainble and Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeRuss1
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Diego and it was the srat of agreat conference. The hotel is minutes from the airport. The shuttle bus runs every15 minutes or shorter as it was there when you need it. The arirval at the hotel was perfect. The lobby was beautifully decorated and prepared for our conference. The rooms were nicely appointed: refreshment centre, T.V nautical theme room and very comfortable. Concierge team member very accommodating. The Director of Front Office was very cordial and engaging; thank you Daniel. Though the airportis close to the hotel, you felt as it you were in a resort. The hotel does a great job creating a sense of relaxation and comfort with its surroundings. The guestroom keys are made from cardboard........WOW that is what you call "Taking care of the environment". Thank you everyone for a FANTASTIC experience. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - San Diego, Harbor Island”
Reviews.Author: mdculpepper
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite San Diego hotels. Friendly staff. Easy to find. Assessable parking. Nice bar and restaurants. Nice Executive Lounge. There are two hotels on the property. About a 5 minute walking distance apart. One tower is the "luxury" tower, has all the amenities and fill up fast. The tower tower is more secluded and has a better view of the San Diego Harbor. Ask which tower you will be put in. Both are a short car drive or bicycle ride to the main Port area.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could use an update”
Reviews.Author: mcap56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night through priceline when the stay for my conference ended elsewhere. The main issue with this place in the rooms. The first room I was given had stained carpet, peeling wallpaper and was just not that clean. They were gracious about moving me and the second room was better but there was still a very large stain on the carpet near the bed. Overall, the rooms are decent but could use an upgrade and good cleaning. The location is OK - especially if you want to stay near the airport. It's on a Marina which is nice and you can walk out into a park that is attached. This is not a place that is convenient to downtown however. Count on cabs (which are not that cheap there) to get anywhere else. I asked about public transportation options but there really isn't too much around. You can walk to downtown if you are a walker and ambitious. There is a pathway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay the "best" staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Marina hotel and had a wonderful stay. The Staff is marvelous and the property and rooms were great. Loved the location next to the airport. I will always consider this hotel for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service and parking sucks”
Reviews.Author: thebigace15
Reviews.Content: They pretty much charge you for everything. You have to go through a gate to park which hardly ever worked and constantly had to get new keys made because of it. The parking is $11 a day which is almost more then any airport you go to just to stay there. Also at 7:15 we wanted to play ping pong and the manager there told us they can't give us any paddles because it's past the time. I clearly told him most of the people staying here don't get back till around this time and he refused to care. This was a great location hotel but not even close to worth it for the price. I rather have stayed at a less nice place for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for small association meeting”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: Our group was very well attended to -- perfect for a group of 300+ -- made us feel very special.. Food and service was quite good-- Great to have the Carl Vinson right outside our window to watch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, depending on which floor”
Reviews.Author: StephD13
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant after reading other reviews, but my stay was very comfortable and enjoyable. The staff was friendly and helpful, and I really like the $5 reward per day for participating in the "green" program! If you want a nice view, request a room on an upper floor. Noise from the airport is noticeable regardless of which side you're on, but quiets down by 11:00 or so each night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ScottnCindy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel & Marina (Bayside) for three days attending a conference at the hotel. My first night in room 1167 I discovered the thermostat did not work and air conditioner would continue to blow cold air. I made it work by turning the unit on and off several times during the night. The next morning on the way to the conference, I mentioned the problem to the Front Desk and they advised they would send Maintenance to fix the problem. I returned to my room at lunch and found the thermostat was displaying in Celsius and the unit was blowing heated air (as in furnace). I called Guest Services who reported that Maintenance reported the problem as fixed. Guest Services scheduled a second visit from Maintenance and I went back to the conference. I returned to the room at dinner and found no evidence of a visit from Maintenance. I contacted Guest Services who advised they had not heard back from Maintenance and would send someone right away. I advised I would be back in the room around 8 PM and if the problem was not fixed the problem would be escalated to the manager. I returned at 8 PM and the problem was not fixed and the room was super hot. I contacted Guest Services who advised Maintenance was on their way. Fernando from Maintenance quickly arrived and within five minutes determined the unit was broken and would only blow heated air until it was repaired. Fernando contacted the Front Desk and advised them to move us to another room and send a bellhop up to assist in the move. I waited 30 minutes (sitting outside on the balcony to stay cool) and no bellhop. I walked down to the Front Desk and spoke with the manager Dana over the phone. Dana guaranteed the bellhop would be up quickly to assist us and she was researching ways to properly compensate me for my unnecessary troubles. We received a call from Sue at Guest Services asking how our new room was (by calling us in our old room?). We advised we are still waiting on a bellhop and keys to the new room. Sue advised she was working on a compensation package for us to make up for the full day off troubles. Thirty minutes later, I went back down to the front desk and received the keys to room 1172 and I moved myself into the new room. I did meet a maid as I was transferring to the new room that was sent to clean my old room (???). We never saw a bellhop, Sue from Guest Services never called back to offer compensation and Dana the manager never called back to offer compensation. During checkout, I had to argue my point as to why the hotel should remove a charge for a movie rental never finished in the old room. A few days prior to this I stayed at another San Diego hotel during a widespread, 12 hour power outage. I experienced better customer service from that hotel, under the worst of condition compared to the Sheraton Hotel & Marina under the best conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't Even Stayed Yet And Already Not Sure I I'll Like It”
Reviews.Author: SloopJB
Reviews.Content: I'm starting this review at 2-stars, which may change depending on how our stay goes. Yes, that's right, we haven't even stayed at this hotel yet, but the experience thus far has not been very good. I called the hotel a week ahead of my scheduled stay (9/21/11) to make a request for a "great room with a great view." Simple enough, right? First, let me tell you why I made this seemingly simple request. I'm planning on proposing to my girlfriend while in San Diego, and, of course, I want everything to go well...everything from the hotel to the restaurants to the proposal itself. I want it to be an experience. So I called up Sheraton reservations and was told that I would need to speak to the front desk reception, as I booked through a third party (Priceline). After being connected to the front desk, I explained that I am proposing to my girlfriend and want to get the best room for this experience. The woman I was speaking with seemed to care less. Don't get me wrong, she did the minimum of what she was asked to do, but she showed no real care. She explained that I was currently booked in the Bay Tower and could only stay on a floor no higher than the 4th. Really? She went on to explain that if I wanted a higher floor I would have to pay $20 extra per night. Ok..if that's what it takes, no problem. I mentioned to her that I had read lots of reviews saying the Bay Tower was not preferable and the main hotel was much better. She admitted that the Bay Tower was kind of far away, but it was quieter and the rooms were bigger. Ok...sounds fine, but I told her that I was concerned because of all of the reviews. So I asked what she would prefer if she were receiving a marriage proposal...which tower/room/view would she prefer. All she said was it is up to me what I want to do and she will make the request. This was less than friendly or personable, and it showed a real lack of caring. At any rate, I agreed to pay the $20 extra per night for a Bay Tower room "above the 4th floor." I made a request for room on the 10th floor with a good view...so let's see if I get it. I hope the concierge is more caring and sincere, as I plan to ask him/her to have champagne waiting for us upon our return to the hotel after I propose. I will stop the review here for now. I really hope I can come back to this review and put 5 stars on this upcoming stay. Wish me luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: hyelala
Reviews.Content: This is a great property and I'd definitely stay here again. Offers 3 pools and decently sized rooms with balconies. Our view of the marina was beautiful. Some reviewers complained about the location, but it's nice not to be in the downtown area(scuzzy, with lots of homeless!! --- I know they have to live somewhere, but when you're traveling with family you do not want to deal with that element.)  My main complaint with this hotel would be the lack of customer service and their VERY STRONG air freshener. Certain people in my party loved it, but it was definitely not allergy friendly. It had me wheezing before I even completed the checkout process and I had a headache for the rest of our stay. Got up to our room, we decided to order room service and relax before heading down to the pool. I called room service four times and called the front desk, but nobody picked up! I started pushing other buttons in an attempt to ask about room service or other dinning options, but again no answer. The only people that did answer were the valet and they had my car waiting for me proptly every time(good job valet! That was the best service we received while there) I called and asked for two extra blankets, several hours later they never came. After making a follow up call(which AGAIN was not picked up) I went downstairs and requested the two blankets in person. Eventually they sent up ONE blanket.  My room was also charged over $50 in minibar charges for items that were never removed from the fridge. Called to have it corrected, was told someone had to come check the fridge before we checked out, but no one ever came, we waited over an hour for a person to come up!! Finally went down and was told by the desk that they already reversed the charges... So why on earth didn't any staff member bother telling me this??? Because of the wait we ended up being late to our next destination.  Great hotel, bad customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for my cousin's graduation from Marine boot camp. The hotel offered a free shuttle to the Recruit Depot. This weekend had a large power outage, and the hotel staff were extremely friendly and offerred free waters and snacks. The room was newly remodeled and very clean. If you stay here, eat at C Level- it's a great restaurant within walking distance (.3 miles?). Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to get stranded”
Reviews.Author: chris l
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in San Diego during the big power outtage and after rushing over from the airport I was met with a huge line out the door of this hotel and only limited power from a generator. What could have been a long miserable experience was instead a really nice stay at a great hotel! The staff all pitched in and passed out bottled water, kept everyone informed and even made sure there were a few emergency power receptacles for people to charge their phones. It looked like they had practiced for ths type of event because everything went so smoothly. Since the rooms had no power everyone was given a glow stick when the checked in and with an open sliding glass door looking over the bay I got a very plesant night of sleep. The restaurant fed everyone with the limeted cold food they had like salads and sandwiches, but most importantly, the bar was open and they had plenty of cold bottled beer on hand! This would be a great hotel to stay at normally but even being "stuck" there was a pleasure because of the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: B C
Reviews.Content: Nicolas C. is to be commended for searching, finding and sending my cell phone charger left in the room. He took the appropriate steps to track this important item down and shipped it to me in a timely fashion. Thank you for the enjoyable stay and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Barb747
Reviews.Content: First class hotel and great accomodations, the room was very comfortable. The view of the bay and marina was spectacular, very nice pool, nice restaurants if you don't feel like going out. The one down side was the cost of parking at $22 per night but we will definitely stay again because the location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Money not well spent on multi-million dollar remodel!”
Reviews.Author: happytobehappy
Reviews.Content: We won't be back to this hotel. We stayed in the Lanai building in what they call a town house. It has two levels. Upstairs bathroom and main bedroom. Downstairs, bathroom with no bath or shower. Sofabed plus rollaway was for the children. The furniture was insanely heavy to move around which you have to do if you want to pull out the sofa! So once the sofabed is out you have virtually no room to move. The most interesting mistake is the way the balcony is designed. There is a great view of the harbor, BUT if you sit on the chairs on the balcony you see the railing of your balcony instead of the view....How dumb is that? Who got paid to design that? Plus it takes forever to get to the building from the lobby and the final part is really ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Handled conference and Black out well”
Reviews.Author: judy s
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference of 450 people for FMA. The hotel staff were gracious. On Thursday night when the "big" power outage occurred, they kept one elevator running in each bank of elevators, moved up our social from 6:30 to 4:30, had food and drinks, ice water and ice for over three hours on the lawn for our group. Quickly rechecked in folks who were planning to leave that night but needed to stay an extra night. Provided candles for us to continue to enjoy the evening outside and lit the fire boxes. Overall, the staff handled everything very well including the long lines that formed once everyone at the airport decided they were there for the night and quickly converged on the nearest hotel. They kept the kitchen going, providing what food they could under the circumstances. The true test of a hotel is putting them through a crisis such as the regional black out for almost 12 hours. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: ayerslane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in San Diego in August. The rooms have a natical theme and are very nice. We had a view of the harbor and the city!!! The pool area is great. They had bikes you could use for the paths that were along the waterfront which was alot of fun!! We needed a refigerator in our room and they had one sent up immediately. Would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: icedg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marina Hilton before but this time we were assigned to the "Tower". This was a former Westin that was added on the Sheraton. They are actually a good 10 minute walk from each other. That really is the only bad thing. The rooms and service was good but there is only one restuarant and the service there was not good. I would reccomend the hotel if you are planning to eat out for everything. Also when you get a room at the Sheraton ask if it is at the main hotel or the tower. Big difference..

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivyspalady
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel during a mojor power outage and cannot believe how quickly they had everything together that they could do to make it as easy as possible to check in. They did little things such as having bottles water for the guests standing in line to check in and set up a dinner buffet so people could eat during the outage. Staff also handed out glow sticks as the rooms were dark. I would suggest you give them a try as just a wonderful staff and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not of Sheraton Quality, beware there are two towers!”
Reviews.Author: LaoBlue
Reviews.Content: The Bay Tower is the pits. First, it suffers from the Holiday Inn look. If you book with your SPG points, you will get placed in the cheaper Bay Tower, unless you complain. Rooms suffer from echos from the parking lot (design flaw - big time!). The Bay Tower also has rooms that overlook the bayside, but the road noise is loud, and every voice or music echos up to the balcony and into your room! Lacks minimal things like toothbrushes, robes, and slippers (not like other Sheratons I stayed at!). No refrig - unless you ask? Coffee maker did not work, minimal tea selection - cheap, cheap. Loud lobby area which looks cheap as well. I don't think they offer any upgrades for Gold/Platinum members since it appears all the rooms are the same. It's not worth the 10 K points, maybe 7k at most. The Marina Tower maybe better - well, at least looks better from the lobby/drive up area! If you are paying "big bucks", I would recommend looking elsewhere, but don't stay in the Bay tower!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service during the San Diego blackout”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: I was ASTOUNDED At the service and amenities the Property and the Service staff provided during the recent San Diego blackout. This was not a planned emergency - all of the sudden the power went out. The team at both locations were friendly, hospitable, went above and beyond to ensure the guests were taken care of (water at the front desk, glow sticks to help see, etc). They put out a buffet that was INCREDIBLE given the circumstances. When you have emergencies like this, you really see what the team is made of and the level of service that the hotel provides - and this one is TOP NOTCH!! Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KimDushinski
Reviews.Content: When the power outage hit San Diego I was in the airport and I did not want to sleep on the airport floor. Quite a few other people had the same idea and we all headed for the Sheraton. When we got there they had a generator powered up and the entry way was well lit to welcome us. Someone was handing out water bottles to the long line of people and assuring us they had room for us. Someone else quickly figured out that the Bay Tower had availability and took a bunch of us over there in the shuttle bus. The front desk staff was hand running credit cards and writing down the room numbers on a piece of paper. Every staff person was friendly and calm. Upon checking in we were handed glow sticks so we could find our way around. They told us they had a dinner buffet set up in the main hotel. Ever staff person there was working efficiently and with a smile on their face. The food was very good and the service was excellent. All this without electricity. It was obvious the hotel staff were prepared and trained for this kind of crisis. If they weren't they sure faked it well. I was so impressed with every staff person I encountered and want to thank them for making what could have been truly miserable, something quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Gpsswinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 nights whilst visiting San Diego. My wife and I live in England now, but she is born and raised in San Diego. Stayed in the Bay Tower as opposed to the main building, The Marina Tower, it was much quieter & all facilities from the main building are just a short stroll along the marina pathway. All aspects from housekeeping, dining to facilities were excellent. Be prepared to pay for parking $22 per day. This seems to be the norm throughout.

Reviews.Title: “I had the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lu28
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with my stay at this hotel. I loved our view, our room, the staff, the pool; I can't say enough good things. I got a great rate from priceline.com and it was worth every penny. I got this room for my boyfriend for his birthday and we had such such a memorable time. We sat out on our balcony, drank champagne and enjoyed the stunning view of the marina. The bed was incredibly comfortable and it was difficult to get out of bed in the morning to make it for the breakfast served up on the top floor at the club lounge. The pool next to the marina was very enjoyable and we even mosied over the hammock for a relaxing siesta. I would definately go back and recommend it to people visiting!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: westin_calgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business trip and EVERYONE's interaction with the guests was amazing. The hotel is in a great location with beautiful weather and a very nice bar by the harbor. The pool is great and the rooms are nice too... i didn't spent too much time in the room as i was enjoying th entire hotel and it's city every day till late night :). There are a lot of great food and in the hotel, there is a nice Starbucks that you can just relax and sitdown to enjoy. Overall great stay and thank you to Norbert H and his team to have made my stay awesome!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR LUGGAGE”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Sept 1 after waiting about 20 minutes in line. Went up to our room on the 6th floor & put the key in the door, opened right up, walked in & saw a laptop & luggage on the floor. We left the room immediately. We went downstairs & asked for a manager. They told us it'd be about 10 minutes and offered a front desk clerk offered to help. I explained what I concern was. What they did for me was "upgrade" me by giving me a room 1 floor higher & gave me free breakfast. I didnt want/need an upgrade, I wanted this to be noted & addressed by the manager, not to be 1 floor higher & offered the same breakfast 3 days in a row. Had I not already paid for the hotel through Priceline, I would not have stayed there. I made sure we left our valuables in the car. I will not be Priceline'ing a "4 Star" hotel in the SDdowntown area again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie52339
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is very inconvenient for activities. Sheraton should provide a shuttle to downtown area and other places, not just the airport. Unable to walk to anything and felt like they know that and therefore charge outrageous prices for drinks and foods. Room was just okay. Cleaning Service was extremely slow and hallways were not always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a break and received it. Thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Laxmanboiler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time with my wife and small children for an intended 5 day stay in San Diego to visit the tourist spots. Unfortunately, my kids became very ill the 2nd day of our stay so we needed to leave and head back to Los Angeles. The hotel was fantastic about our circumstance refunding the remaining days of our reservations with no penalty and allowing for a very late check out. Although I probably would select another hotel next time better suited for families, it was obvious that this is a very good business hotel and I will definately be returning. Also, a big thank you to Julia and Hayley for their great service on that troubling Friday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here. Huge disappointment!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AKA77056
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE BOOKING...... PROS: Good location if you want to be isolated from just about everything. Few restaurants near by but for most part downtown area I hear is better for lodging. Yes there was only one good thing about this hotel. CONs: Initally everything seem to be quite nice. Shuttle personel was wonderful. Check in was very slow. We walked up with two ppl in line waiting took about 45 mins to get to us. Wanted to get a service performed from spa only to find that they didn't have a full time employee on staff who could complete my request. I was livid... Had to attend the Marine graduation looking not up to par with my norms. The actual room was something you can see at a Motel 6( please no offense meant to that franchise). This goes for the hotel rooms in the Lanina side. The worse looking rooms I ever seen at a Sherton hotel. OMG please dont let me get on the pricing there. It is true they have a price on everything to have a refrigerated in your room of what you think is a 4 star hotel that cost is 15 bucks/ day to have handy. Prepostourus!!! THE HOTEL WILL NICKEL AND DIME YOU AS STATED IN OTHER REVIEWS. THEY PURPOSELY DO NOT HAVE VENDING MACHINES SO YOU ARE SOME WHAT FORCED TO DRINK FROM THE OVERLY OVER PRICED MINI BAR! JUST THINK IN THOSE LATE HOURS WHEN THE THIRST BUG HIT YOU YOU SHOULD MAKE SURE YOU HAVE EITHER A BOAT LOAD OF MONEY STASHED AWAY FOR THE MINI BAR OR STOCK UP ON YOUR FAVORITE NIGHT TIME SNACKS AND DRINKS BEFORE COMING BACK TO HOTEL PREMISES AND REMEMBER THAT FRIGs are 15 bucks/night to have in room!!! CRAZY RIGHT! same thing I said. The front desk associates (one for sure) was totally clueless about shuttle times etc. At this point I am boiling over! The ball was def dropped at this Sheraton! Please do not let the location fool you! At any rate we didnt have to pay for a couple of nights for all the aboved inconveniences!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Location just out of downtown. Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: stevefantana
Reviews.Content: stayed in the bay tower. Very close to airport and free shuttle available. Lovely helpful staff. From reception to hse keeping. Rooms lovely decorated and very spacious. A fridge in room would be a great addition. Nice pool and hot tub area. Larger bay tower facilities available to use to all guests. Five minute walk away. There is no bar and grill that is open all day in bay tower. Opens periodically in the evening. Bus stop is a ten min walk and its only ten minutes to downtown. 15$in a cab to downtown. The extras in this hotel are very expensive. Parking $20 per night,movies,mini bar etc. Removing points for no wifi in each room and the lack of a always open bar/grill. Wifi only available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Poor Service - Bay Tower”
Reviews.Author: csmirasol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bay Tower for a friend's wedding from August 25-28. First of all, they messed up the reservation I made through Hotels.com. I specifically requested the Bay Tower, but for some reason gave me the Marina Tower. Luckily, they were able to put me back in the Bay Tower. This also happened to my friend. The rooms themselves were clean & pretty spacious. They had nice views of the water and the marina. The service at this hotel was horrible. The night before I arrived, I called to ask if the workstations had MS Office. They could not provide an affirmative answer. Only after I tweeted SPG did I get a firm answer (which is "yes" by the way). Every time my friends would call the lobby, the phone would ring endlessly -- literally. Sometimes, they wouldn't answer. I also signed up for green service, meaning they don't clean your room unless you specifically ask. Well, on Friday night, after I got through to the lobby after at least 8 rings, they said they'd remove me from green service and get my room cleaned on Saturday. Well -- that certainly didn't happen. That was just me. My friend, who was getting married, had a cocktail hour at BTL, the lounge in the Bay Tower, on Friday night. They tried to close early on her because they were shorthanded and the bartender had to get home to attend to a personal matter. I feel sorry for the bartender, but this is my friend's wedding! They have the reception in this very hotel and have a bunch of family/friends staying here. Provide a little service! The Marina Tower pool area is much larger and nicer than the one at Bay Tower. If you like to run, there is a nice path right outside the Bay Tower right by the water that you can run. Overall, if you don't mind shoddy service, this hotel will do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, conveniently near airport, but hold onto your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: sactosource
Reviews.Content: The staff was welcoming, and the hotel was nice. The room was a great size with balcony, and overall a decent place to stay (there are 2 hotels and we were at the marina side). During the day it was a little loud, but this is to be expected being near the airport. My biggest gripe about the stay was being nickle & dimed for everything. Make sure to read the fine print! Two things to be aware of: 1) Not only are the items in the stocked fridge overpriced like usual, you will be charged a 20% stocking fee and taxes on top of the listed price. So a can of Coke listed at $4.50 is really $5.50. 2) It's pretty archaic to use anything other than your cell phone these days, but use the phone in your room at your own risk!!! My wife was feeling under the weather so she stayed in the room while I took my daughter to check out a college she is interested in attending this fall. My wife wanted to check on us but couldn't find her cell so she used the room phone instead...her 2 calls that went straight to voicemail cost us $30!!! I can definitely afford to pay the $35.50 here, but it's the way we were charged that doesn't sit well with me. Charging 12 pack prices for a single can of soda and feeling obligated to add a re-stocking fee and tax on top seems ridiculous. And although the card next to the phone says in small print that direct dialed calls will be charged AT&T operator assisted prices, they forgot to mention "bend over and look out!" But if you don't use the room phone and make sure to read all of the fine print, it was a decent place. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but we looked at the pool area and it looked nice and was clean. Although I wouldn't rule it out entirely, we probably won't be back and will check out another property next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bunny0016
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Sheraton Harbor Island using a coupon deal for one night. When we arrived at the main hotel, we were told we needed to go to a different tower down the street. I found that odd since the main part of the hotel is where all the restaurants and large pool is located. However; when we arrived at the Bay Tower we were greated by valet and proceeded to check-in. Our room was on the 9th floor close to the elevator overlooking the marina. I like to have a refrigerator I can use when I travel so I was disappointed the room only had a mini-bar. We were hungry but there was no restaurant in the tower so we walked a few yards to a deli down the marina. Our room had two double beds, nothing special and not very comfortable (in my opinion). The bathroom was small but when we requested extra towels they were delivered immediately. We spent the afternoon in our private cabana at the pool which was fantastic. The only issue I have is in talking with some children in the pool, found out they and their family of at least 12 people, were "pool crashers." Apparently that location is a regular spot for them! Later in the evening, we attended the Dive-in Movie at the pool which was fun. I thought the noise from the airplanes (right across the marina is SD airport) was very loud. Nothing special about the room. It was decorated in a nautical theme. I might stay here again but am concerned about the price especially since overnight parking is $30!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family!”
Reviews.Author: Malialyssa
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because of the positive comments we read and it did not disappoint! We were impressed with the spaciousness of the room and my daughters (5 and 3 years old) immediately went out on the balcony to check out the view. I recommend requesting the Marina view in the upper floors. The only downside to this stay is the cost of parking which is $22 per day or $30 for valet. Also, we were here during the weekday and found it difficult to find parking so I can't imagine how it would be on a busy weekend. Overall, it was a fun family trip...pool was nice, clean, and warm. They have a fitness room and small gameroom for table tennis and pool. Oh, forgot to mention that they give you an option to be "green" by opting out of getting room serviced in exchange for $5 voucher which we used for Starbucks...totally worth it since you can call housekeeping anytime for more towels or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't come back, but not all bad”
Reviews.Author: Trigirl92014
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided to book a last minute "staycation" in downtown San Diego for a night so we could enjoy some relaxation by the pool. We booked on priceline and got the Sheraton SD Hotel and Marine for $81, plux tax, approximately $95 - NOT BAD! If I had paid the $169 rate plus tax, this would have been 2 stars for my liking. Valet - very nice and quick, but $30. Seriously? Are we in NY or SF? You can self park for $22. Check-inand Room- Again very nice, but slow. Although, the girl was new. Because I am a Starwood preferred guest, we were upgraded to the 10th floor overlooking the Marina and the pool which was excellent. The room was adequate the balcony was wonderful. I loved waking up in the morning, reading the paper and sipping on coffee while the sun broke thru the morning cloud layer, truly a fabulous way to start the day! I will say it was a long walk to the ice machine and there were no robes (which is unusual for preferred rooms in most hotels) neither were a big deal. Pool - It was right on the bay and in my opinion beautiful. Not because the pool is that great, but because how can you not love being on a pool, with great weather and on the water? From a nine year old perspective, "it sucked". Although, he seemed to enjoy it from the first two hours. But, soon became bored because there was no deep water, slide or other attractions to keep him busy. There were mostly younger kids here, but for a one or two night vacation, perfectly adequate for any age. Pool side service - Was sporatic. It took about twenty minutes to get a menu (2pm) and another twenty to come back for our order. But, once we ordered, the food was very quick and the service was friendly and very accomodating. The food is a mixed bag, my sons pizza was $12 (I think) and was a medium cheese pizza which was way above the standard I am use to for hotel pizzas. He ate half for lunch and the other half for dinner. GREAT VALUE!!!! I ordered a a lemon drink which was awful, but I ordered it that way, so my bad. I was hungry and ordered the fish burrito which was terrible, I couldn't eat it. In all fairness, I was raised in SD and we are home of the Fish Taco, so I should have known better. Oh well. Game Room - Game room, hmmmm. Not exactly what we expected, but turned out ok. The "game room" was a room inside the gym that had a wii in it with not really anything games other than the standard package. Also, the parents need to be in the room supervisng the kids at all times (I get that), but wasn't really how I wanted to spend the day, so we moved on to upstairs. This was FABULOUS! My friend joined me at the bar for a glass of vino while my son played the complimentary Xbox with kids that were coming into the lobby (he was 10 feet from me). This entertained him for two hours and he made new friends. Tapatini Tapas & Martini Bar - I have mixed reviews on this. Scott was attentive and was good with all the clients. There seems to be a mix of regulars here which is nice. They come in for dinner and drinks from their boats. My one complaint which is HUGE is the food. Scott recommended the beef skewers, which I was not in the mood for. His second recommendation was the scallops. I should have known better not to order a scallop tapa from a hotel bar - dumb on me. The scallops were good size, 3 on the plate with I believe walnuts and currants on the bottom, a ton of them. It was super sweet, totally gross and the scallops were rubber. I took one bite, disgusting. But, I took a sip of wine and tried another small bite - even more disgusting. The scallops sat in front of me for an hour until I paid the check. Really? I put my napking over them and my fork and knife, isn't this a subtle enough hint to take them from me and maybe ask me if I want something else? Guess not. My son was having such a good time with one of his new friends I asked them if they would like dessert. They both ordered the apple tart and Hagan Daaz icecream. They were like $11 or $12 each. I'm find with that, but neither of them had more than a bite of the tart and said it was too much crust. I tasted it, yep, not awful, but definitely not worth the money. I didn't complain about that either. As long as my son is happy, I am happy! Here is the funny thing though - when I said it was time to go, neither the new friend or the friends dad thanked either Alec or I for the dessert or said goodbye.....really? Here is why I probably wouldn't stay at the hotel again, but only because I am addicted to my computer and the internet. No wi-fi in the rooms and you have to pay $11.95 to be tethered to the desk to get internet there. The positive is it is absolutely free downstairs and it is very good and a wonderful seating area that even provides computers. If you are on vacation here, this should not be a drawback. Overall, service is 4 stars, food is 1 star and location 3. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and view, somewhat isolated”
Reviews.Author: Calalily7
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at the Sheraton--the clip they had on their website where they were featured on the Today show made the place look fantastic. We were a little disappointed, though. Our first room was so far away from the lobby, and we had a baby and all our gear to haul. The room itself seemed a little shabby. The pool areas, view of the marina, and the grounds were very nice, though. Our second room was easier to get to and had a better view. We had to wait in line for quite awhile to check in/out and it seems they could have used more staff. I did like their on-site laundry facility and computers/printer/internet access. Overall, I thought the place was a bit pricey for the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Family Oriented”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: This was your typical Sheraton. Seemed to be more geared towards families. I was upgraded to a nice room but I could hear everything from the hallway and from the room next to me...not just muffled noises but their actual conversations. The bed was comfortable and I had a nice view of the pool. There was a Starbucks on-site, as well as, a free shuttle to the airport. That was a nice touch for my morning trip back to the airport. Overall, I'd say this was a typical Sheraton but due to the issues with noise, I will likely not stay here again. There are some fantastic hotels in the Gaslamp Quarter of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: steve63
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4ngts as part of a California vacation. Initial thoughts were it was too far out but soon realised that this was very much a positive thing and that the hotel is actually central to all the major tourist attractions as you really need a car to do all. We booked the Club Level which I would highly recommend. You get a beautiful room on the top floor with amazing views which ever side of the hotel you are on. You also get access to the Club Lounge giving complimentary contintental breakfast. Free bottles of water, snacks, free Internet access and printing. Our room was very close to the airport but had excellent soundproofing so we were not disturbed by it. Hotel feels and looks clean and contemporary with a nautical theme present. Pool also nice but no shade so didn't use. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Overall excellent value for money and would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “paul t”
Reviews.Author: paul t
Reviews.Content: On family holiday driving through California and passing San Diego for a few nights decided to try Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina as recommended whilst staying at a Westin hotel. Booked through Expedia and just a couple of points as I thought it was one hotel from the photos on the Sheraton and Expedia websites. On arriving at the marina tower 1380 Harbour Island Drive was advised we were booked (and had booked) in the Bay tower passing Carbrillo Isle Marina 1450 H I Drive. On arriving at the bay tower little dissappoined, as I viewed it as a different hotel , about 400 metres plus entrance to entrance bay tower to the marina tower. Booked deluxe room, but I found to be ordinary type room. Bay tower only 12th floor are suites. Buffet breakfast very ordinary in the Bay tower. Also should have checked fees as 22 dollars per day parking, close to airport and informed by reception car park run by different company to Sheraton and fees not negotiable for those staying at hotel (cost me 66 dollars). Good location for old town. I'll give Sheraton a miss on my next visit to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: debnath
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at this hotel for 1 night, it was an amazing experience.The hotel is very close to the airport and the views are awesome. Select a room with a city, marina and a bay view and watch the view from a higher floor. The hotel staff are friendly and this is undoubtedly one of the best hotels we have stayed in recent times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay....”
Reviews.Author: ChiBri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located near the airport and within a quick cab ride to the downtown area.. the hotel and staff were all great.. the grounds were beautiful and in true Sheraton fashion, the beds were truly the best.. we dined in both the restaurant (for breakfast) and the buffet was so fresh and good.. also, we were part of a conference and the food served there was top notch... i would totally recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego..

Reviews.Title: “Decent SD Hotel near airport and marina. Beware of extras!”
Reviews.Author: JC_Cangilla
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Marina is a decent property--know that is a large hotel, with two towers and a Lanai building-think lots of guests, weddings, events and two packed pools. Location is great--very close to downtown and the Gaslamp, also very convenient to Point Loma and even Sea World in Mission Beach/Bay. We were upgraded by the friendly SPG front desk to the Lanai property. Our ground room had a nautical motif--room was adequate, seemed clean and we had a small (dirtier) patio. There was no wireless internet in our Lanai room. Beds were comfortable; room was slightly loud--our unrelated connecting room had some loud moments. Room service meal was good, came quickly and overall staff was attentive. One thing to warn potential visitors: we did incur numerous extra charges. Internet was ~$20 per day per device. Thus, with two computers and logging in both days (via hardline ethernet), charges were over $80 incremental to our room rate. Throw in $22/day self-parking fee, a decent but overpriced restaurant, and good, fast room service (and a late-night minibar $16 beer), our extras doubled our room rate. Obviously, not specifically the hotel's fault: they were clear about these fees up-front. But, if price is a factor and you have certain expectations of how you stay at hotels, then consider these extras. Overall, a decent hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: quil59
Reviews.Content: I attended some business meetings here and this hotel was by far one of the best I have stayed at. The location is great and views are pitcure taking. Service was impeccable. There always seemed to be someone greeting us in the lobby which was a nice touch. Rooms were clean and well kept. I'm hoping that our company books San Diego as a business meeting again so we can stay there soon. Great job all around!

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque resort in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sdflyer
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for the Americas Finest City Half Marathon and 5k Run and had a room on the ninth floor of the Marina Tower. The room was clean, nice and decorated in a nautical theme. Harbor Island, Point Loma, the marina and the airport could be seen from the balcony. The hotel is very convenient, located adjacent to downtown and the airport. The hotel staff is friendly and courteous. The hotel grounds are nicely maintained and landscaped and the pool areas are very inviting. The only thing I did not like was the $20 charge for parking. The hotel has facilities for conventions. It was the host hotel for the marathon expo and also had other events at the time so it was very busy. After paying the $20 parking fee, were had much difficulty finding a parking spot, day and night. Other than the parking hassles, this is definitely a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too loud!”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Took the family to see the sights of San Diego. If you don't mind the roar of the highways and planes, it's ok. Also $22 a night to self-park your own car? Outrageous....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location...”
Reviews.Author: joharala
Reviews.Content: I was initially surprised that we were so far away from the heart of San Diego. Turns out our location was great. Everything we needed was on the property, and just a mile away was an entire shopping center with Trader Joe's and plenty of little restaurants. The kids loved their choices of pools too. The hotel restaurant was outrageously delicious. My complaint would be that the rooms did not feel so clean. I noticed there were dogs in other rooms and our carpet felt a bit dirty. I did not allow my kids to sit on the floor. Also the restroom had some issues, which the hotel plumber was fixing for quite some time. The hotel was nice enough to compensate us slightly, but it was still a little gross and inconvenient. Overall, I think it's at a wonderful location and I would go back in a heartbeat. The views were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: CarloLivorno
Reviews.Content: What can I say of a place where, from the very beginning to the end, everything was absolutely perfect? We stayed for 5 nights after a wonderful bargain booking made last april with Expedia. We were in the club lounge at the 12 floor with the possibility to have a great buffet breakfast and an every afternoon Hors d'oeuvre. The room (double queen) was clean and comfortable for a party of four like us (with two young kids) and the view from it gorgeous over the Bay and the pool. The pool is also a plus and really relaxing with its spa. We really enjoyed our stay and we'd like to be there again sooner or later. The only thing I can say could have been better.....is that maybe 20 dollars a day for the parking it's a bit expensive......

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: jmathew22
Reviews.Content: The first room I got was on the ground floor. When I went on the balcony to work, I found it littered with garbage. I requested another room. This one faced the marina and was nicer. Other issues: - On several occasions, I was unable to reach anyone at the front desk. - For early risers, you should know that the restaurant only opens at 6:30. - The morning staff at the restaurant weren't very friendly. And they didn't appear to be too happy to be there.

Reviews.Title: “not for the price”
Reviews.Author: rnmnc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 days here and were underwhelmed.No perks to speak of.A very basic room with minimal towels,soaps,shampoos,etc. If you left a half used bottle of shampoo or soap they would not replace it until it was gone.We actually hide the toiletries in our suitcases so they would replace them for the next day. Everything was extra.The newspaper was added to the bill even if you didn't want it.There was only 1 free hour of internet use and then internet use was charged to your bill.But the biggest ripoff was the parking.they charged 30 dollars a day for parking.and there was nowhere else to park(no on street parking available) . The bathroom fixtures were all rusted at the connections and half the rooms light fixtures were not working.All in all,not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Lynn7691
Reviews.Content: Room and furniture in room was very small, no safe, not enough towels supplied for a family of 4, had some sent up then would forget again next day, so therefore had to ask 3 times. The location was ok albeit a little near to the airport next door, but the beautiful marina made up for that. Wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with good customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: Generally we stay away from larger hotels as often they lack the personal touch, but that was not the case with The Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. Friendly front desk reception, reservation, good maid service & attentive restaurant wait staff. Rooms are nicely decorated and were clean. We did have an issue with a sheet, but called room service and they responded immediately. Common areas of the hotel are well kept, the grounds were beautifully landscaped, nice view of the harbor and yachts, clean and inviting pools. Hotel location is good, near airport, car rentals and near to downtown. Close to harbor areas, beaches, Old Town, Gaslamp District, I-5. If you have a car you will need to use hotel parking, either self parking or valet, from $22-$28 daily rates. Otherwise you will need to rent a car or take taxi. Public transporation is not close. No stores, shops and restaurants within walking distance but hotel does have several good restaurants including a Starbucks. Hotel is quiet and relaxing and we enjoyed our stay and were not disappointed in our choice. We would recommend this hotel and would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a "5", and Dog Friendly, too!”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: We drove to San Diego for a few days, and we brought our well behaved spaniel. Simply a perfect place for a getaway. We had a wonderful view of the harbor, and an extremely comfortable room with a king-sized bed. We paid the extra $40/day Club Fee; well worth it for the view from the 12th floor, the quiet, and especially the club access--free breakfast buffet (not cooked), free hors d'oeuvres in the evenings, free water bottles and free internet access. The area is right across from the airport but surprisingly quiet, and there are beautiful walking paths all around the harbor for a happy dog to enjoy with her family. Our only negatives are the $22.00/day parking fee (apparently average for the area) and the fact that they Locked Up the Walkways in the evening, (a security issue?) so after the pleasant evening walk, you have to walk twice as far just to get back in. All-in-all, a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: DKins
Reviews.Content: Sheraton wasn't terrible, and probably a great deal if you have kids, but we won't be back. Housekeeping service was uneven-one night we returned to find no soap refills. Another night we returned to find no coffee refills. These were too minor to complain about, but definitely a deterrent to returning. Room was in the bay tower, with a view of the hotel lobby. We would have complained if we weren't out sight-seeing most of the day. Front light in the room's foyer didn't ever work. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable (even for two people with different body types and bed preferences), and the room's AC never operated correctly. We woke up every night to turn it down further, after kicking off the blankets, but it never cooled down enough. Shower was incredibly small, even for a tub/shower combo. We have a standard size at our apartment, and this was perceptibly smaller. Housekeeping apparently washed around our items on the sink, rather than removing from the sink area, washing, then replacing. Front desk didn't pick up for several minutes when we called at 10 pm for a wake up call. One of us is a Hilton Diamond member and was unpleasantly surprised by the front desk never asking how the stay was going or how the room was at checkout--which is standard for Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BN98
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton San Diego on the Harbor and it was not worth it. Everything was overpriced (bottle of water in the gift shop was $4, omlet at their restaurant was $17, parking was $30/night). Since we didn't have a rental car, we felt isolated. There is nothing around there but the harbor. The only decent restaurant on the island itself is Island Prime / C Level (which is about a mile walk from the hotel). We were unable to take a taxi since we had a 6 month old. I rented a car for each day that we wanted to travel somewhere, then returned it the same night to avoid paying the $30 parking fee (zoo and sea world). The room was decent, but the goose down in the pillows and bedspread were shedding everywhere, creating dust in the room. We had a nice view from our balcony of the harbor. If you don't have a car, I suggest the gaslamp district. If you're more into Sea World, then stay around mission bay.

Reviews.Title: “Kids LOVED this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jandjfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3-story non-tower rooms and was pleasantly surprised. I guess if I didn't have a beautiful view of the Marina it would not have been so nice. Mind you, our last stay in San Diego was at the Hyatt Mission Bay. The rooms were clean however wish the beds were queens vs. full size. My 8 and 6 year olds LOVED the pool and nightly movie. They also loved the WII room in the fitness room which was a nice touch because it allows parents to workout while the kids are safely playing in the WII room. Kids also played ping pong and pool. There is also a nice walking trail along the Marina. Although we didn't do any water activities, it was all there conveniently located on the Marina. We did do the Pirate Adventure Tour and would recommend it to families with young children. Cost was $30/adult and $26/kids. We are Starbucks addicts so we loved the on-site location. We ate at the breakfast buffet and it was actually pretty good except NO pancakes or waffles, which my kids were disappointed with. Otherwise, a nice selection. The free internet access area was great providing guests free use of about 10 computers with big computer screens. Overall, my family really enjoyed our stay here and would definately choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: IsraelSue1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We got two connecting double rooms and both rooms were very spacious for our family of five. The rooms were clean and well equiped and the view across the Marina was fantastic. We ate breakfast at a small cafe on the water front just under the hotel which was very good value. The hotel is VERY close to the airport but we did not hear any noise from there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Sugar Sweet Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night 8/17/11. Our building was the Bay Tower. Check in was quick and easy. Staff was very friendly. Our room was beautiful, clean, large and over looked the San Diego Bay. Our room had two comfortable queen beds,4 feather pillows, large flat screen TV, desk, extra comfy side chair,and coffer maker with Starbucks coffee. We had a patio with table and chairs. We checked out the pool, small but clean and lots of lounge chairs. Across the street nice sidewalk beside the bay for a long walk was great. This hotel is close to downtown for great shopping and restaurants but not to close for to much traffic. I will recommend this hotel to our friends and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: 911SC
Reviews.Content: Booked here for two nights. Arranged a club room but wasnt entirely sure we got one as it wasnt on the club floor and we had to ask twice for confirmation of the club lounge detail/arrangements. Big luxurious and very busy with holiday makers and conference guests in full turnout. Although hard to find real fault, we didnt really enjoy this hotel. Found the restuarants and bars very expensive and the staff not particularly helpful. Location mixed. You cant walk into town from here and next time we'd pick a hotel which is closer. That said, we did go sailing on a yacht in the harbour and the Sheraton was ideal for that. VERY close to the airport but to be fair we didnt hear noise. Very plush but lacks the personal touch

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graf1
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three year old for three nights. We ended up originally in the marina tower and decided to switch to the lanai section. I know some reviewers didn't lime this section but we loved it. We had a wonderful view of the water and were right next to the Pools but the best part was no elevators to deal with which was a treat with a three year old. Room was super comy and nicely decorated. Starbucks was right there which I liked. The only thing I didn't live was the cost of parking but the service and everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nursejenny37
Reviews.Content: Just returned August 16th, all in all this hotel is good not quite up to the Sheraton standard though, the rooms are clean the bathroom could use a fan, and it would have been nice to have a fridge in the room, the beds were comfortable . We had a room in the Marina tower which is the bigger of the two towers we had a room facing the city/Airport which at first I thought might be an issue (noise from Airport) but actually it was not an issue you do hear airport noise whilst sitting on the balcony but when you close the door you don’t hear anything, the walls had good sound insulation which is good because I’m a light sleeper and I did not experience any problems. Food is fairly expensive here we booked a package through Allegiant Air and received breakfast free everyday which was great you had the choose of buffet or menu breakfast it was good, we ate in the bar once food was ok! There are no restaurants close to the hotel so if you don’t eat at the hotel you would have to go downtown which is a 10 minute drive away, if you don’t have a car like us you can take the hotel shuttle to the airport then take the bus to downtown a little inconvenient but it worked. The pool is very nice lots of chairs to lounge around on they do have a pool bar which is convenient the staff do walk around to take orders, I found the food here a little greasy for my liking. The hotel does have lots of conferences here but it did not affect us to much they have a big conference centre so they are really well take care of over their own side of the hotel. The hotel front desk staff we found to be very unfriendly it seemed like they were going out of their way to help us, on the over hand housekeeping went out of their way to help you and were very friendly even though English was clearly their second language. Parking your car here is expensive $25 a night and more for valet parking however most hotels charge the same rates. It would have been nice if they had a shuttle that took you to the downtown area where you can pick up a bus or the trolley system which is very easy to get around on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms - BUT -”
Reviews.Author: sleepy2l
Reviews.Content: Check-in was 3 pm, BUT - we could not get into our rooms until after 5. They said it was not yet cleaned. Door to mini-bar was ajar and nothing was cold. I reported this right away, but nothing was done about it and they still tried to charge us on our final bill. Appears this hotel is understaffed although rooms are beautifully appointed. Very near the airport and if plane noise bothers you, I would stay at another Sheraton as there are several in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Some pros and some cons”
Reviews.Author: maxmanmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The hotel seems to be able to handle a large number of guests; there were 1,000 present at the conference and also some little league baseball teams. The lobby, business center, and fitness center never seemed crowded, but the Starbucks had long lines and the pub restaurant was busy, understaffed, and hot. I stayed in the Marina Tower. Check-in service was prompt, courteous, and friendly. I can say the same for the parking valet and concierage. My room was very clean and comfortable.The bed was great, and room service was reliable. Unfortunately I was unable to get a room with much of a view, but the 5th floor was quiet and I was never bothered by noise from the airport or other quests. Also, the conference facilities were great with prompt attention from the tech team. So on the plus side--very nice room, clean and quiet, and overall wonderful service. Now, the cons--as noted by other reviewers--the hotel is isolated. If you want to see San Diego, you will need to rent a car, and if you rent a car, you will have to pay the outrageous (in my view) parking fees--$22 per day for self park, $28 for valet. I would prefer to stay some place where I could walk to restaurants and shopping. Secondly, in-room internet is costly, although wi-fi is free in the lobby. Finally, the food and drinks in the on site restaurants were mediocre and way over priced, and the restaurants and bar always seemed to be understaffed. I spent two nights checking out restaurants in the Gaslight District. I would recommend taking a cab rather than driving, as parking was scarce and very $$$. Also, the evening scene there is not very family friendly. Try Fred's for Mexican or one of the reasonably priced Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Three Star”
Reviews.Author: Brad1962
Reviews.Content: This is an old tired property that tries to pass as a 4 star hotel. The Lanai Building portion of this property offers a two star experience. Seriously, the folks at Starwood need to downgrade to a lesser brand and lower the rates. On the positive side, the staff was friendly and helpful and the lobby was well appointed. The problem is the room, hall ways, elevators look and feel like a Motel 6. If you are paying less than $100, then you are getting value for your money. There are much better options closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient location.”
Reviews.Author: Mluca9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 minutes from the airport and free shuttle service is provided which was a big plus considering we had our toddler. The property is amazing, we had an awesome view of the marina. The beds are first class, very comfortable and the restrooms are spic and span.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Heather4CU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton because an annual conference I attend had booked this place. It was not out of choice. The rooms did NOT have wifi. I verified this w people in both towers there for my conference. The hotel is also out of the way unless you have a car and then the parking card readers are shotty. When you call the valet for help you get an attitude as if the issue is your fault. Icing on the cake for me was finding my room door left open by housekeeping the final day there. When I spoke to the GM about that and my broken faucet he told me my bill would be adjusted. Not so much. Love San Diego but next time I will be at the Hyatt or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “No Redeeming Qualities”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrvlr300
Reviews.Content: Check-in took 45 mins., then my room wasn't ready at check-in time, was offered a room in another bldg. "right next door" or a two-hr. wait for my room. The bldg. "next door" is actually about 1/2 mile away and has very limited services, internet service is really poor and only available in certain parts of the hotel, no pool, no coffee shop (when I asked about a Starbucks in the bldg. they referred me to the in-room coffee). There is a shuttle between the main hotel and the satellite hotel......but it takes you to the main hotel via the airport!! Very poor service all-round and obvious it starts with the management. By the way, this hotel is right next to the airport so you will need earplugs if you still decide to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary get away.”
Reviews.Author: zumbadancer
Reviews.Content: This trip was a gift from our children and spouses for our 40th Wedding Anniversary. Don't let our age bracket influence you in a negative way. We saw all different ages that stayed here and everyone seemed to be smiling. The room was large and very clean. No complaints at all. The Sheraton is about one mile from the airport and consists of two separate buildings, a five minute walk between them. We were told upon arrival by a cab driver that the Marina building was for the younger crowd and the Bay Tower building was a little more relaxed. The only complaint we had was the Starbucks was in the "other" building. We didn't rent a car the first two days. By the third day, we rented a car as the cab rides were getting expensive. There's a lot to keep you occupied: Old Town, Balboa Park, Coronado Island, USS Midway, San Diego Zoo, Littly Italy for dinner, Boat rides, Seaport Village to people watch and coastal drives. Oh, and Tijuana. Keep an open mind and enjoy the vitality there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families. No good for Business”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average. The pool and view are super and the rooms recently visitied. Howver, the TV in my first room did not work and it took 45 minutes to switch rooms. The gym is SMALL compared to the size of the hotel so very crowded. The bar/restaurant is average. Service is decent but food was average. Internet is $18 and self prking is $22. I would not stay here again unless my children were with me.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Otis F
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Location is superb and it is easy to get any where from here. Views are great. Conference facilities were more than adequate. Service was exceptional. I must also say that the employees working in valet were always very efficient and were very helpful in letting us know an easier way to get to some of the sites we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding”
Reviews.Author: KarenH92807
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline.com for $85.00 per night. When we arrived, the parking attendent checked his list and we were told to go down the street to the Sheraton "Bay View" to check in. Right away, I was dissappointed as I wanted to stay at the Sheraton "Resort" with nice pools and a marina to walk around. Since I belonged to their points club, the desk agent gave us an upgrade to a higher story room where the views (which were absolutely beautiful) would be better. It's a good thing that the patio had chairs as the room itself was a dive. Barely a 2 star place. Upholstered sofa and two chair/hassocks were stained and filthy, the aircondition duct was hanging down from the ceiling, walls so thin I could hear the people in the room above us going to the bathroom. Self-Parking was $28.00 per day; Valet was $32.00 WiFi was $17.00 per day. THe next day when checking out, I wanted to speak to the Manager - unfortunately, another desk agent told me that all the management people were housed at the "Resort" The best thing was Deana at the front desk - a real people person with excellent skills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, service needs refinements”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDawg78
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we got to the hotel early and we didn't really expect our room to be ready yet. They offered to call us when it was ready but we waited to 3PM, check-in time, and there was no call. Back to the long line at the desk. Long since there was only one person waiting on guests checking in. In fact, we rarely saw more than one or two people at the reception desk, therefore there was always a long line of tired travelers. Our room was still not ready so we were given a room with the city view, which is very nice but faces the airport and freeway so is substantially noisier. Back to the line for another 10-15 minute wait. Can we wait for our original room, we ask? There was no record of our original request. Okay, so we head out for dinner, the parking gate was not working properly. Back to the line. They explained there's something wrong with the computers and to just use the assistance button at the gate. Later after dinner, can't get into our room. Back to the line.
