If you are willing to get up and walk the to the other building, you can use their nice pool and their spa and their large gym and their pool table and their ping-pong tables and their fountains and their aquarium and their beautiful wood panelled lobby and their in-house Starbucks and their sculptures and their artworks ... but if not, you get the lame pool, no spa, a gym with old equipment, and a white no-frills utilitarian lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: LittleLee234
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and that was enough. From the start of our arrival the parking was a nightmare. Checking in was a bit long but quick when we finally got up to the counter. Our first room was on the 4th floor on the end over looking the jacuzzi. The room was large but that is all the goods things I have to say about it. There was a huge red stain on the carpet when we walked in. The people in the room next to us were so loud we could just about hear their whole conversation. I called the front desk and requested to be moved. They told us the hotel was sold out. So I decided to take a towel from the bathroom to close the gap under the door that adjoined the rooms. There was a huge black hair on the towel so once again I called and requested to be moved. They told us to come back to the front desk and they would have another room for us. Our second room was on the 3rd floor and we had a lovely view of the parking lot. The room was much smaller than our first. We immediately noticed there was black hair all over the bathroom floor. We had problems with the shower working correctly and had more water coming out the faucet than we did the shower head. It took a good 10 minutes for the shower to drain before the next person could shower. We were unable to find the TV remote, after calling the front desk it took them 30 minutes to bring us a new one at 1:30AM. To top things off a car alarm starting going off at 5AM. Needless to say this was the worst hotel experience. I booked the room through priceline which was the first mistake. They were not helpful in resolving the issues after we returned home and said there was nothing they could do. I've emailed the hotel and no response. I was given the name and number for Riquel and have called and left her 3 messages with no response. There are plenty of other hotels close to the San Diego Airport and I would caution you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, great variety on club floor food, extremely attentive staff, with plenty of walking paths.”
Reviews.Author: KateChristie
Reviews.Content: I was on the club floor with marina views for one stay and on a high floor with city and bay views on my second stay in October. Great bartender in small tapas bar who can mix truly classic cocktails. Very reasonable rates for our small goup meeting. Excellent lunch during our board meeting.

Reviews.Title: “It was an Awesome weekend at the Sheraton Marina Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hector99_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a very wonderful weekend at the Sheraton Marina. The Staff was great and catered to our every need. The activity facilities were well kept and very accessable. At night we walked the grounds and took in the beauty of the city and the surrounding harbor. The dinning was pleasant and the food wonderful. Thank you Sheraton for providing such a great service and creating some cherished memories. Sincerely Yours, Hector Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views, awesome pool and food.”
Reviews.Author: emoshenko
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Sheraton. Perfect location for all the site seeing we did. Yummy food at the hotel and great restaurants around the area. My son loves planes so we could occassionally see planes flying by without the noise I would have thought there would be. They also had a great breakfast buffet and the kids ate free! Now that is a great deal! We loved playing at the pool. We had wished there would have been service still at the pool for drinks and food. Overall we loved our stay at the hotel. Fun memories with a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “far from enchanting and a trap for folks without rental cars”
Reviews.Author: tbs82478
Reviews.Content: the hotel has two towers: the nice "marina" tower and the stepchild "bay" tower, a five minute walk between the two. the hotel is a cab ride from everything, poorly appointed and has minimal ammenities. twice, i've stayed here for a conference held in the marina tower. both times, I booked the conference tower and was - without any notice - moved to the bay tower. so I have to either hoof it to the marina tower or wait 15 minutes for a shuttle. not ideal and not what I reserved. customer service when I complained about the switch today I got a "we're sorry" and the manager tried to shift the blame to me for not booking with the conference block. no offer for free in-room internet or anything else. when I tried to order delivery for dinner, I found there was no directory of delivering restaurants and no phone book. I got a phone book and made some calls but no one delivered to this location. upon calling the front desk to request options, I was told to go online. (she assumed I was paying $12/day for in-room internet). when I explained I had no internet, she told me to come to the lobby and use their computer. really? ammenities 1 vending machine in the whole hotel, overpriced mini-bar or over-priced gift shop. you can't walk to anything so they have you at their mercy. "free wifi" in the lobby? yeah, but only an hour and you have to agree to pay for overtime when signing in. wifi in room? nope, but you can pay $12/day for wired service. bottom line if you've got a car, you might be fine here. if you're walking, you'll feel trapped and taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: tll3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and have to say it was one of the nicest stays I've had in San Diego over my last 8 years of visiting there monthly on business. Ive stayed in a little nicer hotels but the customer service and staff far out weight the luxuries of a very select few I have visited. I cant say enough about the staff, managers, waiters, and bartenders at this hotel. Its hard to find a hotel staff who treat you like your on vacation as cater to your every need. Keep up the good work and ill be back soon and suggest you to all my traveling companions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay... could be better”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: My stay here was just fine. It was not great it was not horrible. I can say what I did not like most about this hotel was the fact that it does not have wireless in the room. What year is it? Seriously.... wireless should be standard in all business hotels. The room was fine... it was not bad, it was not amazing. The location, while has some great views... is so far away from the city. Its not within walking distance of anything... beyond the airport. The gym was really nice and the pool looked great. Would I stay here again... it all depends. If my event was at the hotel, I guess I would stay here again. Thus I say I would recommend this hotel. However, would I choose to stay here again, no.

Reviews.Title: “Two Hotels, One Name”
Reviews.Author: vamktpro
Reviews.Content: I was a bit confused when reading reviews for this hotel prior to my trip. My hope is to ease this confusion with my review and photos posted. The Sheraton is actually two hotels, one call Marina and one called Bay. They each have separate check in desks, separate parking lots and separate facilities. The hotels are connected by a sidewalk that takes an adult walking quickly 6-7 minutes from one location to the other. The Marina appears to be the newer of the two and offers upgraded facilities. The pool, whirlpool and fitness room are far superior to the Bay hotel. This hotel fronts a very upscale marina. pricing for items like food reflect this. Saturday brunch was $19 pp, more in line with upscale hotel pricing but delivering basic offerings. The airport is just across the street, convenient but also noisy from 6am-9pm. The Bay hotel offers larger rooms, but is a more sterile and noisy inside. Make sure to get a room viewing the bay not the airport. Stayed five nights and prefer the marina location. Self parking at $22 is another way to get more money from guests. It is not well guarded at the Bay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: superstorm
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 yr old to San Diego the last week of June and stayed at this hotel. Hotel is adequately furnished. The hotel staff was excellent, always accommodating and helpful. We requested a refrigerator to store my son's milk, etc. It was promptly provided. A couple of months later the hotel charged my c/c for the fridge and removed it once I complained that a charge was never communicated to me. Very happy with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandomTravels123
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that will nickel and dime you to death than this place is for you. $18 a day for in room internet access is robbery, hell Motel 6 offers free in room internet. Sure you can use their "Internet Lounge" in the lobby for free if you don't mind the lack of privacy when trying to conduct sensitive business matters. No in room refrigerator, oh sure they could bring me one for $15 a day; wow the operating cost might be all of .50 cents a day, what a joke. Let’s talk mini bar, I know only the truly desperate use these things but $4 for 4oz bag of pretzels, $24 for mini bottle of wine, really? If you bring a car they will be charging you $28 a day to park it there, insane. My room did have a nice view if you don't mind the sliding door rattling from who knows what all night. I fixed that with the notepad from the desk stuffed in between the sliders, nice. You may be wondering if I notified the staff, well no they probably would have wanted $ to look at it and the note pad was the only free thing in the room. When I made my reservation I requested a king bed (traveling with my wife) but when we got to the room it had 2 twins. I called the front desk to ask for room with a king and was told they are all booked but should have something the next day and they would call me to get me into a different room, needless to say I never got a call oh well probably would have wanted more money for that as well. I had a standard room where I got a conference rate of $200 a night (regular rate of the street is around $250) There is absolutely no way I would pay that if I was making the trip on my own dime. One last thing, if don’t mind taking a cab everywhere you go or taking the hotel shuttle to the airport to catch a city bus than you would be happy with the location because there is absolutely nothing within walking distance of this place. You’ve been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: baracegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Priceline and have to admit that I was somewhat hesitant after reading other reviews. However, I found my stay in the Bay Tower at the San Diego Sheraton to be extremely pleasant. All staff members were friendly and helpful. I had a room in the Bay Tower looking out to the bay. The view from my balcony was incredible and the room was nice and the bed extremely comfortable. Steve in the Bay Tower Lounge was great as was Lucia who I saw each morning in the Bay Tower restaurant while I was having breakfast. Both these employees are definitely an asset to Sheraton. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I visit San Diego on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: fullvan
Reviews.Content: We came in for drinks at the Tapatini bar and had a great time! The service provide by Scott at the bar was impeccable and the variety of cocktails was fantastic. We even had a couple of the appetizers which were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: Campedo
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina, recently during the American Society of Anesthesiology conference. I didn't get to spend too much time at the hotel or in the room due to my commitment with the annual conference, but I do have to say that I was very pleased with my stay. I liked my room very much. It was very nice and comfortable. My view of the San Diego harbor was superb. It made me miss living in California. Also, it was a very easy and convenient shuttle ride to and from the hotel. On my last night, before leaving back to Miami, I stopped at the Tapatini bar inside the hotel's lobby. I met a very friendly and personable bartender by the name of Scott. I got to talking with him for a while and I was very impressed by his recommendations of appetizers, tapas and specialty martini's they offered. I really had no idea that they offered such delicious drinks and food at this fun and reasonably lively bar. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay there in San Diego at the Sheraton Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Had to contact the front desk three times before we were moved to a decent room.”
Reviews.Author: lydwalker
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here for our anniversary. We got it through priceline, which we've used before with great results. We were very disappointed with our room. It smelled like smoke, there were cigarettes on the porch, one of the paintings had been ripped off of the wall, the sheets were stained and it looked like the room hadn't been cleaned in a long time. I called the front desk and explained the situation. I was told the hotel was at capacity and they didn't have another room we could stay in. My husband and I sat in the nasty room for a while debating whether or not to stay there. We decided that we would rather stay somewhere else. I called again and was transferred to a department that wasn't even open that day and got a recording stating that I should leave a message. I was really mad at that point and called on last time before going to the front desk in person. Finally this woman helped us and magically found a decent room (what happened to being at capacity?). This fiasco wasted almost two hours of our time. The hotel is really outdated, the fitness room isn't great and the "spa" is a joke. There are much better hotels in town for about the same price. I wouldn't stay at this Sheraton ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Husky69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Marina Tower [more convenient, in my opinion, to the hotel's services, including its airport shuttle, than the Bay Tower] for 2 nights 10/15/10 and 10/16/10; beautiful views of Downtown from the small but adequate balcony. Room was clean and had all the amenities needed, but not luxurious. Common areas of the hotel are nicely decorated, and the staff at check-in was quite cheerful. One plus is the free airport shuttle, which one can use to connect with Metro bus 992 to get downtown. One note: since the hotel is isolated on a small spit of land [the marina], there are no restaurants within walking distance, which the Sheraton's restaurants capitalize on [high prices], so expect to pay $16 for a hamburger or $38 for an ala carte strip steak.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location for an anniversary travel.”
Reviews.Author: PattyJake
Reviews.Content: Every staff member provided perfect service while we stayed the weekend of our anniversary. The front desk staff member surprised us by providing wine and dessert in our room to promote our anniversary stay. The hotel is located with 3 miles of the Gas Lamp area and near many wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Amenities, Great Location and the Best Customer Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: dianesocialworker
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called for reservations, I felt like the staff were good friends . They strived to please us, and demonstrated above and beyond customer service. Our guest service agent, Roseann Schaefer, listened to my requests and needs for accomodations due to a recent illness and major surgery. She is awesome, and the best guest service agent we ever talked with ever! I will come back to this hotel just because of her! That's how great she was to us! She upgraded our room and had a fruit plate delivered to us upon check in! Every employee we encountered during our stay was so friendly and helpful. The concierge happily answered questions and offered to arrange for rental car, provide tickets to attractions at a discounted price. We have never encountered such excellent customer service at any other hotel ever, and we frequently travel! Way to go, Sheraton! The fitness center is a dream come true, with top notch new, smooth Life Fitness machines. This is our fav hotel in San Diego, and we will return again and again. Thank you, Sheraton, for a wonderful stay, beautiful views, comfy accomodations, super staff and great location! Don't miss the all the yacht lights reflecting on the water at night! Stunning view from the balcony at night in the Marina Tower. We're already planning another trip here! Hint--request the Marina Tower with views of the bay and marina. Views are great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we ever stayed at with the best customer service.”
Reviews.Author: nygalt
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son in SanDiego and chose to stay at this hotel. The great service started with Lauren the consierge who helped us get the rental that we wanted. It seems that the rental agency we went with didn't have the car we reserved. Lauren was terrific in getting us a car. The second person that made our stay awesome was Julia at the front desk , our stay was actually in two parts and she booked the second part (with upgrade) for us. These two were the most helpful. We definately will be staying at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Marina breeze is energizing and the view is beautiful as you enjoy a wonderfully tasty breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jerity
Reviews.Content: Our townhouse room over looking the ocean a big plus, well maintained and clean hotel. The Marina breeze is energizing and the view is beautiful as you enjoy a wonderfully tasty breakfast the Sheraton offers for $19 per person. It’s a great place to go for a central location near beaches, downtown nightlife and the airport for commuting. I love to go there very relaxing! It's incredible the unique variety in resturants to fit any size budget.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy it every night and the view by the harbor”
Reviews.Author: 00hello-kitty00
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best location & hotels in San Diego. there are a lot of nearby places to visit & good restaurants to try out. It has two towers, so it has 2 pools that can serve both sides of travelers in case it gets really packed in summer time. though the room services are below average where they don't answer your call or not bring items up to your room even you tried to called 3 times. other than that, it's a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: OregonSp8
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. The staff was super friendly and the accomidations comfortable. Exactly what I expected. Excellent location, our room had a fantastic view of the marina. Super close to the airport, yet extremely quiet. Excellent amenities (pool, restaurant, full Starbucks & FedEx/Kinko locations in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: travelinbobm
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights prior to boarding our cruise ship. We liked our room very much. The view of the harbor was great. We saw our cruise ship dock the day we boarded. The reason for our visit to San Diego was to visit the Zoo. We had been there years ago but couldn't wait to see it again. The zoo didn't disappoint. The only down side was the cab ride back to the hotel. Our driver took a number of back streets adding more than $7 to the fare compared to the cab ride to the zoo. When we arrived at the hotel I wrote down the drivers name and license number. At this point the driver became very apologetic and said we didn't need to pay for the ride. I paid him what we had paid for the morning cab ride minus the tip. I reported his name and number to the hotel. Bottom line, watch the cab drivers in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: quantumracer
Reviews.Content: SERVICE, SERVICE, SERVICE!!! Did I mention the service? This was my first stay at the Sheraton, and it will not be my last. I simply will not stay anywhere else in San Diego. There was a problem with my reservation, and Brian at the front desk had it fixed within two minutes! The staff was amazingly attentive, yet not intrusive. I have found the balance between the two is a very thin line. The Sheraton staff walks it beautifully! If you have an opportunity to stay, I highly recommend the Bay tower with a bay view! My wife accompanied me on this trip and we thoroughly enjoyed having coffee on the balcony and watching the sailboats run in the bay. GORGEOUS!!! We have found that most hotels have hard bedding that makes for rough sleeping. Not the Sheraton. My wife and I found the bed to be surprisingly comfortable. The mattress was soft, with plenty of support. I can sum it up by stating: Stay here, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HotelNut13
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly! There is a Starbucks in the hotel, which is a huge plus! And the restaurant was great as well... plus you can't beat the view! I don't think there is a bad view from any room!! It was close to the Gas Lamp area, but definitely not walking distance, that is the only bummer... but a really quick drive, plus it is super close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive parking fees”
Reviews.Author: Internationalflyer
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with nice and updated rooms, great view and good swimming pool. There are 2 major problems with this hotel. There's nothing you can do walking, so if you plan to drink some wine and have dinner in town you would have to take a cab. The 2 nd problem if you're driving are parking fees 22 for self parking and 28 for vallet. If you think you did a good deal, wait for the bill after you check out.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel;beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: heathers44
Reviews.Content: spent 6 nights here in September 2010. Beautiful views from marina side of hotel rooms superbly clean and comfortable meals etc expensive, tried the buffet breakfast at $19; very good staff friendly and proficient lovely pool area very close to airport, no night flights but opens at 6am;

Reviews.Title: “Was not as reserved, it was just, ok.”
Reviews.Author: dreamer2805
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room at the Sheraton San Diego hotel, at the Marina address. This was the better of the two towers. When we gave the taxi driver the address and he took us to the Marina Tower, the bellman redireced us the the older, and being worked on tower. We found out later that there was a teachers convention in town and they had changed our reservation without our consent to the older tower. The old bait and switch routine. The pool was closed for renivation and the front of the Hotel was being painted and sand blasted. We thought we booked a 4 star hotel, I would rate the tower we stayed in a 2.5 star at best. We started to call price line and complain, but I don' t think this was Priceline's fault. We hold the Hotel responsible for changing our reservation to the lower price spread.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for conference”
Reviews.Author: Kwiecin
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and must say it was very good for this purpose. Hotel is clean, well facilitated and comfortable. Very close to the airport. 30 minutes walk to harbor and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NearRadwell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in September for business. Excellent service at check-in and for help with directions and overview of local restaurants. Room was very clean, large and had a good view of the bay. The airport is very close by but I did not hear any aircraft noise in my room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor, but far from city attractions”
Reviews.Author: theseacret
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated, nice views. The restaurants in the hotel could be better, but they were adequate. Was STEPS from the airport, but a pretty good taxi ride to anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Not a value for a money definitely”
Reviews.Author: helmutsk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for about a week and I rate it as poor because of a service. I mean rooms are nice and clean, hotel has a pool and fitness center (I did not try those), but…I had number of issues with a service. Firstly you will be required to pay for every single service you get – no free Internet (it costs almost 20$ a day! Crazy), no free breakfast and even I had to pay for my package handling! For a hotel that costs 200$ a day that is NOT acceptable. Also during a check out I had some objections on invoice I got. I was told that they will sort it out and let me know on email. Guess what – they charged me anyway without giving any information! This is not a 5* hotel service. It is a money printing machine.

Reviews.Title: “The Service made this stay”
Reviews.Author: Simmitam
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference and over four days was treated professionally and warmly. Yes the bathrooms are small, and as the restuarants seemed to be served from a central kitchen, food was not as hot as it could be. BUT the staff is what makes this hotel worth it. And to those reading this, this is not just a "gushy, sentimental" review. I have worked hospitality and know what true value is. It's not always the size of the room but whether the staff is there for you when you need them. Thank you to: Anika @ check in who patiently helped me find a suitable room. Shane (shuttle driver) whose warmth has added to this hotel even in his first month there. Hayley and Brett whose kindess cannot be compared (you know what you did). Max (security) whose compassion and professionalism in a diffcult situation spoke volumes. and John (waiter at Harbour's Edge breakfast on the 21st) whose sunny disposition did alot to offset the cloudy weather. You all made my stay. Simone Brown (Toronto)

Reviews.Title: “Ignored!”
Reviews.Author: drsean
Reviews.Content: This hotel has ignored all of our attempts to contact them via telephone and email regarding the missing items from our room. The morning of our checkout I was packing the suitcases for our flight and noticed that our big shopping bag of clothes and souvenirs was missing. Nothing else was touched in the room and I quickly deduced that housekeeping could have picked it up thinking it was garbage. I immediately called the front desk in horror thinking it had gone to the dumpster and perhaps they could retrieve it before the inevitable. The front desk person was very defensive of the housekeeping staff and told me in a surly tone that this was a matter of security and that I shouldn't assume anything. Security came to the door and took all of our information citing they would begin an investigation and that they needed to review all the risk management strategies or something to that effect. I told them what I thought about it being a possible mistake by housekeeping given he fact that there was also packaging material from my now sobbing 8 year old son's souvenirs in the bag as well. I asked them to please go and check the garbage, but the gentleman just pursed his lips and gave me a blank expression that I could only deduce was that it "ain't gonna happen." They left the room and promised to call us and give us an update on the following Monday. After my phone calls (that magically go to voicemail) and email, it has been a month and there has been absolutely no response or contact. I am extremely disappointed with this lack of response. Shame on you Sheraton for such poor service (no service) after an emotionally upsetting violation of trust and promises. drsean Victoria BC

Reviews.Title: “Okay but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Maxony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference. The hotel lobby is lovely and the view of the marina is very nice. For the most part the food at the hotel was good and there is a Starbucks right in the lobby. The service was good. However, the room and the bathroom are tiny. Upon arrival I noticed that the towels in my room were dirty so I asked for a new set. The new set had old stained spots on 2 out of the 4 towels brought. The faucet in the bathroom had some sort of a problem because there was only hot water or cold water but you could not adjust for warm. The hotel is far away from pretty much everything. We walked around for about a mile and couldn't find even a convenience store. The hotel parking price is obscene ($22 per night) and parking is not easy to find in the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good facilities but a bit of a hike from downtown...”
Reviews.Author: RKJJ
Reviews.Content: Some great aspects of this hotel, free computer and print facilities in the lobby, on site starbucks and a relaxed friendly atmoshere. As you would expect everything was nice and clean. As some of the other reviews say, this hotel is a bit out of town, we walked it a few times and it took approx 45 minutes to walk. Typically, we walked out for dinner downtown and got a taxi back to the hotel (approx $15). If there was a regular bus service available, i would have marked the hotel as a 4, as the location does limit your options. This would be fine if staying for a couple of days or only for a conference, but on holiday you want to get out and about as much as possible!

Reviews.Title: “I Never write reviews but I just have to say something”
Reviews.Author: andthewinneris
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly for business and needless to say have been in hundreds of hotels but the sheraton on harbor island has some serious problems.... The gift shop is vertually never open, always a sign saying they will be back The lobby bar in the west tower has limited operating hours. Also it has 2 large screen tvs but durring my last three visits over the last 3 weeks it hasent had service. What is wrong with this place that they cant get there tvs up and runing to watch a ball game. The sugested 5 minute walk to the other tower to watch tv and have a beer is the last thing I want to do after traveling all day. The check in process is painful. waiting endlessly only to get a trainee...every time. Must not have good employee retention if they have such a steady flow of new desk agents. Finnaly...the shuttle! No where near as frequent as stated, I may just be really unlucky everytime I try to catch a shuttle but never less that 30 min from my experience. There are plenty of great hotels in sd, this isnt one of them. Ive had it and will have my secratary book rooms elsewhere .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cupertino_dude
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton through Hotwire. After discovering our mystery hotel, we looked up the reviews on Trip Advisor, and had some concerns... However, I have to say we enjoyed our 3 night stay. + Our requested crib was delivered to our room before we arrived at the room. Granted, we checked in @ the Marina Tower and had to drive over... + Our toddler was able to watch airplanes and the SeaWorld fireworks show from her crib. This was definitely a unique experience. Our room faced north in the Bay Tower. The windows are floor to ceiling. + The pool has towels - it's in a big wooden box. + Close to the attractions we visited (SeaWorld, San Diego Zoo, Coronado) but you do need a car. It's next to the airport, and I didn't see any restaurants you can leisurely walk to. +/- In room internet is rather expensive, but there is free Wifi in the lobby. Also a big plus is that there is a guest PC for use in the lobby with a printer. - The check-in process was confusing... We parked and checked in @ the Mission Tower, which is the first Sheraton you see from the airport. We were re-directed to to the Bay Tower... had to repark. - Parking is expensive ($22/night)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: Mort2K
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip for the week of 8/23/10 for 4 nights and I just wanna say thank you so much Warren for your warm hospitality and personal touch by having David taking me to the train station on my way out. Great location by the harbor was very relaxing, staff was just absolutely on top of everything, and awesome food was served in our daily meetings. Please say thanks to the kitchen and banquet staff and keep up the good work. Thanks again and that’s my new destination to stay in San Diego from now on.

Reviews.Title: “The service was 4 star and the view from our Marina Tower terrace was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mcg04
Reviews.Content: My husband,myself and fifteen year old son spent 3 nights and had a great stay. All the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The valet staff always gave us perfect directions, the desk staff and the restaurant/bar staff were also very attentive.The hotel is very clean and has just had a renovation. Rooms are very clean and housekeeping service was very conscientious.The pool is very relaxing and has a bar/resaturant outside. There was a good mix of family and business clientele. We stayed at Marina Tower because it was closer to restaurants/pool. The Bay tower has larger rooms but is a 5 min walk along the harbor and is quieter.The entire hotel has a resort feeling to it and is a very relaxing atmosphere. There are a lot of paths to take scenic walks/jogs around the Marina and Harboutr Island.Even though hotel is 5 min from airport we were never bothered by planes overhead. The hotel is a 10-15 min drive to Gaslight/Balboa Park and Zoo area. We were very happy that we stayed on Harbour Island instead of downtown San Diego hotel as we really felt like we were at a resort ans could still get into town easily. This is one of th the best values I have ever had at a hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found Sheraton Hotel and Marina”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledGal27
Reviews.Content: I was there on business but it felt like vacation. The location has the most breath taking views of the city and the harbor. The staff was exceptionally nice and my room was absolutely wonder. I will come back here again and again for both business and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: faajj
Reviews.Content: Went for a conference which was fine, but as far as doing anything else.... stay elsewhere. It's a taxi ride or bus ride to go anywhere interesting. There's nothing to eat there but barely adequate food from overpriced restaurants with surly staff. We took the hotel shuttle and 2 busses to get downtown and then took the train to get to old town... it just takes too long to get anywhere if you don't have your own vehicle. The hotel gets a "C+", the restaurants and location get an "F"

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: vacafam123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina for 3 nights and it was one of the best vacations we've ever had! Great location, service, and pool area. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights and thought this was a great place (Bayside); enjoying the views of the water and airport. Very convenient to airport and only 10 minutes via cab to the downtown area (although we had a car and also traveled to other locations, with easy access to the freeway). The business center was good and internet generally reliable. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. As for the business meeting, the staff and service was outstanding (easy to eat too much because of the great quality and variety of choices).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a bit far from the city centre, though”
Reviews.Author: Babetoo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great pools, great view over the marina, good food. Only minus is that it lies a bit far from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kauinca
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Bay Tower (purcheased through Priceline), Aug.20-22, and was pleasantly surprised! First, I must comment on the level of service all around. From front dest and room service to shuttle and valet, the Sheraton staff was wonderful! Kudos to everyone working Bay Tower that weekend! The hotel is conveniently located near the airport, and pretty close to downtown (about a $12.00 cab fare), yet the setting by the marina and bay give one the feeling of being in a private oasis. I had a sixth floor room with a view of the harbor (and airport) and despite the fact I could see planes taking off, it felt very peaceful. Saturday night I was even able to watch the fireworks at Seaworld from my (nice sized) balcony! The room itself was spacious, comfortable and very clean. The only negative remark I could make is that the size of the bathroom was a little small, not that of a four star hotel. Both mornings I used room service for breakfast and the meals were great, delivered timely and fresh. Coffee in the room is Starbucks and delicous and super easy to make. Directly across the street from the hotel is a walking path along the bay. It's lovely and is a great place to unwind and watch the boats and take in a terrific view of the San Diego skyline. I also walked over to the Marina building checked out the lobby, pool, grabbed an ice tea at the Starbucks and sat on a veranda there for a bit - very pleasant! I would absolutely stay at this property again and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “One of Starwood's best”
Reviews.Author: twenty9blue
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel, and I was thoroughly impressed. As a member of the hospitality industry, this hotel practices daily what we all strive to be. Friendly staff, all the amenities you need (except Wireless internet), amazing views, great food, flawless business event, and set in one of the best locations on earth. Kudos to the entire Sheraton San Diego team.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pricey parking, nice hotel bar, good pool, decent service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeforeKids
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews here before going scared me a lot since we had booked a room for four days using priceline. The pickup from the airport was smooth and sure enough we were put in the bay tower which I had heard was worse than the marina tower. We had several air crew in the shuttle with us and they were directed to the marina tower so we felt a natural discrimination towards us the priceline customers. oh well. The bay tower was not bad surprisingly enough. It was a very pleasant less than 5 minute walk from the marina to the bay tower and our room was on the 10th floor with a nice view of the marina. Seriously, sitting outside on the balcony in the morning and drinking my coffee was a nice start to the day. We did not interact with the staff much other than to call them to get the times of the shuttle which they were always happy to give. This brings me to the transportation part of the review. Parking fees were 22 bucks a day! But this is easily discernible well in advance and anyone with a modicum of sense would do their research before going. We did a decent workaround - rented from hertz every day in the morning and returned in the evening. It cost us $10 more every day because of the $10 fee per rental but you are saving about $12 a day for the parking so in total a win. The shuttles from the hotel drop you to the airport and then you can take the car shuttle from there to the car lot. Summary: great location (everything in san diego we saw was close by), good transportation to the hotel, worth the money from priceline bid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Hallways Stink”
Reviews.Author: HiranW
Reviews.Content: The arrival experience was great and the parking guys did an awesome job (even during night and day). We were coming there to spend the weekend with the kids and go to Seaworld. The Hotel looks nice, has a business feel to it. Room service was good - the server again was very nice. It is apparent that these guys spend a lot of time on training on customer service as you can feel it all around the Hotel. My only issue was the smell in the hallway. We were in Room 1163, the hallway smelled like someone crapped on it. It may the old carpet and someone steaming it, but other than this minor item the stay was very pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bay and marina views!”
Reviews.Author: doilybug
Reviews.Content: We arrived at San Diego airport at 22:30 and I was concerned that checking-in at this time would be a problem, but it turned out to be a breeze at Sheraton. The hotel is a 5 minute taxi drive from the airport - perfect if you have an early flight to catch. My partner and I were greeted by very friendly staff who upgraded our room upon check-in. Our room was in the Bay Tower, which is only a scenic few minutes walk along the marina from the hotel's main building, the Marina Tower. We were on the eighth floor and had the most beautiful view of the bay. I'd consider going back for the view alone! We stayed for four nights. Unfortunately breakfast was not included in our rate and the room service menu in our room didn't exactly offer the most tempting prices, so we didn't experience any of the food on offer. We did however make the most of the Starbucks located in the Marina Tower - a great way to start the day. The main purpose of our trip was San Diego Comic Con. Regular free shuttle buses operated throughout the event, stopping outside both towers and taking us right up to the Convention Center. This hotel is perfect for anyone going to the convention who doesn't want to pay the high rates of the Gaslamp hotels, but also doesn't want getting there to be a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Parking”
Reviews.Author: honolulutraveler
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel $89/night after the hotel agreed to beat the price located on Orbitz.com. Hotel was conveniently located near San Diego airport and a quick drive to downtown, Point Loma and Old Town. Hotel located along harbor and there is a nice walking path which my toddler loved strolling on and looking at the boats. Room was cozy buy clean and had a nautical theme. Had a great computer center. I hate paying for parking and self parking at this hotel was more than $20/night. This was only palatable to me because I got a great rate for the room. Despite paying an arm and a leg for parking the self parking was not convenient. Returned late one night and the only available parking was quite a walk from the hotel entrance. Overall a good hotel except for the parking rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of the Bay and the City”
Reviews.Author: kkr67
Reviews.Content: At first I was disappointed to be so close to the airport and not within walking distance to downtown. However, it really is a lovely hotel (nautical theme throughout) and kind of away from the hustle and bustle. The views are incredible. A few restaurants are within walking distance which is convenient as well. This would get an even higher rating if they provided a shuttle to downtown!!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: GREENIZZ1
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at this hotel because of the some of the reviews i read here, but with some research I decided to take the chance and was pleasantly surprised, the hotel was clean, rooms were comfortable the view was great and the staff was amazingly friendly & helpful, although at check in the clerk did try to pull the old switcheroo and tell me my room was not available with the king size and they could put me somewhere else but thanks to a review I read here I didnt let them do that to us and told them I wanted the room with the view and the size of bed I paid for and I got just that, beware they might try this on you too cause another traveler had posted this too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome overnight stay! The rooms are spacious, staff is rushed but friendly and accommodating. I think most rooms have BEAUTFUL views of the marina plus balconies. Although it is near the airport, it does not feel that way at all. Location: Close to airport but only a 5 minute drive to downtown, not bad at all. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when traveling back to San Diego. The executive management staff is SUPERB and very customer service oriented. Club rooms are special as they have additional amenities, however, the evening service is not around on Fridays...only for breakfast, which I found slightly odd. All in all, a very pleasant experience and worth getting a rez here!!

Reviews.Title: “It is ok, don't stay in the back hotel”
Reviews.Author: enjoyslife3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the airport but planes are not bothersome. There are two hotels, the bay and the marina. We were stuck in the back hotel. You have to walk 5 minutes outside to get to the other hotel. Fine in the daytime, not well lighted at night. I would not want to be a female walking alone here at night. The front hotel seems to have all of the staff. I saw two people working at the front desk at the back hotel in the two nights we were there. Not one other employee anywhere. Parking is a challenge. Not much of it, spaces are very small. Balconies are nice - we had someone empty what we think was a cooler over there balcony onto ours. Everything was wet, out table/chairs, window, patio. Called to let security know - no one came up. Front Desk took some money off for the inconvience. We used the pool in the front hotel. No towels anywhere. Finally found some in the fitness area. The whole pool area had used towels everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Tower - NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfatalbert
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton Harbor Island through Priceline for under $80 per night. Having read all of the negative reviews on here beforehand, I was very disappointed to find out we were booked into the Bay Tower, but thought I would give it a fair chance. The Bay Tower is, at most, a 1/4 mile away from the Marina Tower. Bay Tower has its own separate lobby. For all intensive purposes, they are 2 completely separate hotels that simply share the Sheraton name. For Priceline to allow the Bay Tower to be booked as a 4-star hotel is disappointing and frustrating. I'm sure there are different qualifications for what makes 4-star vs 3-star vs 2-star, etc. But for me, a 4-star hotel should make you think things like, "This is nice", or "This goes above & beyond a normal hotel", or basically, "Wow, this is fancy!" Sheraton Harbor Island Bay Tower sadly did none of those things. The Marina Tower, from what I saw, appeared to be a nice, newer, sleek-looking closer-to-4-star hotel. It's a 5-10 minute walk from the Bay Tower. The Starbucks in the Marina Tower is quite nice, and therefore very busy. If you choose the hotel's Green Option (of declining daily maid service), you will get a $5 coupon under your door each night, which can be used at Starbucks. So that was nice since it pretty much paid for a drink each morning. The living space in the room was average. Since it's literally across the street from the Bay, it had a nice balcony that looked out onto the Bay. The Bay-View has ships & military boats go by, vs. the Marina-View, which just has boats parked there. However, if you pick the Bay-View, there always seemed to be a lot of loading/unloading/work going on in the mornings since the loading docks are on the first floor, directly under the balconies. This causes a lot of noise (ie, not very relaxing), especially if you're on the lower floors Bay-view side. The room's decor itself was ok, nothing fancy at all. The couch looked quite worn. The bed was firm, bordering on hard. Pillows were very thin, even when double folded. The clock radio was cheap, as in $10 Radio Shack cheap. No iPod or auxiliary connection that I would expect a 4-star hotel to have. The bathroom really showed the age of the room. The wallpaper was borderline gross in places and should really be replaced straight away. The shower was weak in terms of pressure - it could not shoot to the back wall. But it did stay hot for a long shower. The towels were your basic white hotel standard-issue ones; i.e., the ones that are barely long enough to wrap around my 36-inch waist. I have nicer towels than this at home! And only one towel hook/hanger in the bathroom. The TV was pathetic. A 4-star hotel should not have an old 27" old CRT TV. This was the TV my brother had in high-school in the mid-90's. Also, our TV had an annoying habit, when the balcony doors were open, of switching itself back to the Hotel Menu channel randomly every couple minutes. The problem went away when the balcony doors were shut. Very odd. There is a $22 per night parking charge to park in the lot in front of the hotel. I wasn't that upset about the fee since most hotels - and everywhere else - in San Diego charge you for parking if you're anywhere near the water. I think it's fair to say that you really need a car if you're going to stay here for any extended period of time. Taxi charges will add up quickly. Because for the most part, you're really in the middle of nowhere in terms of shopping/places to walk to. There is a Fresh & Easy about 5+ miles away in Point Loma, but alas, there is no refrigerator in the room. On to the positives - the view obviously is great on the Bay side. The gym area downstairs was free to use. Again, dated machines but free is nice and unheard of at most hotels. The employees were all very nice and helpful. There is free wi-fi in the lobby. There is also a "business center" with 3 computers and a printer that are free to use. The room itself though feels outdated and not very professional at all for a "business center", but again, at least it was free to use. All in all, the Sheraton Bay Tower felt like a hotel from the Hotel Circle that had simply been placed in Harbor Island. It felt much more like a 2- or 3-star hotel. Nothing left me saying "Wow this is fancy". Even having paid a discounted rate, I still felt disappointed about the hotel experience. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep well here”
Reviews.Author: The4Monkeys
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were put in a back building which is 3 stories tall. Were told it was a King bed but it was two doubles. A brief delay and visit to the front desk got us on the top floor (3rd) and a King bed. The air conditioner is motel style (not central) and is a unit near the sliding door. It is loud. L-O-U-D. I couldn't sleep at all the first night. Also this place is across the street from the San Diego International Air Port. You can hear every departure (they start early and so will you!). We had a view of the Lanai pool--seemed to be the place to make out. Kids enjoyed the other Lagoon pool and hot tub. Ping Pong tables are situated in the "Game room" which has two ping pong tables and a non-functional coin-operated pool table. It is very hard to enjoy this specific area because it is situated near a HVAC intake port which sounds, oddly, like a jet engine. So, if you are hard of hearing, stay here, it is a reasonble place with nice people working here, good service in the main restaurant and I enjoyed the waffles while my kids had plenty of choices in the buffet. Cost $50 for breakfast. The food and parking in all these touristy places is way overpriced so be prepared and get over it. I was happy with the valet service--very quick. We got this place on a hotwire rate of $100 per night, but looking back would have paid extra to have a quieter place. Bring earplugs just in case.

Reviews.Title: “The Missing Teddy Bear Comes Home”
Reviews.Author: dkaney
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay. I wish we could have had more time to enjoy the hotel. My family which consists of my husband, two teenagers and a 10 yr old had a blast during the week of Comic-Con. Check-in was speedy and seamless. Check-out was just as well handled. We had found a discrepency on the bill and the counter check-out staff fixed it right away. We were given a spacious room for the 5 of us but one of the teenagers had to sleep on the floor anyway. The cleaning staff was gracious enough to make sure he had clean linen every day and we had plenty of coffee and towels for all of us. The best thing of all was getting my youngest childs Teddy Bear Back. Apparently the bear had been covered up in the bedding and inadvertently left behind. We didn't notice until we were several hours away. My child was beside himself. He said with huge allegator tears running down his face, "Mommy I need Henry. He keeps the bads dreams away". As you can probably guess I felt his absolute vulnerability and terror at that moment in time. The realization that for the first time in 9 yrs he would not have Henry to fall asleep with. I called the hotel and the security staff put housekeeping on the alert right away. We didn't hear anything for a day. I called the next day. Still no Henry but assurances were given that people were looking for the bear and someone would call me as soon as it was found. Day 2 we get a call. Henry had been located. Housekeeping had washed the bear and was waiting for a trip home. The next day the manager FedEx'd the missing companion to Oregon. We received Henry 3 days later. Clean and well travelled, into the very happy waiting arms of his life long companion. My son learned a valuable lession during those "Henry-less" days. #1 He could sleep nightmare free without Henry. #2 Never forget to look in the blankets at a hotel before declaring "I'm all packed lets go" and #3 It was sure good to get Henry home. Thank you to the unnamed manager that sent our Henry-The Teddy Bear Home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: JAM574
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old son and I had a wonderful time at the Sheraton San Diego Harbor and Marina. The staff was very friendly, efficient and helpful. The location is very convenient to the airport and right on the water. We were able to rent a jetski right at the hotel. The view of downtown San Diego at night from our balcony was amazing. Great pool, tennis courts, fitness center, pool table, ping pong table-lots to do for kids and adults both! We will definately stay at this hotel again next time we are in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine once there. Reservation process sucked”
Reviews.Author: BballDadKevin
Reviews.Content: We traveled to stay at this hotel as part of a baseball tournament where this hotel was one of the host hotels and we were required to stay there. Once there, the hotel was fairly decent except for the "car alarms" that go off on a nightly basis. Not sure why that is but, we suspect the proximity of the naval base? Nobody's gps's worked properly in the area either which we were certain were a result of the naval base. If staying here again, I would highly recommend the Marina Tower over the Bay Tower. Bay's nice but, Marina's where it's all happening. Restaurant prices were horrible forcing most to find food elsewhere........AND, the Bay tower could really use some laundry facilities.....especially if their going to be the host hotel for a baseball tourney. The worst part of the entire trip was the entire reservation process where the resey's were made back in March and apparently this hotel/chain is not set up for this type of venue as our resey's were a complete nightmare from the beginning. The hotel staff once we arrived was very accomodating to insure everything was in order and we got everything fixed. Kudo's to Blair & Brett for all of their help and excellent professionalism however, BP a supervisor back at the main office (you know who you are), NEVER fulfilled his promises nor even replied back to repeated emails asking for help. This after spending a fair amount of time on the phone with him to rectify everything. Give that guy a demerit...........The hotel itself is in a great location with a great view of the harbor. They should really step up to Queen beds (in lieu of doubles) cause you have the room to do so and doubles are rediculous for couples traveling with kids or players. We especially liked the overall locale of the hotel and it's proximity to many of the featured area's: Sea World, Zoo, Old Town, Little Italy, Coronado Island, etc....... And it's a HUGE SECRET that I'll share with you here.......Between the two towers and closest building to the Bay Tower, there's a MARINA DELI on the back side of the building that serves wonderful bfst & lunch for extremely reasonable prices. They also have quite a few ammenities should you need drinks, snacks, beer whateover. Too bad we did not find it till the last day we were there but, a fantastic breakfast was had by almost our entire team and priced as it should be. There's also laundry facilities there but, do not believe they are suppose to be available to anyone aside from the members of the marina........but, it's there and nobody is spose to talk about it. Just this little fact will enlighten your experience immensely while staying at this portion of the hotel. Would I stay there again? YES, with a much greater knowledge than the 1st time. Enjoy.........(would I try to get resey's every fixed again with BP...................NO!)

Reviews.Title: “great location, great beds, fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: roboch
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the sheraton san diego and marina. We were in san diego for fun and a day at the races. The hotel was great, the view of the marina was awesome and the beds were very. very comfortable.I have stayed at 8 or 9 4 plus star san diego hotels and this one was as good as any of them and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: luv2cycle1
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by the poor service. It seemed like they did not have enough staff to start with check in. At times there were long lines and 3 people working. Check in seemed to take much longer then other hotels I have stayed at like Marriott. Now I realize my disappointed, use to staying those hotels, this was a differt culture. I did not feel like the staff really care about the happiness of the customer. I was use to being able to check in early with out a problem and not being charged $10.00 per hour for late check. Check in was 3pm. My room was not available until 4:30. I was offered accomdations for my bags until a room was ready, but felt like this was not something new.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Pricey Resort”
Reviews.Author: CapeFearTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for the Comic-Con, and the Sheraton Marina was the only hotel left with rooms, so it wasn't my destination of choice to begin with. That said, it's a very pleasant resort hotel, with a wonderful view of the marina & a very nice swimming pool. I wish I had time to check out the amenities like the spa and the free bikes, but we were only there for 2 nights. Luckily, they are pet friendly, and our room's patio opened right out onto a green space, which was a plus. The real draw back was that everything else in the hotel was VERY expensive. A room service breakfast for 2 came in @ $60! And the service at the Harborview Restaurant was agonizingly sloooow, despite almost no one being seated for dining. And you're given a choice of either parking yourself for $25 @ day or valet for $28. Really? Oh, and they charge you $20 @ day (not 24 hours, mind you--a calendar day) for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was near perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: clav10c
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline for $104 and was then prepared to be very disappointed after reading all the negative reviews here. However, the hotel far exceeded expectations. Despite what another poster mentioned, I thought it was a perfect hotel for a family with young children. The location was quiet and serene, there were many amenities at the Marina Tower, they even had movie night at the pool one evening. The front desk associate was extremely helpful. She helped to get us into a double/double instead of the king we had been booked into and she even moved us from the Bay Tower to Marina and to the 12th floor! Thanks so much for your effort Samantha. The only complaints we had are 1.) Yes, the parking is extremely overpriced at $22. 2.) The large pool at the Marina Tower was closed an entire day for "Servicing". The smaller pool was open though. Seemed odd since I recall other reviews in previous months stating the same issue. I wonder if it's not really a servicing issue, but that they just don't want two pools open at the same time on a weekday since they would have to staff them both.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst and most expensive hotel stay in memory.”
Reviews.Author: AnaPeligrosa
Reviews.Content: San Diego in July. Crowded, crowded, foggy and cold. We booked a room for our last night in town as we had a 6:30 a.m. flight. We asked for an early check-in. Got there at 12:15 and were not allowed in our room until 4:20 p.m. The front desk staff was rude. The room was incredibly expensive and our card was charged $50 more than we were quoted over the phone. All in all, our stay there cost $400 (after I complained and got the $50 taken off our bill) for 16 hours of time, only 12 hours of which were in the room. Oh yeah and they flunked wake up call too. Fortunately we woke ourselves up and made the plane. Total rip off!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean, Bad Parking”
Reviews.Author: peaceandlove4evr
Reviews.Content: Got a special rate through USTSA. Marina Tower was very nice, clean. It smelled brand new. Rooms were very quiet; didn't hear noise from neighbors only airplanes as it is very near airport. Beds were very comfortable. Parking was very inconvenient at $22/day ($25 if you get valet). We had to park far away in a dirt lot. It is kind of out of the way from stores, and restaurants. It was excellent quality for the discounted $114/night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Barfly-guy
Reviews.Content: Got this through Priceline and was worried by the awful reviews, expecially of the Bay Tower. So when we arrived and were told to head to the Bay Tower, we asked to be moved to the Marina Tower. Although the hotel was fully booked for a convention, the front desk agent happily accomodated. The room had been recently renovated, new carpets, etc., with a very comfy bed. Best of all was the great view of San Diego from the balcony. Pool is nice but busy with kids, and pool service is reasonably priced. There are a number of computers on the main floor with free internet access. Starbucks opens early and the hotel restaurant had a great inexpensive buffet dinner. Concierge was hit and miss. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. We never did see the Bay Tower so cannot comment. Parking at $22 / day is outrageous for a hotel so far away from downtown. There is not much around but do but try the "Island Prime" restaurant just down the road. You will need reservations. We also tried the Boathouse..take a pass on that place. Best evening in San Diego was at Henry's Pub downtown. The band Flock of 80s was playing up a storm and the beers were flowing nicely. Just don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Seaworld and the Zoo”
Reviews.Author: Matty17r
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Paid $74 a night plus taxes on priceline. Hotel is located on Harbour Island near to the airport. Didn't really notice the noise at all. There are two parts to this hotel, the Marina Tower and Bay Tower. Make sure you stay in the Marina Tower as this is main part of the hotel. We got an excellent view of the Marina. The hotel pool is really nice and there is also a nice walk along the Marina. Seaworld and the Zoo are within a 15 minute to the hotel. My only gripes would be the cost of parking which was 25 dollars and the long check in that we had. The room is really nice and modern, however the bathroom was really small. The hotel is not within walking distance of Downtown and you need a car to get around! Overall if you can get a good deal I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel. Spotless. Attentive even during a conference of 800!”
Reviews.Author: castigln
Reviews.Content: We experienced no difficulties or hassles when checking in. There was a conference during our entire stay which did not prove to be anything more than a delayed wait at the elevators in the early morning. Pool was clean and staff was very attentive- thanks Stephanie! Beds were comfortable and rooms were spotless (and I'm an Italian wife-clean freak type) . Been to San Diego three times and this hotel met all of our needs (Starbucks too!) Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Comfiest beds ever”
Reviews.Author: LorienSage
Reviews.Content: trip advisor was such a great help to me that I just had to write a review. The beds are so soft that I wanted to take it home with me. Many people said that and they were right. The view from the Bay Tower is amazing but realize that the Marina Tower (which is short walk from the Bay Tower) has all the ammenities i.e. Restaurant (very over priced of course - Quinns - but they have great burgers), Starbucks, lagoon-like pool. For us it was perfect to go next door for all of that and tip toe back to our quiet lovely view. Staff was very nice and the rooms are big and very clean. Do yourself a solid and give it a try. P.S. We went for Comic Con and it was a very short shuttle trip - good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “At a discounted rate, good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlesgate
Reviews.Content: Priceline categorizes this Sheraton as a 4*, but as we often find with Priceline, it's really a 3-star for older Bay Tower building. The hotel is split into 2 locations around the corner from each other surrounding the harbor marina. Separate parking, separate check-in. While the Bay Tower is older, it has been recently renovated. It is quite clean, bed comfortable, good sitting area and offers the usual amenities expected of a Sheraton. Each room has a balcony. The hotel is across the street from the airport, so expect air traffic noise, but the marina is quiet and provides a pleasant view. We could also see the SeaWorld fireworks in the evening from the marina side. Although the hotel was very, very crowded with weddings, families and other groups over a Sat. stay, the pool area was not very busy. The pool bar was not open, which was an inconvenience. Parking, self or valet, is an extra $22. per day. The location is on Harbor Island, 5 min. drive either way to downtown SanDiego or Point Loma. We were satisfied with the hotel as there were few choices in San Diego for that weekend and Priceline was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Tower - Staff could not care less...”
Reviews.Author: ghartman
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms for a 3 night stay at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. Our party was relegated to the Bay Tower, which was an older building, sadly in need of a face-lift. Very disappointing in appearance, cleanliness and amenities. What was truly surprising was the "couldn't care less" attitude shown by the staff. We would have to call the front desk numerous times to get even the most basic things [eg. previous occupant had left the room safe locked]. The gift shop was open for only a few hours over the entirety of our stay, which was unfortunate given that the hotel is isolated from any stores. The business centre's printer didn't work, which staff knew about but didn't bother to post a sign, or even tell any of the guests who were attempting to use the equipment. I run a health care service organization and it is abundantly clear that there is a lack of oversight on the part of management. A very poor effort on the part of Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Huakai
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal during our stay so we didn't pay the usual crazy resort price (thank you Hotwire). I have my hang ups with the roads in San Diego so finding this place wasn't the easiest thing but upon arrival I felt comfortable. We stayed in the Bay Tower, which I admit must not be as great as the main hotel, but for the price we paid, we didn't mind. This hotel is not really in a good location. It's right across from the airport, noise wasn't a problem but still, really? It's also not close to any restaurants or shops. We had to drive out for dinner and San Diego road's are not my favorite. But service was fabulous. The staff is excellent, quick, and friendly. They give really good advice about the area and the hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of Two Hotels, One Reservation and a $400 per night bill for a run down property.”
Reviews.Author: jrh301
Reviews.Content: As an SPG fan, this was disappointing. Firstly, they have two properties. One is a hotel, which they call the 'Marina Tower' with nice lobby, flat tvs and restaurant, etc and then they have another called 'Bay Tower' which is more like a run down apartment building/crackhouse/dorm that they like to shuttle you to and call it 'an upgrade' and that they 'have bigger rooms' and so on. Liars. It is horrible, run down, CRT TVs and cream whitewashed furniture. The other tower has Flat TVs, lovely showers and you are on the Marina, not overlooking the Airport, which is the Bay Tower view. Add this to the fact that it is $300+ per night, charge $25 per night for self parking your car, $13 per PC for internet per night and this is a $400+ per night stay and honestly, a joke. Even sitting in the restaurant for breakfast and all you see is stains on the windows that block your view of the harbor and make you ask yourself what else in this hotel isn't clean. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else when you are in San Diego. This hotel is overpriced (with internet and parking it was $400+ per on a weekend) for the quality and they bait and switch. None of which are qualities that I will patron and I will never, ever stay here again. This has tarnished my opinion of this brand. It should not be a Sheraton, but perhaps a Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “a vacation saved”
Reviews.Author: mrsjgreco
Reviews.Content: I am sending this email to recoginize one of your employees. This employee saved my family's summer vacation. Originally our plans were to stay at a La Quinta Inn in Oceanside and go to Legoland. Upon arriving in Oceanside, we realized our view was the rooftop to a Gentlemen's Club. On top of that we were misquoted on the ticket prices we were going to pick up at the front desk. This threw our plans off because we like many families are on a budget. We ended up changing our plans to come to the bay area. My in laws are live abords in Harbor Island. They offered us to stay there, but with a growing family, the space is a little tight. So we headed south to hotel circle. They were booked! The Ramada had a few rooms left but they were smoking rooms. My husband is a smoker so we thought we could handle it. We spent the day at the beach and went to the Ramanda room late evening. That was the most disgusting experience of my life. Not only was the stench overwhelming but we found rodent feces in the bedsheets. At this point we were totally exhaused and headed back to the boat to try and get some sleep. As were were pullling into the harbor we decided to check availability and pricing at your Sheraton. That is when Melissa Hernandez waited on me!! Not only did she find my family a room its was also affordable. Our vacation was saved. We were prepared to come home the next day. We had a great room, beautiful view, and great service. Employees like Melissa will keep your customers coming back. If there were any negatives, I would say parking charges are excessive, and the girl who checked us out was not too polite. Other than that, Melissa Hernandez was a Godsend to my family and we will return to the Sheraton! Sincerely Joanne Greco

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best.”
Reviews.Author: jkds88
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel our room wasn't ready and it was 2 hours past the projected check in time when we finally got to our room. The front desk staff had a line several deep and only one person at the desk. She was extremely pleasant and did her best to service everyone. The phones were ringing off the hook and she was trying to focus on each customer, management should really consider getting more help during peak times checking in and out. Our room was dissappointing at best, the view was great, we were on the harbor side, this however was the only highlight of our room. We went out to enjoy the balcony and had only one chair. We called twice before someone arrived with a chair, it was dirty and we had to clean it before we could use it. Our room had several non working outlets. Traveling with 2 other young woman all with cell phones, laptops and other electronics to charge, this was a huge problem in our room. I called twice before an Engineer came to our room, he said he had to get a tool, left and never returned. At that point we gave up. You have to question the decision not to offer wireless internet. For a hotel not to offer free Wi-Fi or at least offer it as an amenity for a fee is sad. This was a business trip and it made it very difficult to work as well as my 2 travel partners. The wire service was for one computer only and a huge inconvenience to be trapped at the desk. The beds were comfortable and very clean. The housekeeping staff on the 4th floor were very pleasant and worked hard to service the rooms. We love San Diego and will be back but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Atrippy5
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! The Bay towers view was beautiful and peaceful. The bed and pillows were unbelievably comfortable... so comfortable my boyfriend and I ordered room service so we can could stay in bed a little longer and eat out on the balcony. We were also surprised by a $50 credit to use for food or beverages. Absolutely No complaints about our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disheartened”
Reviews.Author: rlmikash
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the bed was comfortable and the view was beautiful. I was however, disappointed that there was no refridgerator in the room except the extremely expensive mini bar filled with candybars. I have a 2 year old and had to turn the mini bar around to keep him out of it. Also, I did not appreciate having to pay $22.00 a day for the priviledge of parking my vehicle there. I never saw anything in the advertising advising me of this fee when I was searching for a hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience....”
Reviews.Author: ladymagz
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, I requested to have the two rooms we reserved side by side. The front desk was able to accommodate us and placed us in the Marina Tower. It was a 5 minute walk (or 1 minute drive) from the Bay Tower (the main tower) but we didn't mind since the walk was right next to the water and was very refreshing. Plus, I hear the rooms in the Marina Tower are bigger than those in the Bay Tower. The rooms were quiet, a good size, and beds were very comfortable, but the couches in both rooms need to be replaced or reupholstered because they were obviously worn out. The bathrooms need updating and a good cleaning! The views were beautiful, especially when sitting out on the balcony. Only 2 things to complain about...parking is expensive, $22/day and there was a $100 hold for each room placed on my card for 48hrs after checking out that I wasn't informed about when I checked in or checked out. All in all, needs some TLC but hotel staff was polite and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge service is a misnomer”
Reviews.Author: BigT2
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the hotel was very good, however, any attempts for shopping, dinner or any other activities through the concierge was dismal at best. I received better service from the valets and the shuttle drivers on activities that should have been handled by the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Sheraton on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: moneycome2me
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay last week at your hotel. From the entrance with the sweeet aroma to the staff at the front desk to the housekeeper on the 6th floor. My stay was great. I would like to mention Keri & Brett at the desk, Victor and the Chef in the restuarant with the buffet style set up. I can not forget Estella B. and Natalie M., in the begining Ashley Eng helped with the arrangements long distance in planning, coordination and implementiing everything we could think we needed. The special touch was the fruit basket I received in my room from Natalie and Estella, that was the icing on the cake. The bedding was so very comfortable every night, I recommend that everyone mention receives a raise or day off for a job well done. Sincerely, Major Mary Brookins United States Air Force Nurse Corp

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: AstarZ
Reviews.Content: I am so not happy with this hotel. The first time I stayed there it was perfect! The second it was awful! I stayed here for a wedding for two nights and might I mention I was the make-up artist for this wedding as well as the bride's brothers girlfriend. Everything was beyond screwd up. They put us all in the different towers and when I checked in I had them fix that and put us all in the same room. It also took 40 min to check in. And then they stuck me in a room with no A/C. Might I mention I live in San Diego and i was only staying here for the ease of getting the bridal party ready. So I was stuck sleeping in 80 degree heat! When I called they said in the morning they would fix the room since they were booked and could not switch me rooms. In the morning they came in and decided to start fixing it at 9am and when I told them at 10am I would have the bridal party coming in and needed the A/C fixed. They told me it would take longer and we would be without A/C. So finally they switched me rooms. And Frita the person in charge didn't even want to comp the night stay let alone give me a discount on the room. So finally they changed me rooms. I had to go down for the keys and I had to move my own luggage since the bell hop never made it up with my keys or to move my stuff. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone!!! Please dont stay here let alone block rooms for an event.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with level of service”
Reviews.Author: lolom
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Starwood properties and therefore selected this Sheraton based on trust and previous experience. I was however disappointed with the level of service as this particular property. Many times people would try to contact me at the hotel and no one would pick up at reception. In addition when I tried to contact someone at reception it took a few calls before anyone picked up as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: darrin90254
