Luckily, cabs are waiting for you at the hotel, and most downtown locations are within a $10 cab ride. Make sure you take the number of the cab company and a cell phone with you, though, because you can't just hail a cab when you are ready to return to the hotel, since they don't patrol the streets just looking for their next fare. You'll just need to call them, and they'll send out their next available ride to pick you up. The fare starts when you get in the car (not when you call.) Be sure to ask the concerierge where the closest X is before you just get in the cab and go. My friend and I wanted to go to IHOP for breakfast one morning, so we just jumped in the cab without researching the location. $20 cab fare later, we showed up at IHOP. Which, of course meant that we had to pay another $20 to get back. Most expensive IHOP pancakes I ever had! :) We would have been better off ordering room service and paying the $16 for 3 pancakes. I would really recommend renting a car and traveling up to La Jolla to visit Torrey Pines and the coves and beaches there. You can do a 12 hour car rental if you don't want to pay the $22 overnight parking fee. I'm starting to digress here, so let me just summarize with this: If you are looking for a clean comfy place to just sleep and take showers, this is a great hotel. If you are one who likes to use up everything that a hotel has to offer, this will probably end up being a very expensive vacation for you. Either way, it's in beautiful San Diego, and that's all that matters!!!!! Have a great trip~

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Highway Robbery!”
Reviews.Author: jccns
Reviews.Content: TRAVELLERS BEWARE! This hotel will charge you for absolutely everything. Parking is $22/Day. Internet is $20/Day. A rollaway bed is $20/Day. This hotel charges absurd amounts of money for what other hotels provide for free. Sign on hotel entry doors state "that the area, meaning the hotel, has cancer causing chemicals with some California State law number. .Absolutely true! I WILL NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN! Do yourself a favour and don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location Don't expect SVO or Gold member perks”
Reviews.Author: firedog2881
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a memorial service at Point Loma. Hotel was great and location awesome. Room was clean and comfortable. Only complaint was asked for a late checkout and was told 2:00 pm anything after that would be $10 per hour and I can't offer that either. What ? why even mention the $10 and I can't give you that? My buddy who isn't even an SPG member let alone an SVO owner or Gold member get's a 4:00 pm checkout and I'm offered a 2:00 pm checkout like they we're doing me a favor. Stored my gear in his room instead. Very disappointed in how they treated me as an SVO owner with Gold membership. If you go here don't expect anything different than the non SPG membership, let alone SVO owner would get. Not sure I'll be back based on that alone. Great hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: Good value for the cost & decent location close to SAN

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel by Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: artnmadz
Reviews.Content: It's hard to appreciate the qualities of the hotel when all you see is what they don't have. We arrived in San Diego in the late evening and decided to go downstairs to eat. Normally, there is a folder that has the hotel amenities to include the hotel restaurants. Not there. The next day, we went to Phil's BBQ (Very good), but I wanted to write down the address. Looked for a pad and pen that normally comes in the room. Not there. In the morning I went to take a shower and after I dried myself off, I looked for a towel hanger... not there. Service was very good though. The people were very helpful and made us feel welcome, it's just too bad there was so much to focus on what was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport, but otherwise inconvenient; extra charges abound....”
Reviews.Author: okazon69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and modern, but the location is very inconvenient for business in downtown San Diego. As others have noted, it is a good $15 cab ride away from anywhere. As seems typical for a Sheraton, nothing is included. Internet? $$$ (Nobody could give a reasonable explanation as to the difference between the basic and enhanced version!) Breakfast? $$$. Apart from that, they seem to take advantage of their captive audience by inflating the charges for everything on offer. For a quick stay before flying, sure, but otherwise there must be better choices around.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great, until...”
Reviews.Author: Florie
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Sheraton at the marina in San Diego. We booked the room through Jet Blue vacations and got a lovely room with a great view at a great price. We enjoyed a delicious lunch at the 'casual' restaurant/bar where the service was attentive and the prices were comparable to our NYC area. Back to the room to relax and turn in early--we were headed for the border and a Baja adventure early the next morning. I turned down the bed and was quite distressed to see a BLOOD STAIN on the white sheet. Not terribly large, but quite noticeable, about the size of a dime. I called the desk to request that the bed be re-made, and a housekeeper arrived a while later--with a new sheet. When I asked her how this could possibly happen, she suggested that the morning housekeeper may have cut herself and bled on the sheets. When we requested that the ENTIRE bed be re-made, she provided us with new pillowcases as well. Absolutely no attention was paid to the blanket, mattress cover or the duvet. When we again asked for the entire bed to be attended to, she muttered something about the hotel's policy to save water; and then, when pressed for details, seemingly forgot how to speak English. We were too tired to request another room, had only a few hours before our early morning departure, so I thought that a Trip Advisor review would be more effective than just complaining to the management. This is the second Sheraton "adventure" we have had in the last few years. It will be the LAST.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with most comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick get away to San Diego for my birthday and got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel ($79 per night). We stayed two nights. Check in was a little slow, only one gal working the desk, and she said we were in the far away building but I asked to be in the Marina tower and she accommodated me (I did mention I was a Starwood member but not sure if that helped). Our room had two doubles but that was why we got the $79 price but it was ok. The beds were extremely comfortable. I'm not sure about everyone complaining about the noise and weight of the comforters but I was very comfortable and warm (but not too warm). Our room had a balcony that overlooked the marina and pool. There was plenty of storage in the room for clothes between drawers and the closet. There was a work desk with data ports for working but we set up a bar on the table. The room was a tad tight with the beds and furniture but was very doable for just two in the room. The bathroom was of good size and had a large vanity. The shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water. The amenities were nice. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was expensive and the service was very slow and the food was warm. Next time I might eat breakfast elsewhere. We almost had dinner in the sports bar but it was just too expensive for foo-foo-ish bar food so we took the car out of parking and drove to downtown to eat. Self parking was $22 per day, ouch. And being on Shelter Island, you pretty much had to drive everywhere else to eat or have drinks if you didn't want to pay the prices at the hotel. Internet in your room was like $14 or you could go down to the lobby for free wifi or use their business center. We did not use the pool or fitness center. We did take a taxi downtown one night and that cost was about $18 after tip. I really like this hotel but it's too far from downtown. It's really close to the airport, though. If I needed an airport hotel I'd certainly stay here. But next time I think we'll stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent But Not Impressive”
Reviews.Author: TXScooby
Reviews.Content: Spent 5-days at the Sheraton for a combination trade show and time off with wife. Found the hotel for a good rate. Not disappointed but nothing exceptional. The hotel is right across from the airport. It is on a little island that is mainly marinas and though very close to lots of airport activity, you get a great sense of being away from the hustle and noise. You can see water regardless of where your room is. Our room looked out "front" from the older tower (there are two actual hotels in the complex). On the 3rd floor and we looked right across a small bay at the end of Coronado Island and the Navy facilities. Very pretty and relaxing. We had a small balcony and spent several nights enjoying a cocktail before bed looking out over the water. The area was very good for long walks along the water with great paved trails and landscaping. Great for walking and running. We walked to several local restaurants on the island and always felt invigorated. the rooms are in big need of renovation. We were in the older tower and you could tell. From what I understand the newer tower had just gone through a renovation and the older tower was next. Could not be soon enough. The room was loud and 70's throughout. The bathroom was dingy and needed updating badly. Housekeeping was very good and not saying the rooms were dirty - just older. The location deserves a little better hotel. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Location is great for any business near the airport or downtown. I had a convention and was within a 15-minute cab ride of the conventions center and the awesome old district downtown. If you can get a cheap rate, this is not a bad place. If you are looking for more upscale, keep searching.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Nice People, Absurd Fees, Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: thegov
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a value, don't come here. I booked a room at about $165.00 a night, thinking that was a decent rate for the area. However, once I got here, I was getting soaked left and right in absurd fees. Some good examples are $22/day for parking, and for breakfast, your only option is one downstairs restaurant with a lovely $17 egg dish!! On top of all that, I had to pay $18/day for high speed internet! In this economy and competitive market, I find it ridiculous to go to a hotel and have to pay this for web access. The views are very nice, but the location is basically right on top of the airport, so be prepared to listen to take offs and landings on a regular basis. And if you don't have a car, there is really no way to walk to an affordable local restaurant or store. On the plus side, all of the staff here were very very nice and friendly. My views of the harbor were great, and there are some good walking/running paths around the hotel and harbor. The room seemed to be renovated and updated, and was clean and comfortable. If this location can get with the year 2009+ and offer a nice breakfast buffet, free internet, and free parking, I would probably stay here again. Right now, no way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Fabulous Stay for our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: devinetravels
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Hotwire. After the name was revealed, I came to Trip Advisor, read the reviews and thought my anniversary trip was doomed. Of course, since I could not cancel it, we went and our experience was GREAT! We stayed in the Marina tower and the 8th floor. Our check-in was great! The customer service was excellent. The woman that checked us in told us upfront about the parking fees. She gave us alternative ways and costs to travel, let us check in at 11:00 am, and gave us a room with a great view! The concierge was fantastic. She suggested a great place for us to have lunch outside the hotel. The hotel was clean, beautiful, and quiet. We travel almost every weekend on business, so we know great hotel service. I was very pleased with the Sheraton. They treated us like we paid full price on the top level. I look foward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service & Price Gouging”
Reviews.Author: queenhearts
Reviews.Content: Stay clear of this dump if you want to be ripped off with horrible customer service. We stayed on Xmas Eve and were hit with a $22 parking fee, even as a guest at the hotel. The hotel is next to a noisy airport so I guess they think all their guests are business travelers who don't care about parking fees since their company will pick up the tab? But we were just regular tourists. So I walk in the room and find an open can of Diet Pepsi inside the mini frig. I called the front desk so I wouldn't be charged and she asked "did you move ANYTHING in the frig?" I said, "Yes, I moved some stuff around to fit in our own snacks from home". And she said we'd be charged for everything that was touched, because it's all sensored. WTF? She insisted with her snotty "tough luck--you will be charged--nothing I can do" attitude until I asked to speak to a manager. The manager said they would waive the mini bar charges. Well gee thanks... A week later, when we checked our credit card, it was all screwed up with charges that weren't removed from the mini bar and charging us twice for parking @ $22 a night (when we were only there 1 night). It took 4 phone calls to correct our bill. Idiots! Another issue was the loud rumbling noise from the airport, not to mention their heaters in the room. It sounded like a freight train. Oh, and breakfast...Their menu prices are outrageous! Two (2) lousy pancakes are $15 bucks!, and that doesn't include anything-no egg, no bacon, no juice--just 2 pancakes. We have traveled the world and stayed at some beautiful high class places, but this hotel truly was the pits. I would never, in a million years, go back. The employees were so rude--maybe they were all pissed off that they had to work on Xmas?

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel....at least the Bay Tower where Priceline guest stay”
Reviews.Author: HuskerJets
Reviews.Content: I was pretty concerned about staying at this Hotel after reading reviews from other guest. I was a Priceline guest and was placed in the Bay Tower. The hotel staff offered me an upgrade to the Marina Tower or a higher floor in the Bay Tower for an additional fee which I declined. If you’re looking to be within walking distance to the downtown area or Gaslamp district, this is not going to be your best bet. The room was decent size and nicely decorated but this hotel is definitely not a 4 Star Hotel. I’ve never stayed in a 4 Star hotel that had carpet stains in the lobby and in the rooms. Maybe they should use their $22 per day parking fees and hire a carpet cleaner for the hotel. Overall this hotel did have a bed, bathroom, and working shower but definitely not a 4 Star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Took the dog and all went smooth”
Reviews.Author: KathrynA47
Reviews.Content: Great views , great service! I had my doubts about bringing our German Shepherd on her first hotel stay but I could not have asked for a more lovely experience. All the staff were flexible and kind. We stayed two nights and on night two , noisier people moved into the room next to us and I knew our dog might bark so they quickly moved us to a beautiful more remote room, not an upgrade but just as equally as nice a room as we had before. THe views are spectacular from the high floors. The beds are super comfy and the elevators were super fast unlike what I had read in others reviews. The food was great, better than I expected. It was a perfect stay and I will definetly be going back for more trips since my son lives nearby. I would recommend trying for the rooms on the upper floors if you appreciate the good views. The room we had facing west had a bit of jet fuel smell since the jets take off with their tails aimed right at the hotel sliders. The view was so nice though , shutting the door stopped the smell from coming in and subsequently all jet noise as well. The room facing East had no residual jet fuel smell. It was fun watching the jets take off and land. I would recommend this hotel to couples and couples with kids , people of all ages and people with friendly , well behaved dogs.

Reviews.Title: “This is how hotels should be”
Reviews.Author: Umply
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff that makes you feel welcome and comfortable from the moment you walk up tot he registration desk until you check out. Comfortable free access WiFi area, gorgeous views from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport but Not Much Else”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a bit by accident, but got a pretty good rate. I reconfirmed directly with the hotel by email, requesting the main tower, ocean view. We did get main tower but view of downtown which was OK. Room was pretty standard with the Sheraton beds, which were a pleasure to sleep on. On 2 nights, the fire alarms went off in the middle of the night - with guests piling out into the parking lots. 25 minutes later we were allowed back in. Fire Dept. took 15-20 minutes to get there. Not so much as an i am sorry from hotel management. Some guests were demanding compensation. The hotel was busy with some Navy function going on and some conferences. We did not eat in the hotel but did stop for drinks in the lobby bar. What we like: the pool and hot tub which we used, a Starbucks on site but too busy with long lines so did not stop, convenience to airport. What we did not like: the parking lot for guests as we must be after thoughts for or the hotel as general visitor parking is same lot. We could not find a stall one night because the Navy guys took every space. Were paying $22.00 a day for??? The lot was gravel where we ended up parking. Overall the stay was OK but we would not stay here again. Other than proximity to the airport it is not convenient to anything and is on the dead end peninsula from the airport. It is not 4 stars no way but is a solid 3.

Reviews.Title: “If you are attending a conference here - stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Brit13
Reviews.Content: Overpriced rooms in horrible locations for conference guests and poor customer service. Showed no consideration towards me as a lone female business traveller. Paid conference rate (only $10 less than rack rate) and dumped in a ground floor room looking out onto the parking lot with the taxi rank directly outside my window. Asked to move rooms (based on my safety concerns) and was told there were no other rooms available even though there were plenty still advertised online. After much discussion got moved to another room (still ground floor) but at least this time without the taxi rank infront of the window. Requested breakfast to be delivered to my room, waiter refused to leave it outside the door as I had to sign for it, no bathrobes are provided in the room so had to answer the door in my pyjamas. Am glad I hadn't already got into the shower before he came as there would be no way i'd open that door in just a towel. Placed a do not disturb sign on my door, and was awoken by a phone call at 9am from the cleaner asking what time I was planning on leaving so that she could clean my room. The next morning she just walked into my room without even knocking, luckily I was already dressed.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dustmight
Reviews.Content: I don't look like the typical business traveler so I tend to get substandard service at most hotels. The service at this hotel was exemplary and I plan on staying here whenever I return to San Diego. I was born and raised in San Diego and am familiar with all areas and hotels therein and I still choose to stay at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: CASUNLOVER_7
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Travelzoo and booked it through Starwood which I think is the parent company. I got a great deal and was able to pick the Marina tower on a high floor. I read the reviews and I was worried that I wouldn't get what I had booked but that was not the case. The person checking us in was very friendly and helpful! We got a room on the 11th floor facing the marina and bay. It was beautiful! The room was very well appointed and appeared to be recently re-decorated. Some of the reviews had mentioned that they heard the airport noise and people above and below but we did not find this to be the case at all. It was very quiet. We stayed the weekend before Thanksgiving and I had asked how full the hotel was and the desk person said it wasn't full. We had a wonderful time and enjoyed going for a jog along the bay in the morning. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and would definitely suggest the marina tower.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: legouge
Reviews.Content: Stayed there again last September for a conference. I was given a room in the Bay Tower this time, and was a little worried because of some not-so-good reviews. My room on the seventh floor was large, clean and had a great view of the Bay. I had large palm trees swaying back and forth right off my balcony, which made it a little more serene. Although I had to walk to and from the main hotel where the conference was taking place, I enjoyed the surroundings and peacefullness.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy and shifty”
Reviews.Author: Ronmako
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend and toddler over Thanksgiving weekend. We were lucky to get a room in the newly renovated building. The room was clean and the view of the marina was nice. This hotel is very large and on this weekend was playing host to a lot of soccer teams. Kids were running up and down the halls until late at night. Apparently this hotel also allows them to stay in rooms without adults as we had the pleasure of rooming next to a few of them. When asked if they could keep it down we got knocks on our door with the subsequent sound of feet running away a few times. To get to our room we had to walk by the hot tub which, though large, was packed with teenagers every night. We didn't care to use it but if you do this may be important. My biggest concern was that upon my return home I discovered missing clothes from my luggage. Clothes that were packed in my suitcase the day before checkout but prior to the last room cleaning. I did not think to look through my luggage again on checkout day. The hotel couldn't do anything for me when contacted by phone and they did not respond to an email. I understand locking up your valuables when you travel but if a traveler has to worry about their clothes a hotel has a serious problem with its staff. Also, there is a $22/day parking fee. They do tell you this up front but in case you weren't paying attention to the details. All in all, no matter how clean the rooms are or how nice the view is (and that is not guaranteed) the stress of wondering when the kids are going to quiet down is just not worth it. And certainly not at the added cost of missing luggage.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Sheraton on harbor island”
Reviews.Author: jlnskn
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute change in our hotel before coming to spend two extra days before our cruise. The change to the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina helped to make our make our vacation a very enjoyable experience. We had a room with a bay view and with the great weather during our stay just great. To be able to see all the ships coming in and out was a new experience for us. Our friends that traveled with us just kept thanking me for making the change. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and made sure we had all we needed. Thanks again, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Snippy valet and front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: tishy56
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk had an attitude. The valet was condescending and dismissive when I asked him when my car was going to be parked. It was just sitting there and was almost scratched by a big SUV. This occurred at the bay tower. The room had an excellent view of the bay but there is no insulation between floors and walls. You hear EVERYTHING from the people above and the neighbors next to you. This is not a place you would stay on vacation. It's convenient if you have a business event because you are minutes from the hotel. The sofa was dirty and stained.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff. Great Location. Great View. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: thebee007
Reviews.Content: It's a little far from San Diego downtown, but the views (especially if you can swing a Bay View room) are gorgeous. We preferred staying at the Bay Tower instead of the Marina Tower because it gave us a small hotel feel. The Marina Tower is good if you want ambience for business meetings. Nice, clean, comfortable rooms and a super friendly staff made our stay great. Highly recommended. The one reason to take away any points is the over-priced parking. Sheraton needs to reconsider this unreasonable surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: All in all a good value for money hotel. We had been travelling for 15 hours straight, so it very nice to know that the hotel was only minutes away. The downside is that you can hear aircrafts taking off from around 6:30am until late in the evening - but I do not think that there are many places in San Diego where you are unable to hear the aircrafts. That aside, the location is actually fantastic. ½ hour stroll and you are in town. Excellent walking or running along the front of Harbor Island. Not too many other amenities, a couple of restaurants, hotels and some small shops. The hotel itself (Marina) was very nice. The room was an adequate size for the family. The extractor fan in the bathroom could be made a bit quieter though. Good amenities. Excellent room service meals. Good restaurant and even a Starbucks (if you like that sort of thing). Staff were very helpful. Swimming pool was a bit cold for my liking, but the jaccuzi made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Overall--okay”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nites in Marina Towers (there are two at this property) which had been updated recently. I was leading a two-day conference at the hotel. The rooms are nicely updated. Comfortable bedding, adequate counter space in bath, big shower head in bath (no makeup mirror) and flatscreen TV. Starbucks in the lobby a bonus. Conference room for 25 people had no windows and was dated--not that clean--I had to ask them to vacuum the room. However all request were promptly addressed. The conference breakfast and lunch buffets were very good--fresh food, good choices, good presentation. Great conference staff. Hotel Bar--one dinner--the service on the food was very slow and the food was basically marginal grill fare. Minutes from the airport--would recommend for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Marina needs to learn the meaning of customer service!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSylvia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Sheraton Marina to celebrate our anniversary. When making our reservation, I was told we could check-in as early as noon since the hotel was not full. We arrived at 3:00pm (1 hour before check-in time) and were told that our room was not quite ready yet. At 4:00 I went back to the desk to remind them we were waiting and they again said our room was not quite ready, but we could switch to a room with 2 smaller beds if we wanted. We finally were given the keys to our room at 5:00 after spending 2 hours waiting in and around the lobby! I wished they could have told us the room wouldn't be ready for 2 hours when we first arrived, and we would have left to do something fun. The next morning, I called the front desk to ask for a late check-out and was told that they could not do that. I reminded them that they kept us waiting when we checked in, and they said we could stay 30 minutes longer. I was very surprised that they didn't even give us coupons for a free drink at the bar to make up for our inconvenience. If they gave us a coupon for free breakfast, I would have been completely satisfied, and I wouldn't be writing this! Other than that, the room was nothing special, except that we had an amazing view of the nightly fireworks at Sea World. The breakfast buffet was delicious, but expensive. San Diego has so many lovely hotels that I don't know how the Sheraton will stay in business if they treat their customers this way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nightriderPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Super price on Priceline. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Can WALK to the airport. Run along the bay. Close to downtown and old town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Very nice but $$$ Parking”
Reviews.Author: mattlenderman
Reviews.Content: landed a room here for 2 nights from Priceline for $75/night...place was really nice, and i loved having the Starbucks inside...good news we were put on a high floor, with a Marina view but bad news is we got stuck w/ 2 double beds...of course that's to be expected when booking through Priceline, but my wife and I got over it. It was way nice for the price, so no complaints there. The rooms were very nice, but the room we had was somewhat small. Maybe if it was a king bed it would've felt roomier, but compared to our previous hotel it was a bit tight, but not bad for the 2 nights we were there. The hotels in a very convenient spot to the airport, and is somewhat centralized with the beaches just a few short miles away, and the zoo/downtown about the same distance in the other direction. The beds were VERY comfortable I will say. Out of the 3 hotels we stayed at during the week of our vacation, the beds here were our favorite. I gave this hotel a 4 out of 5 stars because: The 3 biggest downfalls for us was the cost of parking, no free Wi-Fi in the room, & no fridge...for $22/day you'd think you'd get valet, but no valet is $28/day. It’s really pointless to pay for valet when the valet parking lot is right beside the standard lot. I know paying to park is pretty standard in SD, but $22/day is just getting up there. You'd think for that kinda money to park they'd at least give you free Wi-Fi in the rooms, but only place you're getting it is downstairs. For us, using Skype and talking to family on the webcam is quite pointless downstairs in front of everyone! Lol Far as having no fridge, well, you get the mini bar area in the room which costs $$$$ plus it's not even cold so. Not to mention if you DID get caught putting anything in there, they charge a $25 cleaning fee. When traveling I always like having a fridge, but I bought a cooler I brought with me just incase I ran into a room w/o one.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: snmmankee
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed in our stay at this hotel. We booked because of the 3 pools, one being a kids pool, and for the water taxi to Seaport Village. Come to find out upon check in that 2 of the 3 pools were closed and the water taxi didn't really pick up at thier hotel! They also had over half of thier elevators under construction, resulting in 10 minute wait to get to and from your room and there are no childrens TV channels offered(nickelodeon) unless you want to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Best french fries at Quinns!”
Reviews.Author: techconfgoer
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here for the DEMO tech conference in September. Room was mid-sized (if size is a priority, try the Sheraton Suites Symphony Hall) but very comfortable. The wired Internet cost $12 a nite and was on the slow side (maybe I'm spoiled with Verizon FIOs at home), which did impede my work. Amenities were great. Each of the two towers has its own, huge gym (very modern equipment) and pool. I had a burger and fries at the bar, Quinns, and I must say they were very good, esp. the fries (fat, creamy, semi-skinned wedges with just the right amount of seasoning). Location is pretty - right on the water near the airport and rental car places - and great if you want to spend a dirty weekend with a sig other and only occasionally emerge to take leisurely walks along the water. You do need to cab into downtown for a broad food selection, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BostonsNick
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I enjoyed our 4-night stay here. Right next to the airport, free shuttle, but no noises. We had very good view of the bay, airport and downtown. Coming from Boston, a walking city, San Diego is even better. Seaport village was great walk enjoying the Midway, artworks, marinas with expensive yatches, shopes and very good, romatic seafood restaurant. We walked the gaslamp quarter with restored architecture of the old buildings, restaurant-lined 4th, 5th & 6th streets sining while people watching. All these for $10 & $15 cab rides from the hotel. Sea world is also $15 cab ride away. Don't do the zoo, we were disappointed. We thought San Diego is whole lot better than LA, San Fran or Sacromento. The hotel Quinn sport restaurant served very good foods. I liked very much the Pacific seafood chowder, baby back ribs and grilled salmon. We were filled at full buffet breafast. Per the rating above, we had problems with the waiter at the Harbor edge restaurant for buffet breakfast. The man had attitude as if we shouldn't be eating any food at all. He acted as if he did not want to serve OJ and coffee. He served as he attempting to kick us out. It's a $21 breakfast buffet after all, not $5. We enjoyed the meal but did not come back for second breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I was checked in someone else's room by mistake and entered while they were there.”
Reviews.Author: MistyMayBeyonce
Reviews.Content: After entering an already occupied room with my children (that were worried entire trip if this would happen to us) we had to go down with the ONLY working elevator in that wing of the Marina Tower that took about 15-20 minutes. This time we were given another room. When we went up our key didn't work. While we were going down on the elevator we saw our luggages going down too. The bell boy said it's because he was given yet another wrong room number. After spending over an hour of going up and down finally we settled. The room was nice with a great view. However we were so tired of all this that basically we couldn't do much that day. Now I wouldn't be so upset if they offered something to make up for it however no such gesture was made. They did not even apologized properly. We stayed there numerous times for the convenience of water sports and the view. If I was managing this hotel I would do everything to make up for this sort of inconvenience, So great hotel with not very polite staff. Parking is very expensive. Also for a pet friendly hotel it is strange that she was not allowed at the very casual patio style restaurant by the pool. Because of this we could never dine with entire family. By the way the food was so bad (curry chicken) that I got sick to my stomach. At another trip my husband ended up having the same result with anothert dish. It was surprisingly quiet since it was by the Airport. However since our room was at the end of one wing. We either had to walk a long way to get the main elevators or wait for the only working elevator at our wing that wasted a good chunk of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with great views”
Reviews.Author: skigirlnh
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Sheraton with a room in the Bay Tower. After reading the previous reviews, I had hoped for the Marina Tower, but we had a great rate per night and ended up in the Bay Tower. The shuttle at the airport was prompt, and check-in was a breeze. We were upgraded to a room on the 9th floor in the Bay Tower and the views were great. We actually enjoyed staying in the Bay Tower because it was very quiet, even though we spent a lot of time over at the Marina. We never even saw the pool at the Bay Tower. The fitness center at the Marina is great and the pool is a nice size. There is food service poolside, and our waiter was very good. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but went to Papanani's every morning next to the marina and enjoyed the views and a good breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay, and there were only a couple of problems. Sheraton needs to change their comforters. They are so HEAVY. It reminded me of a visit to the dentist when they put the lead apron over you before they take x-rays. I can't believe Sheraton has not addressed this. Also, there was a lot of dirt on the decking around the pool. Other than that, we had a very nice time . We would definitely stay here again with a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for couples but not families....”
Reviews.Author: tmock13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay but not as great as some of the reviews I've read. First of all, no kids cable channels(Cartoon network, Nickelodeon, Disney) available which made the evenings a little boring for the little ones. Fortunately, we had a room on the seventh floor with a great view of the harbor and the swimming pool. The swimming pool is very nice and the pool area is relaxing. The food in the pool area is surprisingly good but a bit pricey. But hey, you're on vacation. Also, there wasn't an arcade room which my kids keep asking for. Again, not much for kids to do. The complaint I keep seeing is the Parking. Yes, it is expensive with $22/day for self parking or $28/day valet parking. I opted for the valet parking for the duration of my stay (5 Nights). I soon found out that the valet parking was costing me much more than $28/day with the constant and expected tipping whenever you need your car. If you wanna save, don't go this route since the self parking is a very short walk to the entrance. Overall, the hotel was okay. Didn't expect it to be so close (practically next door) to the airport. I would not stay here again when I cime back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this terrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: yanks2
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was absolutely terrible. We were staying in the Marina tower for a wedding at the hotel. Upon arrival we were put on the fourth floor, which is fine, however the room window faced a brick wall with very limited light and no view - this is fine for a business trip, but not for a vacation at a hotel that brands itself as a "hotel and marina". This was also the only room in the hotel with this view. I went down the the lobby to request a room change and the hotel staff said they would not change it. I asked to speak with a manager and the front desk manager, Lynne, told me that it is against their policy to change people's rooms regardless of reason. I was not asking for a better room, nor was I asking for a higher floor, simply another (equal) room on the same floor. She said that they had none available. That is fine, but there was no offer of another room on a different floor. I asked for the courtesy of being moved to a different floor and was told they would be happy to upgrade me at no fee however they had no king beds available on any other floor for the weekend. I found this hard to believe, so I came back again and asked if I could be upgraded to another room if I paid the difference - suddenly a room was available. This simply revealed a blatant lie by the hotel manager, Lynne, which I do not appreciate. When I pointed this out, she said that she could not accomidate me at the same rate. I very much wanted to enjoy my vacation so I agreed to pay the extra money to move, however when we went to the new room it smelled strongly of smoke (in a smoke free hotel). I asked to be moved again and was told no, and asked for it to be cleaned to get rid of the smell. They sent someone up, but it did not help and the smell did not go away all trip. Lastly, housekeeping did not come to make up the rooms until at least 5pm each day, which is when I called the desk and demanded someone be sent up to clean the room. As a person who spends more than 150 nights per year in hotels, the service and hospitality at this hotel is among the worst I have seen, and the hotel management, especially Lynne, is an embarrasment to the Starwood brand.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: PantheraOnca
Reviews.Content: Upon checked in, they gave us a traditional room wth a parking lot view even though we paid for a water view room through an online third party service. My spouse called CS then eventually went to the front desk & spoke with a manager. After an hour of "this & that," they transferred us to a different tower, and gave us a bigger room with a beautiful view of the bay & marina. We are very delighted. We don't have any complaint about the service since they brought our luggages to the new room, and the staff are friendly & helpful. The only set back was the parking which is $22.00 per night for self-parking & $28.00 for valet. And, also the beverages in the room were pricey, $5.00 for a small bottled water, and $7.00 for a bottle of Gatorade. My suggestion is bring your own beverages. And, most of all, spend a full day or two in Balboa Park. We will, for sure, next time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: peppermb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August, and I have to say it's a nice hotel. Our room was on the 10th Floor in the Marina Tower overlooking the Bay/Marina/Pool. Every room has a balcony. The other side of the Marina Tower faces the parking lot/downtown. If you're not on a high floor you will not have any view at all. The other Tower was down the street, appeared to be a totally separate hotel and probably was at one time. I used the free internet in the lobby a few times as I forgot my laptop. It was tough to find a computer that wasn't occupied, they were only a few of them and they were busy pretty much all the time. But it was great they had computers for their guests, it was a nice touch. The location was good, but we were glad we had our car for the short drive to Gaslamp, Little Italy and other places downtown. Although this hotel is very close to the airport we hardly ever saw or heard any planes at all. I was pleasantly surprised and would stay at Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end our summer”
Reviews.Author: mdlvc
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel and stayed for 3 nights (August 9-12). We had a low floor room with a partial view of the pool. We initially started with a room facing the parking lot but after a quick stop at the desk, we were transferred on the other side with the pool view. The staff is friendly and corteous. Rooms were cleaned meticulously. Best thing about the hotel? starbucks in the lobby (for sleepless parents like us). We had a great time lounging around in the pool. They also have a great fitness facility with lots of activities for families. They rent out bikes, lend out ping pong rackets, a tennis court and everything you could possibly think of. I was able to use their spa service and had an excellent massage. They offer facials too and all services priced reasonably. Their spa is not really the type of spa that you go in to relax but it has more of the fitness club feel with showers and sauna. Hopefully they have a real spa lined up in the future. The only thing I could complain about is the Harbor's edge restaurant, for some reason, someone overlooked the fact that there are no ramps to get to the dining area. This restaurant is off of the main lobby of the hotel and only has steps to lead down to the tables. The hotel must have been aware of this oversite because all the staff are always kind enough to offer to lift the stroller for you. They also forgot to put down a ramp to access the main pool on the marina tower so you have to go around and take the elevator down. By the way, did i mention $22/day for parking? we didnt mind since it's like that pretty much anywhere in San Diego, for the rate that we got, it's still a deal. Other than that, it was a great stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Imagine Staying Here By Choice”
Reviews.Author: bg217
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline for two nights in San Diego at two different hotels. Got both for around $70, one at Hilton Gaslamp (which was GREAT) and one here. First, it has been noted in the reviews that they treat Priceline/Hotwire customers differently. I also found this to be true -- and I think it is a silly way to do business, since we are more likely (in my opinion) to go squawk about our experiences on the internet. But anyway... Yes, we were placed in the Bay Tower, which they called the West. We were on the fourth floor -- which was really the third -- and we overlooked the parking lot. Lovely. Yes, there was some water and city views beyond, but with the parking lot three floors below it is hard to enjoy. Tried to take a dip after check-in at 8:30 PM... all towels gone and the pool a bit murky. The room looked nice, but had a few issues. One, there was no information in the room about the hotel services, cost of internet, location of amenities -- nothing. We had to call to find out about all of these things. Do they charge for the coffee and tea? I still don't know. Though I do know that if you put personal items in the minifridge they will charge you a $25 cleaning fee. Really. Two, and I have not seen this mentioned here before, but the duvet, while attractive, weighed about two hundred pounds. The only way I can imagine sleeping with it would be if the room was ice cold --- which brings us to problem three. I set the air conditioner on the coldest possible setting and it was still relatively balmy in there. Could only sleep with a sheet, and it was very hard to sleep. Four, the toilets flush with incredible force, which is fine... but you also hear all the toilets flushing in all neighboring rooms. All night. Five, of course, the parking is a racket. The existence of this hotel would make me nervous to do Priceline for San Diego again. And finally, I didn't take it seriously, but the Bay Tower really is far, far away from the Marina tower. I think it is disingenuous for them to both be a part of the same hotel since they are so separate. It's misleading and, I think, borderline deceitful.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Alarms went off three times in two days, today at 4 am..”
Reviews.Author: luckykeno
Reviews.Content: The American Society of Civil Engineers Pipeline Division annual meeting is being held here (since Saturday.) 527 registrants. Fire alarm and evacuation yesterday am about 10:00 am, all meeting rooms evacuated, scared hotel guests, etc. Then the fire alarm went off at 4:10 am this am (Tuesday 18th), about the time we had some clothes on they anounced "we have investigated there is no fire", then at 10:30 this am the fire alarm went off for the third time in two days, all meeting rooms evacuated, etc. technical presentations disrupted, Front desk is playing dumb, don't know anything, etc. We will NEVER stay at this hotal again. I can assure you!!! This is the Society's third San Diego meeting in the last twelve years, I doubt if the members will ever vote for THIS hotel again, my wife was terrified here on the 11th floor at 4 am. We are 75 and 76 years young and my wife could never make it down 11 flights of stairs, she is.afraid to go to sleep tonight on this 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: amendola_mario
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night nut it was enough to say that it's a very nice hotel...The hall and the rooms are very elegant, although not roomy. Increible sightseeing, on one side there is the bay and on the other side the ocean. There is a nice outdoor swimming pool and internet point in the hall.The location is a good for the airport (walking distance) and the bay, but few miles away from San Diego city center. The price wasn't bad, 120 $ for a two double beds room. There is the possibility to park the car, but it's not cheap. It's a very nice hotel, which I'd recommend if not full price

Reviews.Title: “Not good for the money”
Reviews.Author: ISqueek
Reviews.Content: 8/1/09-8/4/09 Pros: The location was beautiful, nice pool, walk along the marina, clean room... Cons: Construction, Elevator broken all 3 days, No free kids TV channels. $22/nite to park. Some staff was rude to my wife. Even at the hotwire price of $105, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience after some Tweaking”
Reviews.Author: Wetwotravel2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina for three weeknights in July. We had an awesome experience but only after we did some tweaking of our room location. We booked through Hotwire at a rate of $114 and upon arriving at the Marina Tower (there are two towers - the Marina and the Bay - around the corner from each other) the valet politely informed us we were in the Bay Tower. After reading the previous reviews we expected this as it appears the Bay Tower is used for their Hotwire and Priceline customers. We arrived in the beautiful Bay lobby and were informed our "standard" room was either on the first floor in the back of the tower facing the marina or on the second floor in the front of the tower which was level with the parking lot. We choose to look at the first floor room and found a very large, very clean room with floor to ceiling windows that didn't open, a walkway right outside the windows and a beautiful view of the marina. The second story room, although we didn't go into the room, had a balcony but looked right onto the parking lot and then the bay. We didn't like the idea of feeling trapped with windows that didn't open, the lack of privacy with a walkway just outside the windows or staring at cars so we asked for a room higher up. We were informed we were only entitled to a first or second story room and that we'd need to pay $20 a night (plus taxes) to move up. We decided to upgrade and asked to be moved to the Marina tower. The Bay Tower's rooms are large, the pool is very nice, and there's free wi-fi in the lobby, a breakfast room and a business center. The two towers are about a 5 minute walk around the marina and is quite lovely. Perhaps in bad weather it would not be so pleasant. The Bay Tower is a lot quieter if that's what you are looking for. The Marina Tower is where the action is. Our Marina Tower room was on the 9th floor overlooking the pool and the marina. FABULOUS! The small balcony was wonderful and when we closed the sliding doors we could barely hear the airplanes. The room was large (not quite as large as the Bay Tower), very clean, beautifully decorated, and with a good sized bathroom. We enjoyed Happy Hour and a beautiful sunset at the Shoreline Restaurant next to the pool, then dinner at Quinn's, the pub that overlooks the pool and marina. The pub had decent prices and good food and wasn't dark like you'd expect a pub to be. There were two billiard tables for their customers to use. There are two pools in the Marina tower, the main one which is large and next to the Shoreline and the other is smaller and quieter. There are hamocks to relax on and rocking chairs around a fire pit. Harbor Island is flat so it's great for walking and running. I rented a bike one morning ($7 an hour, 4th hour free) and totally enjoyed riding along the water to the Star of India, USS Midway and Seaport Village. I felt very safe as I never had to be on the road with the cars and it only took 25 minutes to get to Seaport Village. The $20 upgrade was well worth it as we loved our room and the view it offered. The elevators were slow, in fact two of the days one of the elevators was being working on but we didn't mind much. We enjoyed the free US Today newspapers and the Starbucks coffee and tea in the rooms. Parking is $22 a night but it seems to be the going rate in the downtown area. We've stayed at other downtown hotels and have paid that amount and more to park. If you don't have a car taxis are readily available (at least at the Marina Tower, I'm not sure about the Bay Tower). Being right next to the airport would be very handy if you have an early morning flight as the Sheraton has a free shuttle, doesn't feel like an airport hotel and yet you are so close. The only negative thing I can say about the Sheraton was how they initially made us feel since we booked with Hotwire. My husband and I have booked a number of hotels through Hotwire and never before have we been made to feel "cheap" or told " . . because you booked through Hotwire . . ." Our past experience is that if a hotel has available rooms it will upgrade us at no charge and there's never any mention of who we booked through. It appears that Sheraton sets aside the least desirable rooms for their "cheap" customers, in fact the entire first floor of the Marina tower had different lighting and lower ceilings than the other halls. I think the only windows that don't open are those on the first floor on the Bay Tower so that's why they are given to the Hotwire and Priceline customers. All in all, a great experience and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with GREAT views!”
Reviews.Author: Lorio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego for five days in July as a quick summer get-a-way - I do love this hotel because of the location by the marina and it has more of a resort feel. Being close to the airport was no issue at all - I did't hear any planes! Some say it's too far out but it's only a $8 - $10 cab ride to downtown... we had a rental for a few days though too. Room very nice - clean, modern, bright colors and the bed comfortable. We had a room up very high up facing the marina and overlooking the pool. We enjoyed nice sunset while sipping a beverage on the patio. They have a fabulous pool and hot tub and the food was great at the restaurants. We found Quinns to be somewhat "cold" in feel and atmosphere but the other restaurant was great!!! Plus, they have a huge Starbucks on site. We enjoyed some delicous tapa's one night as well sitting a the lobby bar over wine. We enjoyed out stay and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: spinkid
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, I was skeptical. I was booked here for 8 days via work for a conference and it probably would not have been my first choice, that being said, if I was returning to San Diego and had a car rental I would certainly return here again. There are two towers, you want to be in the one with the main lobby and restaurants attached, the other is a short walk away, but still it is a walk. My room was actually in the Lanai wing wich is a 3 story area. I was skeptical of it based on the condition of the hallwyas which are open to the elements, but the room was wonderfully clean, nice bedding and pillows. Colleagues on the first level of the Lanai however reported a musty smell in their room and where nicely moved up to the 2nd floor which was fine. The "fancy" restaurant was a little overpriced, the pub, tapas bar, and outdoor pool bar all had decent food. You definitely need a car to stay here, even the other restaurants on Harbor island are a decent walk away. That being said, if you have a car it is easy access to Point Loma an downtown San Diego. You can get to the Gaslamp, Little Italy, Hillcrest, Convention Center, Harbor attractions and zoo with lots of ease. You can also hop on I-5 quite easily and get any place else you might need to go. There is a fee for parking, so be aware of that. The overall vibe of being right on the water is very nice, I chilled out on the hammocks, near the pool and even near the fire pits outside at night.

Reviews.Title: “Cant be beat for the Fourth of July!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCabron
Reviews.Content: Nice place, staff was cool. But as mentioned before here this is not a 4 star hotel. Three or 3.5 maybe. Dont get me wrong it was cool but not for the regular price. We got an $80 rate via priceline. If your there for the 4th of July it cant be beat, FRONT ROW SEATS! The pool was great. My biggest complaint was the out of this world parking fee of $22 per night. Prices for room service and the pub were pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: Zabidi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina and enjoyed my stay. I attended a conference in one of the two hotel towers. The rooms were comfortable and had a great view of the Marina and the pool area. The walk in the morning from the tower we stayed at to the one the conference was in was short and was along a beautiful walkway right by all the yachts. The only problem is that it was far from everything and would require a taxi. I took a taxi on one of the days and stoped by the pier to catch the double decker bus for a tour around town, that was fun and very informative!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not a Good Location for the Leisure Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Sandyago
Reviews.Content: Although we are San Diego locals, we'll occasionally spend a night downtown and play tourist. We use Priceline to save money and always get right downtown Gaslamp - until now. This time our bid "won" the Sheraton Harbor Island. For our purposes, it couldn't have been a worse location. Not only were we not within walking distance of anything but we had no public transportation options other than a taxi at $25-30 round trip to the Gaslamp. As an added pleasure the hotel charges a $22 to self park. A great example of going broke saving money. Having said that the hotel would be great for the business traveler who just needs an over night stay or has an early morning flight. We stayed in the Bay Tower and our room was clean and nicely updated. We had a harbor facing room which is also the side of the airport. I was concerned the flight noise would be a problem but it really wasn't. I will say though that the toilets flush with such force they could wake the dead! Upon checkin we attempted to get the Marina Tower as it is clearly the better tower in terms of things to do within the hotel but the Front Desk Clerk would have none of that. To her defense, they were full with a teacher's convention but she could have handled our request in a better manner. The Bay tower does have its own pool and fitness center both of which we took advantage. We hit the pool around 4:30pm - the pool attendent was gone as were all the pool towels. The fitness center was capable - the equipment was fairly new and there was enough variety to get in a decent cardio or weight workout. Would like to recognize the Valet attendent who took care of us when we were looking for cheaper parking options. We told him we were not going to park in the hotel and would move the car somewhere else after checkin. After getting settled, we went back down to get the car and he moved it to a free spot that opened up directly across the street. Nice Service!

Reviews.Title: “The good start to our too short 4th of July weekend”
Reviews.Author: Swirlz5
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel & Marina exceeded my expectations. We arrived on a 12pm flight and I was worried we'd be waiting around until 3 or 4 to check-in. I had called ahead a couple days and spoke with Melissa. She informed me we could use the pool and enjoy the hotel while we waited if our room was not ready. We were allowed to change in the Spa area and let our kids swim a while. I rented a large blow-up alligator for an hour ($7) that was their highlight. . .we only had it an hour before I received a call on my cell phone that our room was ready (it was shortly after 1pm!) I was very happy for the early check-in and even more happy to find we'd been upgraded to a two-story townhouse room in the Lanai building. The pool rental place let us return the gator and said we could return later to use up the remain hour I had paid for. There were a few downsides. After swimming a bit we arrived to our room barefoot and found the floor was quite damp. I can only imagine it had recently been shampooed. The doors to the outside had about a 2" gap between the bottom and the floor, plenty of room for bugs and such to crawl in but we were lucky and had none. Then there were two balconies. . the wood in dire need of staining and new chairs (current ones were old and dirty). Other then that we enjoyed having the downstairs for out two six yr olds on the pull out couch with their own tv, and my husband and I upstairs in a comfortable king with our own tv. There were two bathrooms, one with a shower/bath, also a coffee maker up and downstairs, and a small fridge and sink. This came in handy when we purchased some grocery items & beverages from Papanani's Deli, located between the Marina and Bay Towers. I highly recommend stopping at the deil. . the hotel charges $6 per bottle of beer and at the deli you can purchase a six-pack for $9, along with tasty sandwiches, cereal, and many other items at a fair price. The kids LOVED the Marina tower pool and the entire family enjoyed the Club Lounge on the Penthouse floor. The lounge was beautifully decorated and a decent variety of snacks in the evening and helpful lounge attendant (wish I had gotten his name - very nice). The breakfast also served in the Lounge the next morning was nicely stocked and plenty of room/quiet while we enjoyed the start to our day. We only stayed one night here (the hotel was full the 3rd & 4th) and after checking out we headed for the US Grant for 2 nights and off to Sea World. All in all we would definitely return to the Sheraton. (hopefully to dry floors, updated balconies/lanai's, and new doors that closed securely).

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tommyboy760
Reviews.Content: My wife and 5 years old just completed a 3 night stay at this hotel. The room was perfect, overlooking the 4th of July fireworks. The service was beyond finer hotels we have stayed at. Everyone was calling me by name, which I think is nice and personal. Whoever is running this hotel is doing a great job and deserves Kudos’s. I can't wait to book another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine with a special rate - not convinced worth paying more”
Reviews.Author: autoflex
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night in the Bay Tower, which seemed to be poor relation in terms of facilities, but was quite OK. I had a pre-paid rate of around $100 and would've been disappointed had I paid more or had had to pay for parking, a better view (mine was fine though, from 4th floor across the bay, from a wide balcony) and the other add-ons (see other reviews on this unsavoury aspect). The TV includes Showtime, but a very limited range of other cable channels (presumably to encourage guests to pay for their own movies etc). The room decor was superb - modern red-white-n-blue paintings; long sofa and expansive desk; footstools and coffee table. If anything, there was too much furniture in the room, but the bed positioned on a corner was definitely an interesting feature and helped give the room a different feel. A stray face-cloth from a previous guest and a faulty constantly-flashing message light on the phone [which the front desk tried but failed to correct, and then failed to follow-up with maintenance] were aspects that would have annoyed me had I been paying full rate, as would the absence of a Guest Services Guide (the tv-based version being unavailable). The ground floor pool was disappointing, failing to take advange of the hotel's position on the bay [it could've been anywhere in any city] and the pool area wasn't kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: FussyCosmo
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient and the staff are nice enough. Note that parking is around $20 a day. The nautical decor is very clean an fresh and suites the destination well. A couple issues worth mentioning: there was an unpleasant smell in the hallways... Not sure if it's what they use to clean the carpets or something else. Also, there was only one elevator in operation for my wing of the hotel. It sometimes took 15 minutes to get down to the lobby do to this fact. The hot tub was not hot in the morning... Definitely less than 100F. I would stay again but only with a nice discount.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - but not for per diem rates”
Reviews.Author: OldCountslur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the airport and a Sheraton shuttle arrives every 15.' The room was apparently deluxe, and seemed standard for the chain. Really beautiful view. Nice bed, very clean room with great housekeeping. What soured the 7 day stay was being declined on access to SPG lounge for continental breakfast because we are gold and not a platinum members, and no upgrade without payment of 28,000 points in a 1/2 empty hotel. The restaurant continental breakfast was 17.95 each, and a single Mojito ( a common drink) was 10.89. No accessable fridge, as any personal food would be removed and a $25 service fee applied. So no milk and cereal. No lower priced food nearer then the airport. so, we used the hotel to sleep and enjoyed leisurely meals in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel---- great location”
Reviews.Author: CaptianZAK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went out to San Diego for a week for R&R before he started a new job. This hotel was excellent.. The rooms were very clean and service was exceptional . The staff from the Pool waiter (Rob) to the Breakfast omelet man(Horatio) where very friendly and helpful. The fire pit at night by the bay was very relaxing with a glass of wine. I used the fitness center three times and everything worked and was in excellent condition.We ended up touring every morning, it is only a 10 minute ride to the zoo, old town, mission and ocean beaches, gaslamp,and sea world. We also hiked at Torey pine state park and visited La Joella . One day we drove to the dessert and hiked Palm oasis canyon hike and hike at state park in the mountains where the Ceder fire was still very evident.. The hotel was so centrally located to everything. The only thing we didn't do was go to Mexico.. They said it was too dangerous there for Americans. I would highly recommend this hotel.. now it's back to work in Pittsburgh... It was JUNE GLUME in San Diego but we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay, Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: fhfalcongirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was much more than we expected. Bay Tower is a 5 min walk from main hotel, but rooms are 33% bigger. Our room looked out over the water towards Coronado Bridge, Staff was awesome, everybody very nice and accomadating. Quinns had great food. Hotel was close to all fun things in San Diego. 3 Swimming pools, hammocks, Bar service at pool, computer station, My son played X box in the lobby. We had a great time and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a better stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTaveler
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina for the second time (June 20 - 24) and stayed in one of the charming Junior Suites in the Bay Tower. We had a wonderful direct view of the bay and all rooms in this tower come with a balcony and view of either the bay or the Marina. We consistently found the rooms to be maintained well, kept clean, the staff polite, friendly and very accomodating to special requests. This was our wedding anniversary and the Management Staff made it a special event. Now, iff the weather had just been as nice as hotel, this would have been the perfect visit. Be prepared to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience at the Sheraton San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea212007
Reviews.Content: I was completely impressed with the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina! I felt like I was staying at an exotic resort, but in actuality I was a stone's throw from the hustle and bustle of downtown San Diego! The staff was friendly and hospitable. They also informed me the hotel just went through a $35 million dollar renovation, and I could DEFINITELY tell! Each room had a beautiful view and incredible mahogany furnishings. I would without a doubt recommend the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina to anyone traveling to SD!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Brewsers2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to end our California vacation. Staff was very friendly. I requested an early check-in, and also requested the Marina tower (thanks to tips from TripAdvisor). Both were granted immediately with no questions or hassles. The Marina tower is definitely the place to be ... restaurant and nicer pool are there, although I did hear others say the Bay tower rooms are larger. Our room was about what we expected ... very clean with a great view of the pool and Marina. The beds were a little smaller than what we're used to however. My kids loved the large pool and hottub ... the pool is much larger and nicer than I would normally expcect at a hotel. It was cool during our stay, so the outdoor heating kiosks in the pool area were also nice. The hotel is also very near the airport. I returned my rental car the night before we checked out. The airport car rental return is literally across the street ... I walked about a quarter mile back to the hotel. The only negatives to this place are the cost of parking ($22/night) and the prices at the restaurant. The breakfast buffet was $22 for adults and $10 for kids. The only other place to eat within walking distance is a small cafe between the towers next to the marina, and they only serve breakfast and lunch. Also, no frig or microwave in the room, so it's difficult to bring your own food. Overall, however, this was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: smithiegirl02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a week long conference at the Convention Center. I also brought along my 3 yr old son and a girlfriend. We all found this hotel to be perfectly suited to our needs. We were in the Lanai Tower, which I know many have criticized. We were more than pleased with it. Honestly, the ONLY drawback was the condition of the carpet outside in the halls...but come on, what do you expect when it's open to the elements? Our room had recently been re-done (it was evident) and it was immaculately clean--I'm a complete germaphobe, so this should carry some weight. We also had access to a separate pool and hot-tub, which we all used and enjoyed a lot. As far as getting around was concerned, we did rent a car for the week so that we could visit San Diego attractions, such as the zoo and Sea World. Although $22 a day for parking sounds steep, it really isn't, considering it's $10 an HOUR in most San Diego locations. And a shuttle came promptly to the hotel every morning to go to the Convention Center, so that was super convenient, as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a business traveler (nice lobby internet/computer hub, too) or a family traveling with young children. Very, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: noel17
Reviews.Content: I got a room upgrade at the time of check-in. Our reservation was for the Marina Tower, lower floor, balcony, with limited view. the room we were given was on the 10th floor, facing the marina, a pretty view. we stayed only one night, mainly because we had a 6:35am flight. The hotel provides shuttle service to the airport that starts at 5am. It was a bit rushed for us, traveling with two young children. The room was nice, bright, and cozy. my main complaint, and unfortunately it would cause us not to stay again is that the blanket is made of some material that you can hear when the person's moving, and my kids' did a lot of tossing and turning, so i didn't get a good night's rest. We had dinner on site, forgot the name of it, it's the casual one. the food was good, so was the service. Even though the hotel is right next to the airport, we didn't hear anything from take-off or landing.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK IT - Exactly as pictured on website!”
Reviews.Author: K&E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay in room 555 at the Marina tower. It was exactly as pictured on the web site - very nautical and appeared to be recently remodeled. It was very clean and quiet. The room was a little smaller than a standard room but had a wonderful balcony with table and chairs. The bathroom was spotless and had been remodeled in the latest "spa" style. Our beds were extremely comfortable. We had a Starbucks in the lobby - a great convenience! But also discovered "Papa's" restaurante on the walk over to see the Bay tower. It is a GREAT little inexpensive place to get your breakfast or lunch. It even had a really nice outdoor seating area that was directly on the marina (we will definitely make this our breakfast place on our return trip). Don't bother with the hotel restaurant for breakfast - way overpriced. The food in the sports pub was awesome and a very comfortable space for gathering with our family for a drink - it has a great view of the marina. The hot tub pa and pool were beautiful. Unfortunately, the spa was not open during our stay. The only disappointment was how the staff handled the situation with the spa.They kept saying it was open - when it wasn't and never apologized for the inconvenience. They also had two fire pits with rocking chairs around it which were a huge hit with guests at night. The Bay tower is much smaller but a more direct view of the bay. It just didn't have that "vacation resort" feeling as much as the Marina tower. Free shuttle service was very efficient and reliable. The view from the hotel is spectacular and location to the airport couldn't be better for travelers. Overall, it was a fabulous stay and I will definitely return again. PS- this room was booked through a 3rd party internet company and I paid $79/night - a GREAT deal for such a beautiful spot. In a phrase.....Book it, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Experience from Booking Rep”
Reviews.Author: therese_9
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here yet but I decided to book elsewhere because of the bad experience from a booking representative at the hotel (Dena Crump). On the spg.com website, they advertised they will match the price +10% off if their price is higher than somewhere else. I had found a lower price on Expedia and was able to get this deal for a Club Room from spg. However, when I tried to book 2 more Club rooms Dena refused to honor this price, stating that the price on the web site is $99 for a basic room, the price for the Club Room is $50 more, which is the same as the price on Expedia. I repeatedly told her that spg.com states a price of $209 for the Club Room, it doesn't state $99 + $50 for the Club Room. She refused to acknowledge the price posted online. I could have booked the rooms on spg.com and appeal to spg for a price match but I was fed up with this booking representative that I decided to just cancel and went somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: BillandPattiLee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is practically in walking distance to the San Diego Airport. The views from some rooms are great, but other rooms have no view at all. To get to some of the rooms requires a long walk and you'll need your key to get back into the hotel. Food is only fair, but staff is courteous. $12 per day charge to park your car.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DaveLD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bay Tower for one night, booked by a travel agent for a conference I was attending. I really enjoyed my stay. I arrived at around 10 AM due to an early flight having worked through the night before boarding the plane. I was planning on just checking my bags and going out to explore the city. Amazingly, they had a room available and I was laying in the bed within minutes of arriving. It was great to spend the day resting. The room does have an interesting layout but it works well. Room feels spacious and was quite clean. One of the unique aspects is that each room has a balcony. Mine faced the marina and airport but I still appreciated the fresh air and sunlight. Loved the pool with the best aspect being that some of the lounge areas are semi-covered in case you do not want a lot of sun. I was able to comfortably nap by the pool without fear of burning myself. It is only a mile or so from the airport but I was not bothered by any noise even though my room faced the airport. If you are a light sleeper, it may be an issue for you. Try asking for a room facing the harbor. This location is not ideal for tourist activity. It is about a $15-20 cab ride to the Gas Lamp District if that gives you an idea. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. They were readily available with dining or entertainment options. I had a great stay at this location and would consider staying there again. However, if I was in San Diego to have fun and see the sights, I might find something a little closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfpen66
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel, the hotel gave us one room facing the marina and the other room across the hall faced the bay. Both views were fantastic. The rooms were very spacious and had a nautical theme. All of the staff treated us like we were royalty. We were only there for one night, but I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Room, Great Club Perks”
Reviews.Author: BKMPhoto
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Sheraton a few other times all in the Marina Tower, after a large charity event I coordinated in May of 2007 and again in May of 2008. The first room I stayed in was a Marina tower deluxe room with a great view of the marina. That was my favorite of the 3 I have been in, especially after the long night before. It was great sitting out on the balcony with a cup of coffee. Stay 2 was a also a deluxe room, and just as nice, although the view of the parking lot wasn't as nice as that of the marina. If you are staying for leisure, I recommend paying the extra for a marina view. I think it's worth it. During stay 3, we were given a club room, but ironically I enjoyed the deluxe rooms better. We originally reserved a king deluxe, but upon arrival were told we were upgraded to a club room. However, they gave us a double bed room. I just think it's strange having an extra, empty bed there. They must have been remodeling as well, which I hadn't seen any signs of in my previous stays. They were redoing the wallpaper on the floor we were on, which is fine, but there weren't any "pardon our mess signs" or taped off areas, so it just looked a little shabby, unlike the rest of the hotel. We did get a chance to have breakfast in the club lounge and that was fantastic. The lounge is beautiful and the breakfast was nice, albeit it being a hyped up continental breakfast. Overall, I've been pretty happy with Sheraton hotels. I recommend getting room service and ordering their seafood melt sandwhich. mmmm.
