This particular hotel has great catering and an executive chef, and I have been pleased with the large scale events I have held there as well. The staff are very courteous and attentive. Oh, and it's GREAT having a starbucks in the hotel as well. :) I'm hoping next time I have a chance to enjoy the hotel's other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay near San Diego airport”
Reviews.Author: Tarepanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Sheraton Bay Tower (the smaller Sheraton) which is about a 7 minute walk from the Sheraton Marina. I took the convenient shuttle from the airport which was literally just a 5 min drive to the hotel. The shuttle runs approx every 25 mins. I stayed in room 917, which was a King size room with a large balcony. The room had a pleasant nautical theme with reds, blues and white. The bed was very comfy with white paneling around the bed. The room was outfitted with a sofa and armchair, a table/desk with two cushioned chairs. The minibar was one of those annoying electronic sensor types. There were small touches; grey marble counter tops in the bathroom and leather pulls on the dresser drawers that gave the room a luxurious feel. The balcony looked over the Navy base across the water with downtown San Diego in the distance. The only problem I had with the hotel was that I could hear the toilet flushing from the rooms above and beside mine, granted the toilets had a powerful flush. I noticed a large number of airline crew were staying at the hotel. This was my first time at a Sheraton and I would say it’s comparable to a Hilton but not as nice a Hyatt (which I normally stay). I did enjoy the in-room Starbucks coffee and tea selection. Although I did not try, the hotel did not seem accessible by public transport. I took a quick $12 cab ride to San Diego downtown. Overall, I enjoyed the stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe our luck”
Reviews.Author: Big_Rich_Sheffield
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the UK to LAX then drove down to San Diego, it took about 23 hours so we weren't impressed when the check-in guy told us we were not going to be in the main building but had to go to the Bay Towers (we had lots of luggage and very tired kids at 4 and 12), but it was the first time I'd booked on Hotwire so wasn't sure what to expect at $90 a night, he told us we had a nice room on the 12th floor with a good view so we repacked the car and drove the short drive to the correct building, we headed striaght for the elevator and were a little surprised to not see a button marked "12", just 1 thru 11 and "P" which we imagined to stand for parking, but we pressed it anyway and were astonished the doors opened on the penthouse level and our "room with a good view" turned out to be the Sunset Suite with a private roof terrace that was even bigger than the room. We could not fault the hotel in anyway, the staff were friendly and enormously helpful and the pool and fitness room were excellent, and all for 90 dollars a night, congratulations Sheraton and god bless Hotwire...

Reviews.Title: “Don't get pushed to the pink palace!”
Reviews.Author: klpopp
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton overlooking the harbor. Nice room. We booked on Priceline & maybe that's why we were next to the remote elevator. Only one of the two main elevators was working so the remote was much more active than usual, but it wasn't too bad. Our room did have a great view and the staff, particularly the parking valets were very friendly & helpful. Parking is $20/day or $28/day valet. We chose valet and only tipped once when we left ($20, he seemed happy, I hope they pool).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Great, Easily Surpassed Expectations Based on Prior Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: brandslam
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 6 nights at this Sheraton property for a conference downtown. The reviews were mixed so we weren't sure what to expect. However, after spending nearly a week there, we had nothing to complain about whatsoever and really enjoyed our stay. First, I'll address the negatives from other reviews. We found the staff to be very friendly. The concierge was very helpful, the front desk upgraded us to a 9th floor marina view even though we got a great deal via a Priceline bid. The restaurant staff was solid too. (Scott, the bartender at the lobby (Tapatini) bar was excellent). Even the housekeeping staff was friendly and had smiles on their faces. The airport noise did not bother us. When we had the balcony door open we heard a few planes during our stay, but not too many and it wasn't that loud. Unless you plan on staying on the property all day, this really shouldn't be an issue. The hotel is right by the airport, so it is not as central to attractions as it could be. We knew this going in and planned on using cabs to get downtown (both for our conference and to eat in the Gaslamp District and check out Seaport Village). The parking rates are high (more than $20/night), so we figured a 10 minute cab ride downtown (about $10)would be worth it and it was. There is a cab stand at the hotel and that way you don't have to worry about parking, etc. We did stay in the main (Marina) tower. The Bay tower is about a 5 minute walk down the marina, so I can understand why people staying there would be a bit inconvenienced, as the main restaurants are in the Marina tower. About two-thirds of the rooms are in the main tower. The hotel was renovated in late 2008 and it really looks great, inside and out. We had a great stay. While the Bay tower might be too far away for some (the PapaNani's deli is a hidden gem for good casual/cheaper food and snack and is located on the path between the towers), the other complaints about this property seemed unfair, at least based on our 6-night stay there. We would definitely come back, even if we had a car and had to pay $20-$25 a night to park it (we are talking about San Diego after all, parking is never cheap in places like that).

Reviews.Title: “Comic Con 2007”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel as part of Comic Con 2007 (Comic Con is a citywide conference which pretty much sells out every hotel room in the San Diego area.) Upon arrival parking was relatively easy to find as it is adjacent to the hotel BUT the parking lot was full, so once we found a parking spot, we went through the nearest hotel entrance we could find and it was a very long TIRING walk to the front desk. The front desk staff was very courteous and cordial and check-in was speedy. We were checked into a room in the Marina Tower (the main tower) and we were VERY disappointed. We had requested a room with a King bed but were checked into one with two beds instead. The room was very basic and it was quite noisy, as well. IF we had stayed in this room for the duration of our stay, I would have been thoroughly dissapointed. The following morning we received a call from the Front Desk stating that if we desired we could move to a room in the Bay Tower. We packed up our things, drove to the other Tower (it IS necessary to drive between the Towers...too far to walk) and boy, were we pleased. The Bay tower has quite the resort feel to it and it is adjacent to the Marina (not sure about the Marina Tower as our room there faced the main street) The lobby was very elegantly decorated and the rooms were very large and cozy and were decorated in a tasteful nautical theme. It was much quieter in this Tower and the vibe was much more laid-back than it was at the main tower. They should be two different hotels!! My advice: Stay at the Bay Tower unless you are there overnight on a layover and only care about the bed... Also for those attending Comic-Con, this hotel is located at a very good location. The Comic-Con trolly makes pickups right outside the main entrance, and the Comic- Con room rate was very reasonable, as well. All in all, I would stay here again (but only in the Bay Tower!! :) )

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: okirk99
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed are stay at the Sheraton. We got a great deal though. I don't know that I'd want to pay $200 a night, plus parking and internet though. We stayed in the Bay Tower. It is like another hotel, seperate from the Marina Tower, and has it's own check-in desk. There is quite a bit of distance between the 2 of them. The bay tower is smaller than the marina tower. There was plenty of parking at the Bay Tower, and it was $22 a day, or $28 for valet. The room was nice enough, and we had a great view of the bay, downtown, and Coronado Island. I would say this tower has a better view. The beds were comfy, and they had lots of comfy pillows too. The bathroom was small, but the shower worked well. Towels were not the best. The internet was $11.95 a day, and it was on the slow side. The mini-bar is expensive and if you move something in it, you will be charged, although they did take the charge off my bill, with no problem. Being close to the airport, I did not hear the airplanes at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a few notations”
Reviews.Author: silversprings76
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is literally across the street from airport and by most accounts is a higher end hotel with business personal in mind but Sheraton is actually a gem for families as well, now, there is the main hotel building which sits across the airport and harbour overlooking boats, and then around the corner the bay tower which is in my opinion the better option jutst based on the fact it overlooks the ocean! So nice the balcony i great, pool hot tub although not working properly as far as heat during our stay was impeccably clean. Free starbucks coffee in the room and the beds you cannot beat.......you need a car if you want to go out to eat or sightsee. The hotel does charge 22 a day for self parking but truth be told all hotels in this area do that. The only complaint i have is the bathroom is very small and was not very clean hair on the ground tub was not as clean as i would have hoped....but the room itself very clean.Beware no fridge no microwave and the in room mini bar is ultra sensitive so dont touch it or the sensors charge your room for snacks you didnt eat....but they were gracious and quick to take off the charges that were invalid. I was able to do early check in and front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Thanks for a pleasant stay love the Sheraton...

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: TravlHawg
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport which was helpful. Checked in at Marina Tower. Young guys standing around that let customers also stand around. Room in Bay Tower which feels like staying at a budget hotel. Scratchy old generic white bath towels. Only enough for one shower (one set each). Nice bath products. Bathroom clean but so crowded. Small bathtub. I did like the bed and there were lots of pillows. View of the marina which was nice. We didn't mind the airport noise because we are pilots of a small plane, but it was frequent and loud. Not sure a non-pilot would be happy with that. No WiFi in the tower. Had to use an ethernet cable with my laptop. $12/day for internet that is slow. Couldn't watch internet videos because connection so slow. That really annoyed me. Restaurants had pretty good food but average service. Overpriced for what you get. Either lunch or dinner always $45 or more without liquor. Conference facilities fine. Long walk between the two towers which is nice for the most part. I will be back in SD for another conference in Oct. and will not plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: yiching
Reviews.Content: I got the room through Hotwire for about over $100 a night. I was a little concerned before the stay due to some pretty iffy reviews on Tripadvisor, but my wife and I both came away very happy. The rooms are very clean and brightly decorated. Someone commented how the color scheme gave her a headache, but I liked the bright blue nautical theme and it fit well with the hotel. We liked the location. The views are great, it's close to the airport and all the major attractions, and there's a walking/jogging trail right outside. Of note, there's FREE internet available in the lobby. They don't seem to advertise it, probably because they want you to pay for it in the room, but it's there. The only negative, which is probably true of all the major hotels in the city, is the outrageous $22 per day parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a meeting. The room and the facilities are nice. Be aware though that the hotel has 2 towers and they are NOT close to one another so if you are staying for a meeting ask to be in the tower where the meeting rooms are ( I believe it's the Marina tower). As far as airport noise I didn't hear it. I walked from the hotel to downtown, it's a 45 mins easy walk, there is a nice sidewalk that goes all round the bay, lots of people jogging and riding bikes so pretty safe. Didnt eat at the restaurants or used the pool, but my room was right in front of the pool and looked nice. You can walk to the hotel from the airport, it's right in front of it, 5 min walk. I didn't have any luggage with me so had no problem, but the hotel provides a free shuttle back and forth from the airport, but again it's extremely easy to get to it just by following the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but so, so loud”
Reviews.Author: Vermando
Reviews.Content: So much noise at this place, not just the airport noise, as noted and thus expected, but also from the marina, dozens of boats running all night. If you are so fortunate enough to be upgraded to a "marina view" room, refuse it, it is some sick joke or curse which Starwoods must be playing on its most valuable customers. Freaking miserable to stay here, absolutely miserable - bring ear plugs, good ones. The room is otherwise fine, though, and the service friendly. If they would put in a decent sized bathtub and then make thicker doors on their marina view rooms it could be quite a nice place. As it is? Don't stay here. The fitness center and outdoor area are, by the way, absolutely baller.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but service levels going down”
Reviews.Author: Carmelcpl
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel have recently been renovated, and are quite nice. The location across from the San Diego Airport is very convenient, and it is a 10-minute ride to downtown, the Gaslamp District, and to the Convention Center. Also a great location if you are visiting the Navy facilities on Pt. Loma. I have stayed at the hotel a number of times over the past 12 months, and generally have had a very positive experience. The exercise room is terrific based on the facilities found in most hotels. There has, however, been a distinct downgrade in the level of service provided. Specifically, the restaurant no longer offers menu service for breakfast - it is buffet only. The buffet is probably better than average, but it is getting a bit pricey at $21.00 per person. We gave up the convenience and went elsewhere for the ability to order off the menu, and at least attempt to stay within our per diem limits. The hotel has also discontinued the newspaper service, so no more USA Today at the door when you get up. To be fair, free copies of newspapers are made available in the lobby area, but you are out of luck if you like to have a cup of coffee and browse he paper in your pajamas in the morning. I also did not receive a bill under my door at the end of my stay. This may be because it would not fit under the door with the new carpet in the room, or it may be an additional cutback in service. It was unclear to me which. Parking is also getting pricey - $22.00 per day to park your rental (or personal) car. The soundproofing is good. Aircraft departing were not terribly noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: kiara26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work conference. I was in one tower, my co-worker in the other. We immediately compared rooms. The good: I enjoyed my room in the Bay Tower. Huge comfy bed. The bed was at a strange angle in the room, but it worked. Adequate bathroom. (loved the full size hairdryer.. didnt get to use it tho, since I brought my own) The shampoo/conditioner and body lotion was nice and stocked daily. The balcony to the marina was beautiful.. but bird poop on the railings and chair (i did not sit outside) The airport noise did not bother me at all. Work conference had sessions posted in both towers... so lots of walking (short 3-4 min walk) was nice. In between the two towers was an amazing little deli/store called Papa Nani's. Lifesaver to those on a budget! They offered breakfast, lunch (hot and cold sandwiches) and assortment of salads in addition to sodas/juices/beer, snacks and small toiletry items. Wonderful and friendly staff. They even popped popcorn in their microwave for you to take back to your room! The hotel shuttles were fast and friendly drivers. And the main lobby (marina tower) had a pleasant smell that reminded me of Hollister store - but not overkill. There was even lemonade available when we checked in . The bad: No fridge and no microwave. There was a mini-bar but I did not dare touch anything inside (outrageous prices) There were no vending machines but an overpriced gift shop was available. The solution? PapaNani's (see above) The Ugly: The internet in the business center went down on my final night (friday.) I could not check airport schedules or email family or work. Front desk responded by saying, "IT went home at 5, they'll be back monday morning." So basically internet down all weekend? The front desk staff did offer to check on airport schedule for me. And there was a computer in lobby which allowed for guests to print their airline boarding passes. Overall, my stay was a great one. I did not have access to a car, but you can take free shuttle to airport to board the city bus #992 (i recommend a $5 all day pass) and make as many transfers as you like to get to where you want to go. The concierge was helpful in helping me get to Coronado for the afternoon. I did not eat at hotel.. since conference provided some meals..but for snacks I definitely recommend Papa Nani's deli. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, def NOT 4*”
Reviews.Author: angela422
Reviews.Content: We got 2 rooms from Priceline. Since PL group downtown and harbor island together, we got this hotel which is on the harbor island, middle of no where. If you're looking for a downtown SD hotel, don't book thru PL. By the time we got there, they told us our rooms are in Bay tower. It's even farther down away from everything. The rooms are decent, with the marina view, which is ok. The Bay tower doesn't have anything in the lobby, except for a small sitting area. It definately doesn't feel like a 4 star hotel. Like everyone else said, $22 for self park is too much. We had valet, which is nice cuz they kept your car there at the front the entire stay we were there. We were bothered by the airplane noise, it's actually quite loud. Don't book this hotel unless you want to be next to an airport and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Basic three star with some nice marina views”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: This is a very ordinary property with some pretty marina views as well as an airport very close by. The staff was actually a huge turn off at check-in. An employee, Lorna, who was checking me in informed me that she could not give me credit for our hotel stay with Starwood because my husband's last name was different from mine even though we were both staying in the room.She was actually quite assertive and almost provoking an argument at check-in about it but I just didnt,have the time to answer. Further, the bellman had to tell her that my husband was actually there and that he had seen him because she wanted him to personally come to the desk when I was checking in. I have stayed many times at St. Regis and other Luxury Collection properties and neither of these things has never been an issue. I really was too busy with the meeting I was attending to spend time on this so I had to let it slide and take care of what was there for. Room service was a little better than a three star. I would only stay there again if I had a meeting on property.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at $99 a room. Beautiful room and view.”
Reviews.Author: BackinthUK
Reviews.Content: If I'd read the reviews on this site I would never have stayed but having missed my flight, I just wanted the closest hotel until the next day - and at $99 I thought it would be average. I got a beautifully appointed room and very nice bathroom. Great bed, desk, flat screen TV, coffee maker and a beautiful view of the marina. Despite other reviews, once the sliding door was closed, I couldn't hear the aiport. At the $99 rate I got which was available on their website as well as hotels.com this was a killer deal and I was very happy. Shuttle to and back from the airport was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: omjen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to get away for my birthday, so we chose to go to San Diego since we had a great time there on our anniversary. After booking our room on Hotwire, I read a few reviews on the Sheraton Hotel and Marina on Yahoo, Hotels.com, and here on TripAdvisor, and was filled with great remorse for agreeing to book a hotel without knowing the name of the place, so I must admit we had low expectations for our stay. However, as soon as we stepped out of the car, we were treated with respect, which was surprising since we are in our early 20's and aren't ever taken seriously, and the staff was very friendly and professional. The front desk was very slow and very busy with a whole line of guests, but the receptionist was kind enough to upgrade us to a Deluxe Room in the Marina Tower, which had a beautiful view of the marina and the city lights surrounding it. However, the walls were so thin, you could hear the conversations in the hall and in the room next door. Despite this, and the fact that the airport is a half mile away, I very rarely noticed the noise of the planes, unless the balcony door was left open. Our room was smaller than I had expected, and the color scheme of dark blue and bright red gave me a headache, but as mentioned before, the view was beautiful. It seemed like the hotel was understaffed, especially since it was a weekend. We called for room service, and were placed on hold for at least 5 minutes. It then took over a half hour for them to just send up tea, and about 10 to 15 minutes for towels, and when we called valet to prepare our car, they did not answer the phone a good portion of the time. The pool area was beautiful. We went swimming during the night, when there weren't any pool attendents, but that didn't bother us. What did bother us was the fact that the bottom of the pool was falling apart. There were little pieces of plaster that would stab your foot, and big chunks of plaster missing from the ground. If you plan on going out of the hotel to sight see and what not, then this hotel is just fine. But if you want to actually stay in the building to relax, this might not be the best place. Sometimes it would reek of chemicals in the middle of the night, mostly in the hall, when there wasn't any cleaning going on. And despite the slow service, the staff was consistantly friendly and professional and very sincere about any of the delays they were having.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of Bay - great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vnbuckmaster_8
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a cool, windy, crisp day for a three day stay - the sky was gray blue and we were able to upgrade in the bay building to the 10th floor (the view of the bay was incredible from the balcony). The main restaurant and gym is located 5min away in the marina bldg - exit the hotel and it's a strait shot along the marina/water/boats which was a very pleasant walk. The harbors edge restaurant had great food and great waitors. The only issue I had was when we first checked in and was given the choice of valet parking and "self parking". The staff made self parking out to be free, and unfortunately we found out on our last day that "Self Parking" is $22 a night. This was quite a deflator, as our long weekend at the Sheraton had been perfect to that point. I would understand a flat fee for parking, but robbery is how i feel this played out. When i asked the customer service lady about the charges she tossed away all responsibility by saying "the parking service isn't a part of the sheraton". Maybe this should be the first statement out of their mouths when a guest checks in so they can find somewhere less expensive to park. Or maybe the Sheraton should just offer free self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It Like The Plague!”
Reviews.Author: FoBMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for a conference. Very close to the airport and you could hear the airport noise almost non-stop. When complained, I was told by the lady at the reception that this was the first time she's heard of such a complain. Well, she must not have worked there very long! In addition, there was also constant construction noise from 9 - 5. Apparently renovation was being done on the 10th, but could be heard on all floors. The shower was moldy. The bed was soft and lumpy. The carpet made you want to keep you shoes on 24/7. On my last day, they checked someone else into my room. Their explanation for the mix up was that the housekeeper informed them that I had left. Never mind that my luggage was still sitting in the middle of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Husband and I enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: family365
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. We upgraded to a club level room and thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary club floor appetizers in the evening and the buffet breakfast the following morning. We had a room overlooking the pool, marina and bay - it was fabulous. Our room had recently been remodeled and it was great. The bed was heavenly - very comfortable. The hotel is right near the airport, but it must be pretty well sound-proofed, because we were not at all bothered by air traffic noise. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two hotels on property - not equal in quality - be aware.”
Reviews.Author: Guyndenver
Reviews.Content: There are actually two hotels on this property - one is the Bay Tower and one is the Marina Tower. I was unfortunate enough to stay in the Bay Tower. Stayed three nights. Checked in just before midnight the first night. I got stuck on the ground floor to begin with. Then, I was not notified that there would be an additional charge for parking a car during my stay. After fumbling around in the the parking lot, I finally had to go back in and ask and found it was $20.00 additional per night. That was my first disappointment. A 4 start hotel and you have to pay for parking? After I got to the room, the bathroom floor was filthy. Covered with hair - disgusting. This is a 4 star hotel? We got up the first morning to some wonderful in room coffee, left a tip for the staff and went about our day. We got back late that evening and the room had been cleaned. All's well. We needed to connect to the internet to check e-mail. It was a $12.00 charge per day! We got up the next morning to discover that our coffee had not been replenished. Not a good way to start the day. We returned around 6:00 in the evening and wanted to sit by the marina and have a cocktail. We found out to do that we would have to walk 5 minutes to the other hotel or walk 10 minutes the other direction to a resturaunt. This is a 4 star hotel? We did our thing and went out for dinner and returned later that evening. I wanted to get soda from a machine only to find out there were no soda machines in the building - you had to call room service or take one from the mini-bar - a 12 oz can for $3.88? I could by a half a case of 12 oz cans for that. Got up the next morning to discover that the maid neglected to replenish the soap in the bathroom. And, did I mention that this is a 4 star hotel? Save your money. Holiday Inn Express does a much better job for less money. Over priced but still available soda machines, usually free parking, free high speed internet, clean rooms always replenished. This place is a HUGE rip off. Did I meantion that this is a 4 star hotel? They did comp me the $63.88 for the parking and soda from the mini-bar, but I will not be too quick to stay in a Sheraton again any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Burglary in the parking lot. Sheraton takes NO responsibility”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTraveler11
Reviews.Content: My car was broken into at this Sheraton property. The cost for repairs was over $2500. Sheraton employees acknowledged that this is a 'high crime area.' And they knew that a rowdy bunch from a wedding party were causing trouble that night. Yet they provided no security to prevent the burglary. Although the lot has a Sheraton sign, and the parking is paid on the hotel room bill, Sheraton claims the lot is owned by a company called 'Mile High.' After repeated inquiries, both Sheraton and Mile High have failed to take any responsibility for my loss.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel But Served its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights when this hotel had a great promotion, so I feel I definitely got my money's worth. I don't like the $20 daily parking fee but that is pretty standard in large cities in California (San Fran hotels can charge up to $50 a day!). I had a marina building room, 6th floor, facing the marina. Nothing too exciting but better than looking at a parking lot on the other side of the hotel. I never went to the bay view building but I think that the views in that building are better since they are on water vs the marina building being surrounded by boats. The hotel is well taken care of- the pool, fire pits, and restaurants looked very nice though I didn't patron any of these. I did use the fitness center- which is one of the better hotel gyms I have used- spacious with everything a gym should have, with newer equipment The Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient, as was the computer center in the lobby where I printed out my boarding pass for my flight (no charge). The room could have used a fridge and the phone in my room had a horrible connection (even just to the front desk was just static) but besides that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: rovingirishlass
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here while attending Comic-Con this summer. I was apprehensive, because I had heard horror stories regarding hotel rooms booked through the official Con site, and our flight was arriving at 10 AM, a whole 5 hours before check-in. We decided to head to the hotel early anyways, to see if they could at least hang onto our luggage for us. I really shouldn't have worried. Even though I arrived at eleven, they were able to check me right in. They even let me change the room to two beds instead of one! The room was gorgeous, overlooking both the pool and the ocean. It was clean, it was trendy, and it had a minibar which was a fun perk. My only complaint would be the scratchy towels. At one point, I actually opted to air-dry. We ate in both the pub and the Harbor Side restaurant. The food was excellent in both places. It was a little on the pricey side, but that was to be expected. The pool was great, too. I don't know if it was open all night, but I was down there about midnight and nobody bothered us. We stayed five nights altogether, and I was so bummed to leave. I would love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down and noisy - Beward the "Club Floor"”
Reviews.Author: Tangible
Reviews.Content: Expect smallish rooms that are badly in need of remodeling. Shower is just a trickle, carpet is worn, TV is ten years old, etc. I paid extra for the club floor, on the top two floors of the hotel. However, my room overlooked the service area for the tent they had erected for a conference. There was noise of forklifts and trucks all day. I went to sleep to the sound of backup alarms every night. The club itself is physically attractive, but quite a rip-off. Don't expect free self-service drinks as in most such places. Everything is brought by a waiter. Alcoholic drinks are at regular hotel bar prices. Non-alcoholic drinks are free, but then they make a big show of presenting a zero bill on which you are supposed to include a tip, so unless you want to be a jerk you end up paying a high price for your free drinks. Breakfast and evening snacks are sparse and tired-looking. The location of this hotel is great. There's nothing here that a little demolition wouldn't fix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, 'average' Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Area_traveler_1
Reviews.Content: We have been to San Diego many times and tend to stay on Shelter Island - but things were pretty booked, so we opted for the Sheraton on Harbor Island. I had been there before for business conventions (just during the day, but was not booked into the Sheraton) and it had been fine. We stayed in the 'bay' tower, which is a bit of a hike from the main hotel [You may want to ask which building you are in prior to arriving]. The room was 'ok', a bit worn ... slightly noisy when the neighbors got loud. The view was wonderful, but make sure you get the bay side, not the marina side. We arrived real late (due the the flight) around midnite - major disappointment was that there is no room service between midnite and 6am, so we had to scrounge the fast food places a few miles away for dinner. There is a small restaurant and bar in the building, but they did not seem to be open late either. We did try room service prior to leaving - the waiter was extremely nice, the food was average. Staff was nice, but sometimes the 'operator' would take 2 minutes or so to answer, even during the daytime. Could be due to the fact that they were having a large number of weddings there for that weekend, which may have absorbed all of the staff time. Maybe the main, vs. the 'bay' hotel property has less issues. Although they have one free computer in the lobby for internet (it worked about 90% of the time), it was a drag to have to pay $11-$12 per day for internet access in the room. Seemed that there were a number of 'per day charges' (parking, etc. - which they seemed to waive for us as we are Sheraton club members - bet we did pay about $10/hr 'late check out' charge [it was our choice to stay later, due to a late flight back and they were very up front about the cost]). Although the hotel is right across the road from the airport, we did not notice a lot of airplane noise, which was very surprising. As we left, the staff even brought our car around, even though we did not 'valet park' - a nice touch. We might stay again, but would if our preferred hotels on Shelter Island were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location depending on what you want to do”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here (again) and invited my sister for a getaway. As such, I booked the Bay Tower to be a little removed from the large conference chaos. The main building is probably a nicer hotel and with more restaurants and facilites, but the Bay Tower served us well. First, room 1188 was VERY spacious, with two queen-sized beds, good closet space and drawers, in-room safe, iron/ironing board, in-room coffee maker, and other amenties typical of a business class hotel. All rooms seem to come with a balcony -- absolutely delightful with morning coffee or a cocktail in the evening. The housekeeping was generally spotless. The staff was very helpful, friendly, and courteous throughout, and there is a concierge desk. This room overlooks the marina (which was lovely) and airport (which we find interesting, and were not at all bothered by any airport noise.) Odd-numbered rooms look over the bay and downtown in the distance. There is a complimentary internet access terminal in the lobby, and (I think) free wireless internet access in the public rooms. While the larger main hotel has larger pools and more restaurants, this place was a nice respite. The Bay Tower pool is large enough to paddle around in, and the facilities were quite nice with chaises and garden plantings. There is also a hot tub. Since it was on the far side of the hotel complex, it seemed less crowded than the main hotel pools (although the pool by the lanai rooms is also less crowded.) It is a reasonably short walk to the main hotel when you want more options for bars and restaurants. There is also an outdoor casual cafe operated by the marina along this walkway for coffee, sandwiches and casual breakfast and meals. You can book various harbor tours, fishing boats, bicycles, etc. in this area, although not part of the hotel operations. The location of the hotel is what you make of it. It is near the airport, with a complimentary shuttle. The hotel is not on the beach, but you can get to many beaches by car. With a car, it is also reasonably convenient to the zoo, Fashion Valley shopping center, etc, with easy access to Hwy 5. Compared to staying downtown, it was reasonably easy to zip around, unless you wanted to be right in the Gaslight Quarter or Old Town, but these areas are still very do-able from this hotel. The hotel provides excellent driving directions to many attractions and interesting areas. Harbor Island is not that large, but provides a nice venue for walks, bike rides, harbor viewing, etc. If you want to be on the beach, the historic Hotel Del Coronado is a lovely place (been there, done that,) but it is often overrun with tourists just walking through. The beach is very nice, and there is much to like about this charming hotel and area (including the hotel shops,) but the Sheraton may be more convenient if you want to get around to the zoo, Sea World, aquarium in La Jolla, hiking in Torrey Pines, etc. You can still go to the beach in Coronado (Imperial) without staying at the hotel. Frankly, if the beach was a priority, going up the coast to La Jolla or Del Mar might also be an option. But if you want a convenient location for general running around, the Sheraton is pretty good. There were some downsides that we could easily overlook. The tub had been re-done, but the covering was peeling. This Bay Tower hotel has very little in the way of a bar or restaurant (it was open at lunch, but often looked closed;) and generally less impressive than the main building. But again, when a large conference is swarming, you might want to be in this somewhat-removed location. The mini-bar has one of those annoying electronic systems. This meant that when we took a bottle of wine out to see what kind it was, we were charged (but the front desk very quickly reversed the charge when we pointed out the problem.) Finally, I still find it annoying when a hotel of this calibre charges for in-room internet access. There is a parking charge of $20 a day for self-park, $26 for valet, but it is reasonably convenient, and there are few hotels around that don't charge for parking in such prime areas. The hotel itself does not have much around it for dining, i.e. very little option to walk to other than hotel dining. However, with a car, much is possible, and/or a quick cab ride away. 'Strongly recommend that you try Miguel's for Mexican in the nearby Shelter Harbor area. You might be the only tourist in the place -- very full of locals. Not far from this restaurant, there is also a Von's and TRader Joe's to supply your excursions. Ask for directions. So: I'd be happy to stay here if a conference booked into this hotel again, or if I was generally touring the area. I can also see it as reasonably convenient for families who wanted to do a lot of touring in the area, assuming the room rate was acceptable. But if I really needed to be on the beach or have a greater number of cafes and shops to visit by walking to them, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Careful”
Reviews.Author: shess10
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night downtown 4 star hotel via Hotwire at the Sheraton. Arrived late in the day after traveling from the East Coast. We were shuffled into the bar as they were still "preparing" our room ? Eventually the bar closed and we moved to the lobby area still waiting, only to eventually learn at 1 AM (4AM our time) that there was no room being prepared and there were no rooms available in San Diego?? In fact our only choice was to drive 35 miles to another Sheraton property in Carlsbad for what was left of the night. Not a great start to our vacation and we felt we were misled (if not repeatedly lied to) and taken advantage of as our trip was prepaid via Hotwire. We kept Hotwire informed and they made contact with Sheraton and have worked out compensation. Kudos to Hotwire!. Sheraton needs to work on their process and management teams communications. We will avoid Sheraton in the future. We did return to the hotel for nights 2 and 3 as we had prepaid. The hotel is nice enough, close to the ariport and a huge marina sits along side the hotel. Hotel is a car drive or cab ride to any downtown locations. Pool area was nice and the Sheraton did attempt to recover witha nice marina view room and breakfast. Be careful when booking this hotel and actively confirm and verify your arrival. If you really desire a downtown hotel near attractions this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is average”
Reviews.Author: nothingbutthe20
Reviews.Content: In general, this hotel is OK. Tim Clark and Michael (outside) and Stacy (at the concierge) were the most helpful and friendly!! They deserve a raise :) The room was average, I was in Marina tower, 5th fl. The shower curtain liner was had mold spots (gross!!), the wood on the sink was peeling off, the trim around the closet had many black scuff marks and the carpet in front of it had a few stains. The bed skirts had white stripes that were not part of the pattern -( almost like when you do your laundry and paper is in there and it sticks to your black shirt out of the dryer). The telephones did not ring- (yes, I checked, the ringers on BOTH phones were on high) and the bedside phone allowed you to hear a person, but the person you were [attempting] to speak with would not be able to hear you. I tried to tell someone about this EVERY day for the 4 days I was there...they sent someone up to my room at 9pm on the last day- just as I was falling asleep. I called the front desk to ask what the deal was and they stated "we tried to call you, but when we got no answer, we thought something was wrong" - ya think??? How many days had I been requesting the phones to be fixed????? Geesh! In the bar, the bartender Chandra was either having a bad day or was just overwhelmed with the amount of people trying to get drinks or food. SUGGESTION: get her someone to wait on tables!! They offer free internet, but after 3 days of being unable to coneect, and again, talking to the front desk - rather than trying to fix the problem, they kept referring me to the business center in another part of the hotel. I was assured each day that it would be fixed...on the 4th day, Stacy from the concierege desk actaully came over and watched me log in. She then worked a little magic and within under 1 minute, I was good to go. The conference I was there for was great and the ball rooms and meals during the conference were a perfect setting for the function. In general, good venue for large groups and the rooms are simply a convenience - I would not stay there on a vacation, though....

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: pdennisjr
Reviews.Content: I was anticipating my two night stay here at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina, but now regret my decision to stay here. I generally enjoy my stays at Starwood hotels as I am a Platinum Preferred, however, I will never spend a night at this particular hotel. First the good -Plenty of on site parking -Free airport shuttle -Friendly desk staff -Great views of downtown from the 7th floor balcony Now the bad -Poorly maintained room (missing granite piece in bathroom, filthy light fixtures, hole in the wall near door (not caused by door). -Parking, not mentioned in my itinerary is $20/night, $26 for valet. -No WIRELESS internet, you can connect to the all but high-speed for only $12.95/24hrs -Half eaten items leftover in the "Refreshment Center" For the rate I paid, the room left quite a bit to be desired, if you don't need to stay near the airport, less expensive alternatives should be considered

Reviews.Title: “Like Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: xanthia11
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel the day before we were to arrive to let them know we would be arriving late and that we needed 2 beds. The receptionist was very helpful and said I will note that in your file. When we arrived the next night they had no record of me calling and only had a king bed available for myself, husband and two kids. They said we do have a room with two double beds available in our west hotel. Thinking it was of the same quality I said sure. Our bedroom stunk, there was mold on the ceiling above the shower, the bathroom light didn't shut off, and there weren't fixtures around the bathroom lights just lightbulbs. We complained to the main hotel the next am and the gave us free breakfast vouchers and said they would move us if a room became available. I called later in the day and they still had no rooms available for us to move to in the main hotel but said they could move us up to the 10th floor in the west hotel. So when we checked in later that night the room on the 10th floor wasn't available. I went to the main hotel to talk to a mananger and he said there is nothing we can do we have no rooms available. I asked him to refund my money and he said he would.... We will see. Don't stay in the west side it is like Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to deliver!”
Reviews.Author: wilbur1Uk
Reviews.Content: Waited in a very long and slow queue at check in (only two desk opens) only to find they had 'deleted' our reservation (made months ago) and could not provide the interconnecting rooms requested . Eventually got rooms allocated only to find that one of them had a flooded bathroom (from a leaking toliet - nice!). Moved rooms (with an apology) to then be woken at 4am with a fire alarm (and evacuation) apparently caused by a leak. it was quite clear staff did not know what to do which was not reassuring and there was no communication. We actually had an enjoyable stay in spite of these factors but you were definitely left with the impression that this was a hotel failing to deliver on the basics and one where client care was almost non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: TAL-PE
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff were lovely, check in was very quick and the hotel itself is well presented and clean. Our room was average, exactly what you would expect from a Sheraton, lovely big comfortable bed, adequate bathroom but spotlessly clean and a small balcony over looking the harbour and downtown San Diego. The pool is lovely and not busy at all as this seems to be mostly a business hotel. We didnt hear any noise from the airport at all. There isnt a great deal else on Harbour Island other than the other part of the Sheraton, a Hilton and a fantastic restaurant called Island Prime which is always pretty busy so book first, it has excellet views across the bay of downtown. We went into the gas lamp quarter in downtown 2 nights as it is only a 10 min taxi ride and there are some great bars and restaurants there. Try The Ivy Hotel, it has a rooftop bar with huge fire pits where you can sit outside overlooking the city. Back to the Sheraton though where there are two bars, one is Quinns which has pool tables and tv's etc and the other is the main hotel bar which is nice an relaxing with the most friendly bar staff. You can take your drinks outside by the fire pit which over looks the harbour, its so relaxing. Overall a lovely hotel in the ideal location as its only 10 mins drive to Seaworld, La Jolla, Coronado and Downtown. Finally.....you must visit Hotel Del Coronado because it is beautiful and has so much history, plus they serve an excellent lunch, in fact if you have more money just stay there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: samsen
Reviews.Content: Okay, as a San Diego native, there is no question that the Sheraton still retains that California feeling. In fact if you take your self (Walking) outside of the hotel and to the East you will see an amazing view of downtown that even I did not know existed. In fact, you usually have to go to to the other side by way of the Coronado Bay Bridge to enjoy such a view. Minutes from the very best of San Diego: Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo and Gaslamp Quarter. I find at times that the hotel transported me to circa 1970's, but the pool and grounds more than made up for this. I do agree with the other reviewers: For a grander experience, the Marina Tower has exceptional service and closer to the middle of all of the action.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nonnie99
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. We had 3 rooms with great views of the Marina. The rooms were spotless, older but very comfortable. We had our 1 year old grandaughter with us and the hotel went out of their way to make it a good stay for her, the crib was great, we were able to rent a refrigerator, the pool area with toys was perfect. The airport being so close did not impact us, the noise was minimal. We all loved the pool area after sightseeing all day. The employees, all of them from parking attendent to the front desk staff, the maids and waiters and the concierage were friendly, well informed and great at their jobs. I have absolutely no complaints and am planning another trip there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal”
Reviews.Author: queuepon
Reviews.Content: I booked this room without knowing its identity, on Hotwire - only paid $129/nite plus the $20/nite fee for parking-still quite a deal compared to their published rates-after I got the name of the hotel, I quickly checked reviews to find some negative comments about the hotel - I called the hotel directly- and worked with them on getting the Bay Tower - which the rooms are Larger ( or so I am told)-----and honestly, they gave us a Bay facing room on the 7th floor - we watched three sets of fireworks on our patio the night of the Fourth, and it was a great view......I would say to just be sure about which building you want to be in when you make the reservation...for us, a larger room was more important than the larger pool area that the other tower offered....the experience was a lot better than I expected, given the online reviews that I had read in advance of getting there - yeah, their computers were not working when I tried to check in, but , that wasn't so bad - we just left our luggage and checked in later.

Reviews.Title: “Tricky Tricky”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Sheraton which looked beautiful as we pulled up to it, we realized that since our room was booked in the Bay Tower, we were not staying at the Hotel we pulled up at. We were to continue down the road to another Sheraton. The Bay Tower wasn't too bad but definately not as nice as the main sheraton. The front desk seemed very excited to tell us about the beautiful view of the Bay from our room, which it's true, we could see the bay...but the ugly parking lot was in between us and the bay. The room was clean but didn't seem to be up to par with other Sheraton's we've stayed at prior to this trip. On our confirmation email, it stated to please enjoy the Continental Breakfast which at any Best Western or any other cheaper hotel/motel...translates COMPLIMENTARY! Wrong we were, The set up was like that of a help yourself complimentary station with the typical muffins, fruit, oatmeal, and coffee. EXCEPT we were charged $3.00 for a coffee that we poured ourself ( had we known, we could have just made coffee in our room with the provided coffee pot). There was a starbucks at the main Sheraton but we would have had to walk quite a distance or get in our car just to get a cup of coffee. The muffins were $3.00/ea. and the banana's were $1.50/ea. Which seemed like such a rip off...I mean we were spending $200/night and they had to charge us for a banana! On the day of Check out we got our bill slipped under our door and it had five (5) addit'l. charges. We inquired what these were at the front desk and they said that we ate the food out of the mini fridge. in the room, which we didn't. It was over $30.00 in charges that kind of just looked like service/tax fees had we not looked into it. They quickly got rid of the charges without any questions. Interesting enough our friends who were staying at the hotel too recieved charges from the fridge. which they had not even opened either. What a scam...had we not questioned it...they would have made an extra $30.00 off us...for nothing.They obviously do this often for they didn't even question our us about the additional charges they just removed them. I'm very dissapointed in the Sheraton, I thought that name stood for QUALITY ....this one proved that wrong. We also wanted to grab some food and a drink and since the bar at our Bay tower was closed at 9pm on a Friday night, we had to drive over to the Main Sheraton ( kind of a pain) we went to the little lounge and ordered drinks which took over 35 mins to get from the time we ordered...seriously are they trying to drive business away on purpose? We had some friends with us that had children , which the lounge said it was acceptable for them to stay until 11pm. We ordered food (which was okay...not bad but not fabulous) we then sat there waiting and waiting for our check. Our server was nowhere in sight, we finally asked a different server if we could please get our check, all of a sudden our server appeared with the check and told us that we needed to get out of there because it was past 11pm, well we would have been out of there by 10:30 had she not dissapeared on us. That was very poor service and unprofessional on her part. So to sum it up...we woudn't not stay there again. There were way too many scams and things that kind of blind sighted us. Perhaps the rooms at the Main tower were nicer but that's a chance we're not willing to take. If you decide to stay here....beware!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: HaroldVisitsVegas
Reviews.Content: Better than a Motel 6, but not by much. Like most people, I stayed here for a conference. Had my company not been paying for it, I would not have chosen here and would not return here. I also would encourage my company to choose another place in the future. The room was pretty basic, not uncomfortable. It looked a little worn, but was clean enough. It's pretty obvious that a large amount of people come in and out of the rooms for big conferences. There was nothing outstanding, worth mentioning about any of the rooms (I saw several) or the hotel in general. It's right on the bay, and literally across the street from the airport. Despite my expectations I did NOT hear the airport, armed services or bay while in my room. My understanding is that may be a unique experience. The bay might have been a nice view, but it was very cloudy the entire time I was there. A lot of the rooms had pretty big holes in the wall from fixtures being moved or removed. Many walls had stains and a lot of the furniture was pretty scarred. This was stuff you had to look for, but it was apparent they had made no attempt to cover most of this. I had trouble with my bathroom door not closing tightly. Pretty basic room, modern decor with a comfortable enough bed. I'd recommend not going here, and if you are doing a conference, try to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: Wahine06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina for one night (Marina Tower), 5 July 2008 and never wanted to leave. The grounds are gorgeous, with flowering trees, palms, fountains. The valet staff, bell man, front desk staff were all very gracious and accommodating. The lobby looks like a palace and there are big pumps of delicious scented lotion in the lobby and huge candles that make the place smell gorgeous during the day - then they light them at night. There's a Starbucks right in the lobby. There is a place to log onto the Internet or connect your laptop for 45 minutes for free, and the computer speed when there were only a few people on-line was lightning quick. It felt very luxurious sitting there checking my e-mail with my Starbucks! Beautiful lanai out back, with rocking chairs, deck chairs, Adirondack chairs to look out over the marina , places to eat your lunch outdoors - plus fire pits at night. The pool is WONDERFUL and there's a jacuzzi pool too. Our room was on the 9th floor with a panoramic view towards the marina and the sunset . King-sized bed and pillows were very comfortable. I've read complaints about airplane noise, but once we slid the balcony door closed, we heard no airplane noise at all and slept like babies. Nice big tub. Very clean room. I loved the mandarin & mint shampoo and lotion! I would warn against opening the mini-bar; of course we knew the snacks were expensive, but didn't realize everything's computerized and motion-sensitive, so when our teenager jokingly picked up the mini-bottles of booze, the charges went right onto our bill. Although - the front desk staff removed the charges with a smile when we explained. You also are warned not to put any personal items into the fridge - again the motion dectectors will know you did it, and there's a $25 charge. Checkout was at 12:00, but our flight was not til 5:00pm, so we asked if we could stay a little longer. We were granted a 1:00pm checkout, plus after that, you can leave all your luggage and even your purse with the bellman, and go use the pool for as long as you like, without needing a room key. We took the dry cleaning bags for our wet suits to put in our suitcases later. There is a spa/fitness room where they'll give you all the swim towels you want and give you a place to change back into your dry clothes - and I have to mention: the "restroom" in the spa was amazing. Scented candles, and cupboards full of lotions, hair products, razors, deodorant, robes and slippers, the works! - for guests. There is also a steam room and of course a shower area and lockers. What a great way to wait for our flight! When you are poolside, there's a litlte cabana that rents big, fun floaties for $7/hr, and sells sunscreen, waterproof cameras, etc. . There is a fresh-water cooler for free, plus there are staff who walk around very courteously asking if you want to order drinks and/or lunch, which you can enjoy right there in the sun. A little cheaper place to eat: Just a 2-minute walk to the left side of the marina is a little sandwich/burger shop right on the dock that sells sundries and some groceries, probably for boaters who need to restock. They have great ice cream and are very polite and friendly. Places to sit inside and outside. This hotel could not have been more heavenly. We got a great deal on [--] (around $125 for the one night, one king-sized bed plus a roll-away bed for $15 for our son). I'd never want to stay anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton --Bay Tower”
Reviews.Author: LouieSD
Reviews.Content: We came for a Conference with a discounted rate, so I'm not sure if the two towers command the same room rates. The Bay Tower worked very nicely for us, but it does look like an older property re-branded as Sheraton. Our room looked onto the Bay and North Island-a very excellent view, no noise from airport. Between the two Sheraton towers is a good outdoor deli that serves the boat marina. It gets all the Sheraton guests for breakfast and lunch at cheap prices. Restaurants: The restaurant at the Bay tower is almost nonexistent. The restaurants at the main tower are deluxe, with terrace dining. Pool: Not too special at the Bay tower. The pools(two) at the main tower are deluxe/ resort oriented, with live entertainment and waiter service to the pool chairs... Lobby: At the bay tower, nothing special. At the main tower--Wow! lots of activity, fancy. Room: clean, good bed, couch, tv, mini-bar--don't touch it., bathroom clean. Parking: We got a special rate, but any charge is too much. After spending much time on the balcony soaking up the view, we would have been happy, but then we walked over to the main tower----WHAT is this !!... Is this the same hotel !!? The main tower has activities, live entertainment at the pool, lounges, Starbucks --I hope they charge less at the Bay tower! On the island, there are several restaurants within walking distance---besides the deli next to the hotel, there is the Boathouse restaurant with good prices, and Tom Ham's lighthouse, and Island Prime restaurant. By car, the Star of India/ Embarcadero/Coronado Ferry and Harbor Excursion is about 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Californiadreamer608
Reviews.Content: I saw a lot of negative reviews on this hotel and knew that it was built many years ago, so we were dreading having to deal with a run-down property in dire need of a facelift. We decided to make the best of it because we were attending an event that was within easy walking distance. I have to say that we were very pleasantly surprised. Everyone on the hotel staff -the front desk clerk who gave us a harbor view room, the chambermaid who went out of her way to chase down an item I needed, the waitress in the huge dining room - was courteous and professional. Our room, though not particularly large, was nicely decorated in a subtly nautical theme in warm wood tones, navy and cream. Of course, the little balcony and view of the pleasure boats moored below helped a lot! The spotless bathroom was well-lit, and had a granite countertop with a basket of toiletries and a curved shower rod, indicating it had been updated fairly recently. The only meal we had in the hotel was breakfast. The food was okay, but personally I don't think a totally basic breakfast for two should cost over fifty dollars. The only other amenity we used was the wi-fi in the lobby, which was available to hotel guests. Much appreciated. We liked the location, which is near Little Italy and other attractions of downtown; we didn't notice any noise from the airport which is very close. Although the hotel is large and shares many features of a corporate chain, the warm welcome and pleasant attitude of everyone we dealt with gave it a very personal vibe.

Reviews.Title: “No Guarantees Here!”
Reviews.Author: kiloj757
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with a view over the phone and was promised a nice room one month in advance. Upon arrival we were told, "we can't guarantee rooms, but you can have one on the other side, the view of the airport is beautiful". Maybe someone should remind these beautiful minds what the definition of a reservation is! No effort was made to accommodate us, and our trip was ruined. I hope this doesn't happen to others, they are taking advantage of people who don't want to look like schmucks and complain!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: CaptainSunDevil
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels with vacancy the day before we left. My wife booked it as it was lots cheaper than whatever else she found. I'm not sure what it cost, but will keep that factored in for the review. We stayed in the Bay Tower, which is a good walk from the Marina Tower. The rooms were not too small (I heard they are bigger than in the Marina Tower), but not what you would call large, either. There was a very comfortable king bed, tv, table, sofa, dresser in the room. Ironing board, coffee maker (single serve packets - they had 3 each day for us), and in-room safe were the amenities. There was a small balcony that you could sit on. In our case, we had a beautiful view of the airport to enjoy. You coul definitely hear them taking off every few minutes if the door was open. If the balcony door was closed, it was very hard to hear the planes. Room service pricing was reasonable, food was average. Our room was clean and comfortable. The Bay Tower has a small gift shop, medium sized restaurant (seemed to be dinner only), and conference rooms. The lobby was not welcoming, and if you didn't order room serrvice, then you are a hungry person. You can hike over to the Marina Tower, which definitiely has a nicer lobby. On the way to the Marina Tower, you will pass a small coffee shop with sandwiches and muffins (if you need a quick bite and dont want to hike all the way to the other tower). The Marina Tower lobby has a restaurant, sports bar, gift shop, wireless area and lounge. This lobby is decently appointed (much better than the bay tower). You can rent boats and seadoos just outside the marina tower. Overall, this is a decent hotel if you are looking for a relaxing trip, and the room is just to sleep or hang out in. I would recommend the marina tower for the lobby and its facilities over the bay tower, although i hear the rooms are smaller in the marina tower. We drove from L.A., and that airport frontage road is a real bear to navigate through to the hotel from the freeway. Getting out from the hotel to downtown San Diego was a real time killer. On the other hand, getting to Sea World or the harbor was pretty easy. If you are going for a value-based weekend, then this hotel might be okay with you. If you are going to San Diego as a destination vacation, you really owe it to yourself to look harder and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcuckt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is family friendly - room was okay. Good location - close to Gaslamp Quarter. Good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not new but definitely OK”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: Before my attending a meeting at this Sheraton, I read the reviews posted on this site. After being there for 5 days, I have a better understanding of what it is about. As a disclaimer for this resort, I learned that it has been here for 40 years. With that said, you can look at areas of the hotel and see 40 years, and then others are as new as what you would find from a new construction hotel. This is how I break it down: THE LOBBY AND EMPLOYEES The lobby was beautiful and spacious with all the amenities you would expect from a finer hotel. There was a bellman stand and staffed concierge. The employees are top in serving your needs. Good hires that work with sincerity. There is a bar and restaurant in the lobby area that are both nice. ROOMS: This is a problem. There was a constant joke about the rooms being similar to a road side lodge. They are small. The bathrooms have been updated and were clean, as were the linens. The beds are comfortable and the room was satisfying overall, just nothing fancy or trendy. Be advised, not all rooms are interior corridors. You might need to be specific if you don’t' like your door opening to the outside. Some colors and décor are showing age. EXERCISE ROOM: I have yet to find a hotel/resort exercise room than can accommodate everyone that is trying to exercise at 6 AM. It could have been larger. All the exercise equipment was tops, just limited. There was plenty to do to get a full workout. It is San Diego and the weather was beautiful. Many, including me, ran along the coast on concrete path. POOL: I believe there were three total. I saw two. Both of which were very nice and bigger than normal. There were plenty of chairs to satisfy anyone wanting to sit by the pool and bake. The pool was even depth all the way across. MEETING ROOMS: It was evident that when this resort made upgrades it was done to the meeting facilities. Really nice in every way. LOCATION: This was good and bad. If you are flying into San Diego, you could walk to and from this resort. Literally across the street. The resort sits on the water and there is a very nice running path that is next to the water. The Sheraton is to two separate buildings. I was in the main building but guess it is a good 10 minute walk to the other. There are a couple restaurants within walking distance, but it is a 10 minute cab ride to the Gas Lamp district. Overall I would stay here again. I am big on service and effort and this property exceeded my expectation on both. I guess it depends on what your plans are. This was my fourth trip to San Diego in the past 4 years. With that said, I have stayed in 4 different properties. The other three were in and around the convention center. If you are looking to get away and simply relax with comfortable amenities, then the Sheraton is good enough. If you want to go to San Diego and walk to places, you should choose another place.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: thatepic1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rock & Roll marathon. It was the worst experience ever! OVER PRICED AND DIRTY! On our way up to our room after checking in, we got stuck in the elevator for an hour (3 adults and 2 kids under 4 years old). My wife and my son did not want to get in the elevator again. We asked to switch to a room on ground level the next day and they said we were supposed to be checking out, but we had one more night left. It was even written on our room key that our check out date was the next day. Finally got that settled. They were supposed to credit my sister-in-laws room $50 for the elevator incident, but charged her $50! If you rent a car, $20 a day for parking in a dirt lot with not easy access to the hotel. Each day we had to talk to a manager, each time a different manager. NOT WORTH IT! The Hilton in La Jolla is much better!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton SD Marina = DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: arthurtrejo
Reviews.Content: I am going to be honest----The Sheraton Hotel and Marina was a disappointment ---- especially if you are staying in the BAY TOWER! Location is next to airport, views are not impressive and not within walking distance of anything! We were dupped when we first arived at the Marina tower parking our vehicle and entering the lobby to check in. We were impressed with the decor and it felt like a fine hotel but were told that our room was in the BAY tower and was a 1/4 mile away. OK? we thought as we repacked our car for the drive over. When we first arrived the service level dropped by 10 points and had to ask more than once for a bellman. Entering the lobby you can feel the difference in the two towers--Marina was grand and the Bay was bland! In fact the BAY tower felt as if it were a former lower budget hotel rebranded as a Sheraton. The room was not impressive as the decor was a blue and red natical theme---yuk. There were no robes and a small bathroom with a cracked toliet that leaked. The location of both towers are adjacent to the SD airport and isolated from downtown. You would have to use a taxi or your own vehicle to go anywhere. If you do stay at the Sheraton Marina make sure you get a room in the Marina tower; our friends did and were happier than we. If you want to experience SD you would be better off staying downtown were you can use the trolly to explore the city. We paid $229 a night and felt we could have done far better elsewhere and we did----we moved to the Hard Rock for the last half of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy and fridge taboo”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton in May 2008 at the Bay tower. The hotel locates in a very beautiful location with a fantastic view. There is a nice path for jogging/walking and that is very nice and enjoyable. However, the nice view has a price to pay as it is far from downtown. There is no store nearby to buy personal items. No easy public transportation is available, except taxi. The parking fee at the hotel is quite high, about 20 dollars/day. It is also very noisy as the San Diego airport is nearby. You can hear them almost all the time. If you are a light sleeper, that could be a problem. The hotel has internet connection but for a fee if you use it in your room, but you can work at the lobby for 1hr free of charge. The one that I dislike the most is that you cannot use the hotel's refrigerator for stocking your drinks. The hotel will throw your stuff away and charge you 25 dollars each time for the rearrangement of the fridge. We pay 300 dollars/night and cannot use the fridge. Saying that, I really enjoy San Diego. The city is very beautiful and is a good place to visit. Next time, I would choose the hotel inside downtown that I could enjoy so many beautiful things nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: LALady020
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night with my then 10 yr old son in between visiting Sea World and Legoland (!!). We got a good deal thru the Sheraton rewards program. Check in was very quick and easy. Front desk staff was very helpfull. The standard room was a little small, but it worked for the two of us (would not work for the whole family of 4, however!). Nice view of the harbor - several stories up so that we did not get much noise from the pool area. Very comfy beds! GREAT POOL FOR THE KIDS!! Shallow, warm with lots of statues spurting water! Inner tubes and floaty things available pool side. Drink service from the pool bar very slow. Room service was fast and tasty. Lots of kid friendly pay-per-view movie choices, but pricey. The Disney channel or Cartoon network would have been nice. The breakfast buffet looked a little exotic(and pricey) for my 10 yr old, so we opted for the local Denny's instead. Overall, great for the one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: phkadel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Gator by the Bay which is located right outside the hotel, so the location is great. There were about ten of us from the same area staying there. The room was fine but customer beware of charges that sneak up on you. A member of our party rented a car through the hotel, was not informed of the need for a parking pass, and the hotel tried to charge him $40 to get his car back out of the lot the next morning. He refused to pay it, and they sold him the (ridiculously priced) $20 a night pass they should have told him about in the first place. It costs $12 to hook up to the internet in your room and you can't use wifi because the hotel has somehow blocked access to unsecured networks. You can see them on your laptop, but can't connect. A salad with moldy tomatoes wasn't taken off the bill in the hotel restaurant until we went back and complained, even though the waitress had been handed the moldy tomato before the bill was produced. The bottle of sunblock that costs $10 at the deli down the road costs $15 at the hotel, Miller Lite is over $5 a glass (Miller Lite? Good grief!), and don't take the offer of a refill on your soda unless you want to pay full price for another one. The front desk is understaffed. The airport shuttle is great and, strangely enough, free? What were they thinking? I think I'll probably skip Gator by the Bay and just go to other festivals. This was too much like being a captive money machine for the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh....”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right outside the exit of the airport. So, first, be prepared to hear the constant roar of planes during your stay. Pros: balcony and beautiful views of the harbor; friendly and helpful staff Cons: rooms are in major need of renovation - clean but old, dark & depressing With the number of great hotels to choose from in this city, I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Some highs, some lows -”
Reviews.Author: traveler5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit outdated and needs refreshing, but the room was quite comfortable and the view wonderful. Obviously being near the airport has some advantages and quite honestly we didn't hear the planes at all. Our biggest complaint was the $12 charge per day for the Internet. That was outrageous. When we complained we discovered that our convention had a deal on the Club rooms with complementary breakfast and afternoon snacks with free Interent for about $20 extra. Given the $12 charge this was the right deal for us on this trip. However, I agree with another writer that they should be specific about the parking cost and the Internet and include it in the price...it was simply ridiculous and started us in a bad mood upon our arrival. The staff has been quite cordial and the Club Floor a delight. I'll check out the pool and facilities tomorrow. By the way, our Club Room was no different than the original room we were offered. If you want to be near the action, this is not the place to be. It is quite far from the Convention Center, Gaslight area etc. We rented a car so it wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty View, Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: MOBX
Reviews.Content: Had a lanai room that overlooked the marina which was really nice. The HVAC system is the type that comes on only when you are in the room so getting it warm enough when you arrive late is a challenge. The hotel seemed to be very heavily staffed with people to answer direction questions which was handy. Service in the restaurant is very slow, they seem to bring things then disappear and the restaurant wasn't very busy. Didn't get the chance to use it, but there was a lovely pool. Plenty of sidewalk and walking areas for a good walk and there were tennis courts. The meeting facilities were very good for the conference that we attended although the rooms were generally kept very cold. The exhibit hall in the basement felt a little cramped. This is out near the airport, not near downtown. It is about a $15.00 cab ride to the Gas Lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Long on Price. Short on Service”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler56
Reviews.Content: Understaffed check-in desk at peak time (7 pm) $20 self-parking includes very poorly lit parking lot and a long walk (the hotel was all too quick to point out that it wasnt their problem because the parking lot is managed by a third party). Valet is only $6 more (plus tip). Ignored by wait staff when attempting to order in the sports bar in the lobby. In their defense it was understaffed for the number of people in the bar, but they did wait on someone else first who came in after I did. The room was clean and comfortable althought the "lanai room" I had was downstairs and had no view. Avoid these rooms if possible. For the price ($189 per night) this could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “YET AGAIN...Rotten Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirlinParis
Reviews.Content: Here we go again....I thought I would give this hotel ONE more shot after writing my last negative review and I have even stayed there TWICE since the last review. I always start with the positive things...some of the staff (Dinah at the front desk, the cleaning staff, and the staff in the Club Lounge breakfast and evening drink area are EXCELLENT!!!!) were just down right wonderful!
