I rented a bike one day (which was $7/hour) and it was nice (a way to get some exercise and away from the hotel). The pool was outside and kind of chilly to go into so didn't get to try it out. I would never stay here if I was paying with my own money. They overcharge for everything and its obvious they know most people staying here don't care cause an expense account is probably paying the bill. The room we stayed in was clean and nice, but as other reviews have said, the walls are thin and we did hear noise often from the room next door to us. I once heard someone listening to their voicemail through the walls, which seems to be a sign of thin walls!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was helpful”
Reviews.Author: OHi0Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice hotel in a good location between the marina and San Diego Bay. The hotel should do a better job, however, in letting people know that this hotel is actually divided into two separate towers which are almost a mile away from each other. The room I stayed in was clean and well appointed. The bathroom was a bit dated, but otherwise it was a good room with a balcony overlooking the marina.

Reviews.Title: “quick visit to san diego”
Reviews.Author: debgroshong
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my Dad on a quick visit to see my son in the Navy. I booked on-line $109 + tax and was trully surprised at the hotel. It is a 3 star and really nice. The pool area is wonderful and ALL the staff were so nice and pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel and would book it for my next stay in San Diego. We were given non-smoking and 2 double beds with lots of pillows and a small balcony over looking downtown San Diego. The parking was $17/24 hr, but I was expecting this. They do take pets less than 70 lbs for no additional fee and my dad has a 7 lb companion, so it was great!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. I made the mistake of booking this hotel using one of those discount internet services. First and last time I'll do that again. I had put in a request for a 4-star accomodation thinking I would be given a reservation at either the Omni, Hyatt or Intercontinental hotel as shown in their example. But , no...it was the Sheraton Marina and Harbor instead. I was both surprised and disappointed. First of all, this property is NOT a 4-star accomodation, and this booking service should not be falsely advertising it as such. We arrived at almost 1am after a late flight. I had previously called the hotel to request a late arrival guarantee. Don't know if it was the late hour or the fact that I had booked through a discount broker, but the room we were given was on the ground floor. Not only did the noise of the airplanes from the nearby airport wake us up througout the night , but there was also heavy foot traffic outside our door in the busy hallway. One night , we had to listen to noisy teenagers out by the darkly lit pool area off our patio until midnight. Ditto on the self-parking situation. I think that $17 is ridiculous! (To valet park, it was $24 per day.) The lot was dirty, far away and very poorly lit. We were also double-charged by the hotel for the entire stay. Someone else with the same common last name must have gotten free parking! You had to give the lot attendant your room number along with your last name each time you left, so I'm not sure how the mistake kept getting made. Even as we left the lot for the last time, it happen again! Back to the front desk to clear it up. Lastly, the condition of the room was not that impressive. Certainly not 4-star standards. Ants in the bathroom and NEVER enough towels. Three out five nights I had to request (by note and phone) more towels and toiletries to the housekeeping staff. I reminded them that there were four in our party and not two. No newspaper on the first morning as well. San Diego and its weather was great however! The kids had a blast visiting all of the attractions. Also, note that there didn't seemed to be any reasonably priced restaurants on Harbor Island. A Von's grocery store was also a few miles away. Note there's no refrigerator or microwave in the room either. The location of the Sheraton worked for us, but the entire trip I felt deceived by the fact that I had basically stayed at a 3-star accomodation but thought I was paying for something much nicer. I guess in this situation the old adage, "you get what you pay for" holds true. Next time, I will book my hotel directly and not blindly through a discount hotel broker.

Reviews.Title: “View is to die for!”
Reviews.Author: robsocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for my Mom's birthday. Check-in was fast and we were up to our 11th floor room in no time only to discover one king bed instead of our requested two doubles. Back to the front desk, I explained my situation and got the icy-cold "I couldn't care less" attitude. They said they would send up a rollaway as there were NO other rooms available. The view from this room was fabulous. Really enjoyed having a balcony... room was clean and fresh and appreciate the morning newspaper. Bottled water was complimentary, nicer than average toiletries, comfortable bathroom with good water pressure. Parking is an outrageous $17! I knew that going in from reading other reviews, but the kicker is the only spaces available were on dirt! So much for my nice clean car, it was toast by the time we left. Also upon check out they charged twenty bucks for the rollaway and REFUSED to reverse the charge even though I requested two beds and no charge for the rollaway was ever mentioned at the front desk. Let me tell you some of the employees here have a serious attitude problem. Overall I would probably stay here again based on the location, nice room and beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Ample parking is a good starting point. Location - near airport - is convenient for the business traveler, but the beautiful views of downtown San Diego and Coronado make it a great place for holiday makers alike! My room was very beautifully equipped and decorated, bathroom was nice. Really, me and my girlfriend really enjoyed our stay there! Complimentary internet is offered in the lobby, which is great! Pleanty of restaurants and there's also a pub! Three swimming pools, one heated, gym and tennis fields. What could you ask more from a hotel? Maybe not the best hotel in San Diego, but a good 4* indeed! Rating? B+

Reviews.Title: “Not as good of a deal as you think...”
Reviews.Author: DCReviewerWashington
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good deal costwise, don't stay here! We stayed at the hotel during the first weekend in March because got a good deal on Hotwire.com ($134/night). The biggest problem with this hotel is its location. It is located directly across the street from the airport-at times it was difficult to sleep because we could hear planes flying overhead. Its also located away from all of the major attractions, so if you don't have a car, you end up spending a lot of money on cabs. If you do have a car (we rented one for the weekend), you end up paying $17/day to park at the hotel. After paying for transportation, it didn't seem like a good deal at all. The room we stayed in (in the East Tower) was clean, but extremely bare. It clearly had been updated in several years. We did use the spa, which was small, but the service was great. All of the employees we encountered at the hotel, from the front desk to the concierge to the spa staff to the staff at the main restaurants were exceptionally friendly and offered prompt service. The staff was the best part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: smujwud
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed by my stay at this hotel. The location was very simple to get to from the airport (I could see it upon exiting) and our room had a nice little view of the harbor and boats. It was right off the main street that skirts the harbor and made for easy access to downtown (we had a rental car) and Rt. 5 (the highway that seemed to take us everywhere we wanted to go). The service was impeccable. From the woman who checked us in, to the woman who brought the room service, to the bar tender, to the concierge, to the woman who served us during our business lunch... everyone was friendly and efficient. They brought me things before I knew I needed them. Having the sports bar downstairs was a welcome addition when we came back after a full day and wanted a quick beer. The bar tender allowed us to sample the 2 local beers we were trying to decide between. The room was clean and large enough for 2 of us by far. The internet access in the lobby was also helpful for a quick email check.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but a little bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ChunMingYang
Reviews.Content: I have my first trip to San Diego this Feb. for a conference. The conference is held in Sheraton Hotel and Marina. I requested for a kingsize-bed room while I made reservation, but I got a twin-bed one. Though not in my expectation but it didn't bother me. The view is great, I had a harbor-view room and the sunset is gorgeous. Downtown view is also available since i have a room in the 7F. The room is just ok, have most basics you may need, but don't expect for a very luxurious room. Decoration is simple but a little bit dated. Bed is quite comfortable. Staffs are quite friendly. I had twice in-room dining, the waiters are very polite. Front desk is also good, provides useful information. I had a dinner in the Harbor's Edge, and enjoyed it very much. The only problem with this hotel is its food. They are a little bit expensive, though I was not in a tight budget, I still feel expensive. I have no idea in Parking since I didn't rent a car. If you wanna stay here and take buses to downtown, you should take route 992 but not route 923. I made a mistake and it almost killed my legs to find the route 923's stop.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely common areas, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: abbyjrg
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences in my life. This hotel has two separate buildings, the east and west towers. When I checked in at the west tower, the clerk was uneducated in the hotel's computer system. As the west tower is the less busy of the two, there was no one to help him and we had to wait about 30 minutes to complete the check in. This would have been nothing more than an annoyance, but the check in was not correct. When we drove to the other building to go to our room, we discovered that our room was in the old section of the hotel, about a 1/4 of a mile walk through a maze of hallways in the hotel complex. I am not exaggerating. I counted steps. I booked my travel through Priceline as an experiment, a mistake that I never will repeat. This hotel was listed and promised as a 4 star hotel. The hotel clearly treats Priceline customers like second-class citizens, but Priceline does not warn you of this fact. When we finally arrived at out room, the carpet was dirty, not just worn, the bathroom was rusty, vents were missing from the closet doors and there was one bed, although the check in clerk had supposedly booked in two queens. The room was a step down from a Motel 8. To the bellhops credit, he switched our room to an "upgraded" room for free, and he at least tried to help. We moved rooms to the main tower and were greeted by dirty (stubbed out cigarettes) hallways and our room was again dingy with beaten up furniture, a desk that was literally falling apart, lamps that had no working bulbs, etc. After settling in and unable to find a floor vending machine for a bottle of water, I decided to pay the $ 4.00 for the hotel's room bottle, only to find that the bottle had been previously opened! Yuck! I called the front desk to assure that the water would not be charged to me, and she comped me another bottle, but the fact that the bottle was not checked should tell you the level of cleaning in the hotel. In addition to the gross room, and I swear to the big G on this, our toilet actually backed up. I believe that the hotel maintenance staff knew that there was a problem with the toilet before we checked in because the lid was not fully on the toilet when we got in the room. All in all this was a disgusting experience. If the room had not already been paid for through Priceline, I would have switched hotels. I WILL NEVER STAY AT A SHERATON AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience all the way around”
Reviews.Author: lns0mnlak
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. We had just come from the Westin Bonaventure in L.A. and after staying in that run-down hotel for the majority of out California vacation, we wished we had stayed in San Diego the whole time! The lobby is nice and fresh and the check in staff was very helpful. At first we were put in a room without much of a view and all it took was a friendly call down to front desk and they happily moved us (we did check in on a weekday so it may not have been very booked). The view wasn't perfect because of how the hotel is angled, but it was nice. The room was clean and the bathroom wasn't huge but it was nicer than at the Bonaventure. I can't remember what the name of the room was, but it was on one of the top two floors, so it came with access to the penthouse club, which served breakfast in the morning and hors d'oeuvrs before diner (but get there early!). The internet access seemed a little pricey at $15, but I think there is free access to internet in the penthouse club. The bar there is nice and friendly. I met a lot of nice people while staying here and I had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant first time stay”
Reviews.Author: agvball
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located directly across from the airport. Parking choices are Valet $24/day or Self-Park (uncovered and short distance) for $17/day...both can be charged to your room with in-n-out privileges. We checked in very late - and our options were 2 beds in the "main" tower - or - a king (what we requested) in the other tower. We were tired - we took the 2 bed room in the main tower. It worked out - our room had a balcony that overlooked a harbo where MANY boats are moored (sp?) It overlooked the outdoor pool and walking trail or sidewalk. It was a very nice view. I think we were in room 1034. Our room had a connecting door to the next room - you could hear people loud and clear in the morning. I'm not sure if they were extra loud or the walls were paper thin (or the noises came through the clearance below the door). The bed was SO comfortable - it is my 2nd favorite bed behind the "Cloud 9" Westin bed in Oklahoma City. Bathroom was up to date and clean. We didn't try internet access. The magazines in the room were helpful - it even had a coupon for Harbor cruises that helped. The concierge (sp?) also has coupons and maps - stop by to see him/her. We stopped by the bar for one drink - it seemed nice. We didn't use any othe shop/cafe/restaurant in the main tower. The "other" tower was just 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile down the road - I'm sure it would have been fine. We did not use a taxi - but the concierge mentioned that it would cost @ $10 to go 4 miles (one way) over to the Marriott hotel (where our friends were) by the convention center. There are some parking meters near the tourist spots - they tend to run $.25 for 12 minutes - and there is a parking garage by the Nimitz aircraft carrier museum. Just thought I would toss that in in case you are trying to decide whether to rent a car or whether to take a taxi to your locations. We would definitely stay here again. We felt like we got a good price for the type of accomodations we received.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Juggajim
Reviews.Content: Well, I used to live in San Diego, so I can honestly say this is a good central location, and a nice way to experience the look of San Diego...by staying at this Sheraton. The price was reasonable, the room had a great bay and city view, and there are very nice restaurants that are walking distance. The only complaint I would have is...that the carpets seemed old and dirty...more of an old motel carpeting than a high-class hotel. Time to give the maids a break and actually break out the funds for a thorough steam-cleaning! Everything else was top-notch, and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: nedve18
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in Harbor Island; very close to downtown. The rooms are very good and very clean. The Lobby is beautiful, and the staff is amazingly helpful. The only thing bad is that the restaurants are extremly expensive, try to eat outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!! from Houston, Texas”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at the hotel and have no complaints at all. The hotel is wonderful. We do stay in the West Tower and get the harbor view rooms. You can't beat the view! The city in the background and the sail boats in the harbor. The walk to the East Tower is nothing. We love it here and when we visit San Diego again, we will stay here. We got our room direct with the hotel and used our Entertainment card.We paid $179 a night for a Deluxe room, High Floor, Harbor View. You can't get a better deal in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserves a return visit”
Reviews.Author: strobellayjam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina for a 5-night stay during a conference held at the hotel in October. The hotel is located on Harbour Island and comprised of 2 towers: the East Tower being the larger and original tower; the West Tower being the smaller but newer tower. After reading the review on Trip Advisor, I made sure to request a room in the newler West Tower. (It turned out to be the better choice since the conference was held in the same tower!). Here's a run-down of my experience: Shuttle - very prompt and efficient. The shuttle runs regularly between the 2 towers and the San Diego airport (5 minutes away). I was also pleasantly surprised to find that the shuttle also drives guests to nearby restaurants on the island and if not available, the bellboy will drive you in the hotel's fleet of Town Cars. Check in - I arrived at 11am on an early flight in and was expecting to have to stow my luggage in storage until the standard check-in time of 3pm. They, however, had my room ready and upgraded me to a larger deluxe room on a higher floor. Staff were very helpful and courteous. Room - paid $259 USD / night which included the buffet breakfast (more on this later). The room had 1 king bed, a sofa, and desk. The room was extremely spacious but the washroom was a little cramped. Room was spotless and had a balcony overlooking the harbour. Housekeeping came daily and was finished before 11am. West tower - newly renovated but while it was the farther tower from the airport, you could still hear the planes coming and going. The West Tower has only 1 restaurant and a small gym but it is much brighter and quieter than the East Tower. The East Tower is a mere 5 minute stroll along the marina or a 2 minute bus ride. Seriously, people who say the walk is long must not get much exercise! There is also free WiFi access in the hotel lobby but you must have your own wireless-equipped laptop to use (otherwise, head to the web bar in the lobby of the East Tower) Gym - very small but was never crowded. Equipped with 1 elliptical machine, 2 treadmills, 2 exercise bikes, free weights, and mats. Water cooler provided, too. Breakfast buffet - trek on over to the East Tower for the buffet. It's well worth the $$!! Plenty of fresh fruits, cereal, hot foods, and a made-to-order omlette bar. Location - very convenient...a 10 minutes ($15 USD) cab ride away to Horton Plaza in the downtown core. Beautiful views of the downtown skyline and marina. Overall, I would return to the Sheraton. Excellent service, great quality, and not outrageously expensive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel refused to give us a Non-Smoking Room! Priceline buyers beware!!”
Reviews.Author: HappySurfer
Reviews.Content: After bidding on 4-star downtown San Diego Hotels on Priceline, our bid was accepted by the Sheraton on Harbor Island. I requested Non-Smoking rooms with King Size Beds, and called the hotel a week in advance of our arrival about this issue. Upon check-in, we were informed that Priceline rooms are strictly Smoking Rooms with two double beds! Our rooms were in the "Lanai" section, a three story older part of the hotel. We had a pool view, not a harbor view as we had hoped. Aside from the heavy smoke odor, the room was very nicely furnished. Beds were comfortable. We slept well, and were not awakened by airport noise (the airport is accross the street from this Hotel). The main Hotel Lobby is very nice, complete with a large aquarium, and free Internet access. The Concierge was helpful, and all of the staff we encountered were friendly and efficient. We would have preferred a Hotel located closer to the Downtown attractions, but Priceline includes Harbor Island in it's Downtown Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for quiet, don't look here”
Reviews.Author: Candlelight2
Reviews.Content: I am a local San Diegan and had planned a birthday Saturday for my husband. We rented a sailboat out of the Harbor very near the Sheraton. The plan was to go to dinner after sailing and spend a nice evening at the Sheraton. A friend of mine had worked there for years when it was called the Sheraton Grande. I attended her wedding there years ago and it was lovely. Apparently they hotel forgot to upgrade. We only spent one night, but believe me that was enough. It was difficult to book only one night, Saturday night. So when I got a rate of $259.00, I took it. The hotel is an older style and must be at least 45 years old. The ceilings are not very high and the lobby is modest for a Sheraton. Approaching the front entrance, loud pop music was playing. Almost like the hotel was going for a Las Vegas feeling. Our room was modest and it appeared all the rooms had a nautical theme, which was fine. The room had a magnificint view of The San Diego Bay. The trouble started when we found our room and noticed we were located closed to the elevator. The hotel being so old, every time the elevator went up or down, we heard it. When the elevator stopped on our floor, a bell rung. That was't a problem until we wanted to get some sleep. We went to bed about 11:30 p.m. but did not sleep. Apparently there were three or four funtions at the hotel. From around 12:00 until 2:15 a.m. the functions ended and throngs of people got in the elevator and went back to their rooms. When they stopped on our floor, the bell would ding and drunk loud guests would proceed to exit the elevator and yell and sing right at our door. I woke up at least ten times. At 2:00 am, we almost packed our bags and went home, since we live locally. The Hotel is so old, you can hear when anyone in the area flushed their toilet. The toilet sounded like an airplane toilet, does the job great but you'll know the habits of everyone in rooms around you. If you can avoid the hotel do it. Even though the view is spectacular, you'll have to catch up on your sleep it you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Pecos17
Reviews.Content: Expected more from Sheraton. The room did not have a fridge or minibar and in general the room was very basic. No facilities to get changed at the swimming pool and could not find a shower either. For a 4 stars hotel I would expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Travelers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpaws
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Mid-September for a conference. Arrived on a beautiful Saturday afternoon well before the 3PM check-in time and was able to get into my room immediately. I found the rooms in the West Building to be very nice and much nicer and larger than those of the East Building. The room & bathrooms were clean and well laid out. Although you have to walk a short distance to get to any conference events, the views of the city and bay more than make up for it. It is also much quieter in the West Building. I did notice that if you leave your sliding door open or ajar that it will effect the operation of the air conditioner. My wife and I thorougly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was prepared for . . . (in some ways)”
Reviews.Author: lagunalvr
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was VERY nervous about staying here. I had been reading reviews for months. We were there for a conference so we had no choice in hotel location. I did request the East Tower, which is where everything is located. The other tower is a far walk away. We were given the tower we wanted and every employee was VERY nice whenwe were making these reservations. Upon arriving we were greeted very professionally and pleasantly. They take your bags to your room, you have no say in this. We were there four nights for the conference and the only complaints I can come up with are the food prices are outrageous for breakfast. If you are preparred to spend $20 for three little kids to have a bagel and share a juice, then no worries. Room service for kids for dinner is EXCELLENT. They have $5 - $6 choices ranging from burgers, quesadillas to chicken nuggets. It was great. The pool and landscaping is so beautiful. You will enjoy your surroundings. My only other complaint is the odd behavior of some staff. MANY times we had knockings on our door, only to have an employee quickly open our door (before time even allowed us to get to the door) and they would pop their head in to see if anyone was there. (Not good if you're in the shower) Always with a weird excuse too. One person was holding bottled water, seeing if we needed replenished. (at $4 a bottle, no thanks) And doesn't housekeeping note these things when they come through???? Another employee came in with a clipboard. When I asked what he wanted, he stated "never mind" and left. Another woman entered with two towels draped over her arm. (Again, doesn't housekeeping do this?) We were beginning to put it together that they knew there was a hotel full of conference attending folks who wouldn't be in their rooms and the employyees were going around swiping things. It's not the most positive conclusion, but it's the only one we came to. Over all, the hotel is beautiful, the pool clean and the empoyees we dealt with were friendly and helpful. Food pricey and a few weird experiences. Just be careful . . . . . Hope this helps a little.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Corporate Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife attemded a conference here so I tagged along for the two night stay. Once you accept the fact that this is a corporate hotel and that it's close to the airport for a reason you can enjoy it for what it is. It has three nice pools, good restaurants, a beautiful view of the harbor, a nice walkway between the two towers, clean and comfortable rooms, plenty of outdoor seating, good service and it's close to downtown. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this inhospitable hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Adamowski
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience ever. A security guard came to our room for a noise complaint. So, we closed the balcony door which had been open to allow fresh air to come in. Next thing you know, no less than FOUR Harbor police cars are dispatched to the hotel. Apparently our next door neighbor complained that we were shuffling cards too loud. We were not loud at all. We are not partiers! The lobby has music blasting at all hours of the night and due to the location of the hotel, airplanes flying nearby from not only the San Diego International Airport but also North Island Naval Station in Coronado across the bay, and a friendy game of cards gets us kicked out of this hotel! We were in the west tower (you have no choice when checking in which tower you get) and the guest rooms in this particular building must have paper thin walls (which is a shame because the hotel itself is pretty nice). To add insut to injury, the front desk refused to move us to a different room or refund our money and we couldn't even check out properly because their "system was down". Fianlly, I contacted the Guest Experience Supervisor and while he was courteous, he said there was nothing he could do for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelerpdx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Sheraton during the middle of the week while a major conference was going on at the hotel. Our room was on the tenth floor of the East Wing looking over the Marina towards downtown. Pluses: 1) Spectacular view of the San Diego skyline and wonderful location along the marina! 2) Very comfortable beds. 3) The lobby is very nicely designed with a feature called Yahoo Link. PC workstations are clustered in groups around comfortable chairs and tables. High speed broadband service is free along with wireless access if you bring your laptop. Yahoo Link adjoins the Aroma Cafe where snacks and beverages are available. The idea is to create a place to "meet and greet" and hangout. 4) The fitness center is equipped with all new Lifecycle treadmills, bicycles, etc. The facility is spotless and well air conditioned. 5) The lagoon style meandering pool is very nice and in certain places very compatible with lap swimming. Minuses: 1) Room decor in the East Wing needs to be updated. Furniture isn't bad, but the table and floor lamps look like something out of the Victorian past. Previous reviews refer to a nautical theme in the West Wing--hardly the case here. 2) High speed access is $11.95 in the guest rooms--it's still a mystery why upper scale hotels charge for internet access and value hotels don't. 3) Parking is expensive everywhere and no less so at the Sheraton. Overall, I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton San Diego (Harbor View)”
Reviews.Author: CriticalTraveler
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night in San Diego and was glad to have chosen such a wonderful place. The view from our West Wing hotel room was spectacular! We had a beatiful view of the Coranado Bridge and downtown San Diego. The large king size bed room was recently redecorated in nautical colors. The location was central to just about every point in the city. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is a first timer to San Diego. The bonus is that its just off North Harbor Drive and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, even if you get a bargain”
Reviews.Author: naneki06
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the hotel for labor day weekend and the best part about the experience was the view. We got an awesome view of the marina and the lanai pool. However, only 1 elevator out of 2 was working the whole weekend and we either had to take the service elevator or walk all the way down the hall if we wanted to go up to the 5th floor. Otherwise, the wait was like 10 mins. Totally ridiculous. The internet is NOT part of your stay which is so cheesy because the Days In gives it to you for free. We argued with them because when you log in it appears you don't have to pay by entering your hotel room number but we got billed $12 a day for the internet and we only logged in for total of 3 hours over 3 days. Finally, the valet guys were all really nice but the parking was sooooo expensive. $16 a day and we did self parking and husband would drop off/pick up in front of the hotel and the valet guys were really nice about it. We didn't know there was a fee for parking and you are not close enough to park anywhere else so totally not worth staying at this hotel. You can do so much better for the price. The bedding was comfortable and they have nice goose down pillows and comforters but that was it. Shop around..don't come here if you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Priceline find”
Reviews.Author: NJteacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the West Tower from 8/24-8/28. The hotel had a large, recently renovated room with a nautical theme. Overall, the room was comfortable (esp. the bed)..however the bathroom could have been cleaner...the floor of the tub looked dirty. The other thing was there was no safe in the room...which I found to be odd. I normally like to place my valuables in the safe while I am visiting a city...it just makes easier for me. The room was facing the bay and it was definitely a beautiful view. We did not get to try any of the restaurants while staying here. The parking charge was ridiculous...$16 for self park and about $22 for valet..The one night they had a sweet sixteen and a weddding...therefore the self parking was full to capacity and the valet parking had a really looong wait. As for the airport noise, I did not hear even one while at the West Tower. However, the one afternoon we went to the East Tower and I noticed the airplane noise there. The front desk was helpful and friendly...but there was always a wait...I think they need to hire more people. It seemed as though the front desk was dealing with quite a few unhappy guests (one customer was being overcharged and another was a bride and groom who had made a reservation for five rooms and they messed up their reservations.) On our second night there, we had a problem with the bathtub...after showering, the water was not going down. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. After a half hour of using a wet vac to un-clog the tub (which caused the room to smell like a sewer from some reason), the man said it was fixed and that he would send someone up to clean the mess made in the bathroom from the wet-vac. My husband and I waited a half hour and then needed to call the front desk to find out where the cleaning service was (he still needed to shower as we were trying to make our dinner reservations), they assured us someone would be right up. We then waited another fifteen minutes...but there was still no cleaning service. Once again we called the front desk and they assured us someone was on there way...a few minutes later someone arrived to clean the bathroom. However, after my husband showered, the tub was clogged again. Since we did not want to go through what happened again, we asked for a new room for the next day. The front desk was more than happy to move us to another room. However, in this room the main light wasn't working..but it was not a big deal...the bahttub still looked a bit dirty. Overall, the hotel experience was okay for the price we paid on Priceline....if I had paid full price for this hotel, I would have been furious.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: erodriguez215
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 4day trip to S.D. Our stay at the Sheraton was good. I checked in early to get a good view, but since we requested two adjoining rooms they could'nt accomodate us with a better view unless we separated (understandable). We stayed at the east tower. All the restaurants and the main pool are at the east tower, just nice. The pool side food is typical of hotel food pricey and not that great. The hotel has updated its look in some areas and some are desperatly asking for help like the arcade. My sister stayed in the west tower. Rooms are renovated and seem larger. If your not traveling with family, stay there its more quiet. Overall we enjoyed our stay, Im not a big winer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ECGirll
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton on our last leg down the coast for 3 nights. Had a deluxe room on the 9th floor with a great view. Room was large and comfortable, especially the beds. Bathroom was o.k.; clean, but could have been cleaner (tub). Air conditioning wasn't as cool as we would have liked it. We were able to regulate it ourselves, but it didn't feel that much cooler; but it was very quiet. We were in the West Tower, but ALL the action is in the East Tower. It is a pleasant 3 minute walk along the Marina. But after a few drinks, we had to walk ALL the way back. They have one restaurant in the West Tower. Had breakfast there one morning; it was our last. Poor service; ridiculous prices -- $4.50 for a glass of orange juice. We enjoyed the East Tower, especially Quinns (sports bar); good atmosphere. If we stay here again, we will request the East Tower (less walking). Found the desk staff at the West Tower friendly; helpful. Overall, this hotel is o.k. We would stay here again. It does sit next to the airport, but you truly are not disturbed by the air noise. In fact, between the hours of 11 p.m. and 6 a.m., the air traffic stops. We liked the location, and it really does have wonderful views.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: jaime4692
Reviews.Content: My partner, son and I recently stayed at this Sheraton. As I fly often out of San Diego Airport, I often had seen this hotel which is located just across the street from the airport. From that distance, to be honest, it looks like a big 1960-ish (not too attractive) building. So, I must say that I had low expectations of the hotel when I decided to stay there. I thought it would just be a cold airport hotel where people would stay only for the convenience of the airport - not as a destination hotel. I am happy to write, however, that the hotel is much, much nicer when you are in it than how it had seemed from a distance! The service was very good (the valet parkers, the registration, bell-hops) and the views from the windows on the seventh floor were really beautiful. From one side you see the skyline of San Diego and from the other side you see the boats in the harbor/marina. The food there was also very good. My only complaint was that the overnight parking fee is quite high. We didn't hear any airplane noise, even though we were just minutes away from the airport. We just had the basic room, so that's what we got. It seemed like it had recently been renovated and was very clean and nice. The square footage seemed a little sparse (the room was kind of narrow shaped). Had a nice little balcony from which we could see the boats too! All in all, a fine place for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jimmydd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our one year old daughter for five nights August 2006. We booked through priceline and were very pleased with the hotel. We were placed in the west tower in a second floor room overlooking the swimming pool. The room was clean and a good size, with a small balcony. The hotel is very close to the airport and anybody wanting an early night or a long lie in might be disturbed by airplane noise or the noise from the swimming pool-which was quiet after 10.30pm. The hotel is on Harbor island - it's easy to go for a stroll from the hotel along San Diego Bay with lovely views of downtown. It's too far to walk downtown, but it's only a five minute drive away. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant one morning- it's a fairly standard breakfast buffet and relatively expensive at $19 but was done well. Car parking is $14 a day. I called the hotel to request a crib the night before we arrived and was told that availability could not be guaranteed. However, on arrival a crib was available and there was no charge for this. In summary the hotel is a good choice for a family vacation in a good location as long as you are not upset by a small amount of noise from about 7am until 11pm

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina”
Reviews.Author: LisaLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our San Diego vacation where we stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. After reading some of the previous reviews, I had mixed feelings going into this trip. However, once I arrived at the hotel, all my concerns quickly disappeared and our stay was completely enjoyable. We stayed in the West Tower and even with 2 children (we had a king room with a rollaway and a crib) were were comfortable and had ample room. Our room faced the bay which was the best free entertainment. My 2 year old had a blast letting us know anytime a helicopter or airplane took off from North Island or a large ship was passing by. We could also see the Coronado Bridge, downtown San Diego and Point Loma from our balcony. We were also treated to fireworks being setoff near the bridge a couple of nights. The hotel has 3 lovely pools, a small one at the West Tower (with bar/food service), the larger "main" pool and another small pool at the East Tower. The "main" pool has poolside dining with waitstaff service. The food was good although typicaly priced for hotel food. It arrived quick, hot and with a smile from the server who checked on us frequently to make sure things were good. They also accomodated substitutions for the ingredients (ie: chicken for shrimp on the salad). They also allow (and sell) pool toys which was great for my kids. The walk from the West Tower to the East Tower was pleasant, with beautiful views of the harbor. There's a great little deli (Papanani's) along the way which was open for breakfast, lunch and dinner until 8pm. They serve the best tasting ice cream! Also, another poster stated there wasn't a game room/arcade as advertised but there is one, tucked away off the "main" pool, near the spa entrance. The one downfall I found at this property was the $16 to self-park your car (you really need one, the hotel's not downtown or walking distance to public transportation) in the parking lot directly in front of the hotel. But. there are no other parking options available so as a hotel guest, you are stuck with the fee. Overall, this hotel was comfortable, roomy and very accomodating to my family and we would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (surrounded by water)”
Reviews.Author: MickeyD777
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Sheraton Hotel in San Diego (near the airport--Harbor Island). You can actually see the hotel from the airport but the flight patterns at the airport keep the noise away from the hotel. The hotel is not new but is in reasonably good shape. We had a room looking out over the yacht harbor and the harbor and it was just beautiful. We upgraded to the Club Level and this gave us a very nice breakfast at the Penthouse level and a 5pm reception (free food but you had to pay for drinks--pretty chintzy). Easy to get downtown via cab to the gaslamp section so really can do without a rental car unless you want to go sightseeing outside of San Diego. The location of this hotel was the best part. We enjoyed the view and the ability to walk along the harbor and enjoy the views.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST for the money!”
Reviews.Author: vchek
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Sheraton was terrible. We had upgraded to a "deluxe" room when we made our reservations. Our family of four was put into a cracker box size room ( told "all rooms are the same size") with a Motel 6 bathroom, no, sorry Motel 6.... worse.. ( cracked toilet, mold in the grout line of the bathtub and not just a little! A sink that when you turned it on the faucet would break off and again, small, small) The AC was not working, the fan made a terrible noise. They nickle and dime for EVERYTHING...local calls $2.00 a minute, internet usage fees, parking $16.00. They even wanted to charge $25.00 to put a frig in our room) At $200 a night...are they serious? What made it all worse was the insincere smiles from the maniquins at the front desk who could have cared LESS about our experience. Needless to say after one night ( booked for four) we checked out. Found a LOVELY Best Western. The Island Palms and for the same rate checked into a beautiful marina side queen suite, full kitchen, huge bathroom, seperate bedroom. No fees for parking, free wireless, beautiful grounds and pool. AHHHHH now we could enjoy our vacation and we did. Sheraton? Just say NO!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LabsTimesTwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of June 2006. Overall the experience was very nice. The best was our view from our balcony over the boats in the marina. It is very close to the airport, but the airplane noise did not bother us. The pool was clean and not too crowded. The beds were very comfortable, bathroom was clean. Location was perfect for us seeing the sights of San Diego. If I had negative comments, it would be that the carpet seemed old and daily parking was expensive ($16/day, just add it to the rate of your room to make yourself feel better). We did not eat at the restaurants, due to the fact we were looking for cheap eats. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: BlondiSCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 1 and 2, 2006 and had a great stay. We spoke to quite a few employees asking questions about renting bikes, restaurants, etc and everyone was very friendly and helpful. We even got lost downtown looking for a restaurant and I called the hotel for help ... the girl gave me directions and was really friendly. We stayed in the West Tower, and I guess the rooms have been recently renovated (see pix). I thought the rooms were really large and you can see the ocean from bed (we had a bay view). The bathroom needed a bit of updating but the room itself was quite nice. We ate at the Harbor's Edge which is in the East Tower and had a lovely lunch - service and food were good. The calamari was so yummy and tender! We spent our pool time at the West Tower pool though ... the East Tower pool was too crowded with too many kids for my taste. The West pool is more low-key although it also has a bar/food service counter. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate hotel to a tee!!”
Reviews.Author: jredders
Reviews.Content: We were ending our family trip in California here but quickly discovered that this was another corporate hotel designed for the business traveller. Lots of extras that you had to pay for inc car parking at $16 a night. Not within walking distance of down town but ideal for airport. Not ideal for families with small children but great pool

Reviews.Title: “Harbor is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jojolina
Reviews.Content: I will simply list the pros and cons i observed from my stay at this property. overall it was very nice and my kids and i enjoyed our stay. i stayed in the west tower that has been recently renovated. pros: beautiful harbor-try to get a room with a view nice lobby free wireless internet in the lobby nice spacious rooms with upgraded new linens higher end toiletries(shampoo/conditioner) nice balcony in every room good central air conditioning with modern and effective temperature control adequate gift shop in west tower, good for forgotten items in room coffee with liquid creamer not powder (yes its the little things) modest pool that is pretty private (most ppl go to the nicer pool at the east tower) and overlooks the harbor nice poolside bar at the east tower parking is very close to the hotel at the west tower close to downtown cons: front desk check in staff was cold and snippy about what room i could get. i asked for the east tower. i was told in no uncertain terms that i would get what i got. well not that bad, but close. otherwise, the staff was very nice PARKING is too expensive! 16/day for self parking. ridiculous airport noise was very distracting the first day and morning. you get a prompt wake up at 6:30 am. you are literally next door to the airport. we got used to it eventually. room service and dining there is extremely expensive-the food was pretty good though most ammenities are in the east tower, so you have to walk over there..about 1/4 mi if you want to enjoy them. there is no game room/arcade as advertised (disappointed teenager)

Reviews.Title: “WATCH THOSE "LITTLE EXTRAS!"”
Reviews.Author: aftkel
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Sheraton because my husband was a speaker at a conference there. We got a reduced (conference) rate and I have to say it was a fair price for the value. Their beds are terrific! Even the rollaway bed (an additional $20 per day) is terrific! It was very quiet, and I always appreciate that. The morning coffee and tea setup on each floor was nice. We were annoyed at the $16 per day parking fee. Seems like conference participants, in particular, should be able to park for free! We could not afford to eat in their restaurant, and the prices of bar drinks was out of sight in comparison to other area restaurants and bars. One morning we had no water at all, and one of the two elevators was out of order. Check-out took forever because of a $100 billing error. Management finally removed the five $20 "extra" fees because they could not provide proof of what the fee was for. We didn't appreciate them trying to get away with this. The location is splendid. Others on-line have complained about the airport noise--it did not bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “West tower, like a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jkchen1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the West tower for a business function and loved the intimacy. I did stroll over to the East tower and it was hopping! Beautiful lobby, bar, internet cafe, and restaurants. However, for me it was too busy. The airport is very close so be prepared for prompt 6:30am wake-up calls!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mssmweiss
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Sheraton Marina April 18-April 20. Got the room thru priceline and must agree that at $110, it was worth it. Read thru the preceeding threads and decided to book a room at the West Tower. The rooms are brand new and very, very large. We requested a high room and we overlooked the back of the hotel towards the marina. It was very comfortable. Service was excellent. Checked out the east tower and felt there was alot more activity going on. If you want calmness book the West Tower. It is however about a 1/4 mile between the two towers. We walked there for the pool during the day, but my son went down to the jacuzzi at the West Tower at night. The breakfast buffet at $18.95 was not worth it. Also it is $16 for self-park with in and out privileges. Close to the airport and downtown, but nothing else within walking distance. I loved the views from the room and would definitely return for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, but make sure you book through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: bofnyc
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the going rate per night is for this hotel, but I'd imagine it's close to $200/night. However, it can be had for approximately $90/night through Priceline. My wife and I got a room at that rate and just spent 5 nights at the Sheraton last week. Overall, I don't really have too much to complain about. The rooms were quite small, but definitely sufficient for 2 people on vacation. You are very very close to the airport and can hear planes taking off on a regular basis during the day, but you get used to it pretty quickly. Overall, the hotel is somewhat noisy. Our air condition made a racket at night and the walls are somewhat thin. Parking is a total rip off--$16/night for "self parking". But if you get a deal on the room it's easier to justify this. You really do need to rent a car as it doesn't seem like there are many public transit options in San Diego, so the parking can't be avoided (there's nowhere else nearby to park). The pool at the hotel is quite nice and very large, and the location of the hotel on the marina is nice as well, and you're just 5-10 minutes from downtown. Also, the lobby is impressive and they have computers set up where you can get online for 30 minutes if you are a guest. Concierge was very very very helpful and the staff are all quite nice. In my opinion, this hotel is a bargain at $90/night. At the full rate, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: SueZeeQueSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Each and every employee, front desk, restaurant, spa, everyone -- had incredible customer service skills and helped to make our weekend stay here very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with great views”
Reviews.Author: GAGURL
Reviews.Content: For the $90 priceline rate we got on this hotel, it worked for us. We got a great room with wonderful view of the bay, downtown skyline and Coronado Bridge. Concierge was great with directions and staff was very friendly. I would have been disappointed had we paid full price, but for what we paid, I was more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck there on a cancelled flight”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: Only spent 5 hours and most of it was sleep. Great view, location next to airport, friendly staff. All in all not that bad for a comp'd airline room. I would recomend to anyone laying over in S.D. overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, if you get it at a discounted rate.”
Reviews.Author: wuzupg
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice, when I first walked in. The registration desk people were very friendly at check-in. I ended up in the East Building in the North Wing. The room wasn't anything spectacular, just a regular room. The worst thing that I experienced there was that, despite the scalding hot bath water, when I changed it to shower it was adequately warm, although I had it all the way hot. Self-parking is $16/day and valet is $22/day. They figure they can get you there, since the hotel isn't really close to downtown. I thought that having free internet access, for hotel guests, in lobby was great. The buffet was pretty good at $18. Not like we had any choice because the average dish was $14 (for french toast, pancakes, omelettes, etc.) What would you choose, considering you could get all-you-can-eat for about $4 more? A no-brainer there.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & view at Sheraton Marina San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the west tower of the Sheraton Marina San Diego pre-cruise. Very attractive room, super helpful front desk and the view of the sailboats racing was incredible! Be sure to book a bay, not marina, view in the west tower (the east tower has not been renovated to my knowledge). Nice complementary appetizers for happy hour in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: plcitv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days for business during the first week of March. I stayed in the east tower and the room was clean, well-maintained, and recently remodeled. I did not experience any of the airport noise. The hotel staff was extremely polite and professional at all of our company functions. Room rate was $199 which is high - but not for this part of San Diego. It would have been nice if there was a beach, but this is a "marina" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here for full price!”
Reviews.Author: salonit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference having paid $250.00 a night - definitely not worth it. Rooms in Main tower had grotty dirty carpets and curtains. Finally moved to west tower where the rooms were new so much better but plumbing was being renovated - so inconsistent hot water and broken taps and loo plumbing. Plumbers and random people constantly walked in during the day to fix these. Overall if we had paid $99.00 a night - great but the price we paid we expected a lot more. Service did not make up for the hotel condition either - would def not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation apparently complete - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidLou
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the West Building at $229 (convention rate) and found all new carpet, paint, paper, and furnishings. Small bathroom, but huge, comfortable hotel room. Surprised that bathroom light fixture is mounted so low that it's impossible to see mirror without ducking (I'm only 5'9"). Very pleasant, attentive desk, bell, and parking staff. Internet service overpriced - try to buy wireless service provided by the marina outdoors - it works from many hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Schneidermom
Reviews.Content: We brought our entire company (28 people) to this hotel for a weekend stay. No one had any problems or complaints. Beautiful property, great location and excellent service. I would highly recommend this hotel for family travel as well. Anything you want to do in San Diego is just 5 minutes away and being next to the airport was not a problem. The view from either side is spectacular. The best hotel experience I have had in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! I loved it”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for Christmas 2005. Pros: 1) Very quick check-in. Requested for a high floor, 2 double beds, and facing the marina, and got it! 2) Very plush, clean, comfortable beds with 4 pillows (on each double bed) 3) Great views from the balcony 4) 5 free internet access/computers in the lobby: very nice modern setup with flat screen Sony monitors, free printing; also a lounge area with flat screen TV. 5) Large swimming pool, usually almost empty each day we swam; nice adjacent hot tub. 6) Convenience store at the lobby was great and essential 7) Laundry facilities!! very nice surprise; washer and dryers definitely helped during the trip 8) Lobby was nicely decorated with grand christmas tree + aquarium 9) For a hotel located right next to the airport, we didn't hear any planes at all! (except for loud next door neighbors) 10) Never pay anything above $99 for this hotel. It is priced right at $99/night. Neutral: 1) Had the christmas buffet dinner, and it was definitely bland. Alcoholic drinks were weak. Should have gone to a restaurant in the Gaslamp District for much less than the $122 we were charged at the hotel. Cons: 1) Gym/health spa was closed & under renovation. Website was not updated until my day of arrival, so I could not fully complain. 2) Parking is a mess at times; no free spots, so you circle around and around and wait and wait 3) Thin walls- loud people in the rooms next door can bother you 4) Small bathrooms 5) No wireless internet; pay for ethernet access

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: paullv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the West Tower for 6 nights last week and had 5 different rooms due to the renovations. I spent the week sharing the evevators with hotel staff and hoping it would stop on my floor. I was very disappointed with my stay. The West tower also only has 1 restaurant. I would definately not recommend the hotel here in the near future and avoid a room by the elevator at all costs as you will be stuck listening to them day and night.

Reviews.Title: “your standard business hotel”
Reviews.Author: homerj108
Reviews.Content: stayed nov 20-23 for a conferance, great bed, standard hotel ameneties. What bugged me about this room is there is no mini fridge and no in room safe. These i consider critical for a business hotel, and just what i would expect for this level of hotel. besides these issues an uneventful hotel eitherway. Also this hotel is within walking distance of the airport terminal,(no kidding).

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: vnomous92
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 2 1/2 year old and myself stayed here back in late August for a late summer mini-vacation. Since we arrived on a Sunday night for a Mon-Tues stay, there were few 'tourists'. We basically shared the hotel with 850 members of a conference being held at the hotel while we were there. Based on reviews on 'Trip Advisor', we selected this hotel as part of our AAA packaged vacation (it included Sea World admission). We requested a East Tower (Main Tower) room with a view of the marina (see photos). Since we were there over a work week, we basically had the breakfast buffet to ourselves and all of the conference members had come and gone by the time we came downstairs. Close to Sea World, Zoo, Downtown and across the street from the airport. Location is great and sure beats the 'Hotel Circle' area (noisy freeway traffic at all hours). And a much better view! We were met by a nice, helpful staff and will enjoy a return visit to the hotel in the future. By the way, if you have kids, they'll love the huge fish tank in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Under Renovations”
Reviews.Author: phathoisy
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a stay at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel And Marina. This hotel is current undergoing extensive renovations. During our stay, there was loud pounding and jack hammering from 8:45 AM to 6 PM on a Friday and Saturday. The hallways also smelled like carpet glue and the elevators were used for construction. This construction is very disrupting to a guest expecting a relaxing weekend at a four star hotel. The hotel does not disclose the construction on their website and only informs guests about the renovations at check-in. I would not stay at this hotel again, while it is under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - your typical, generic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigDTraveler
Reviews.Content: My company was hosting a conference in both Sheraton hotels. Upon checking in, they had my reservations wrong so my suite was not available. They placed me on the 8th floor with a view of the marina, and enjoyed it so much that I decided not to change. Absolutely loved the view, and being able to keep the patio door open 24/7 enjoying the perfect weather. As far as the conference goes - the hotel messed up continously, so I would not recommend hosting one there. Otherwise it was your typical Sheraton with overpriced food, and a few glitches here and there (like the parking) but for quick travlers who want to be near the airport, it's fine. There was a new, swanky Marriott and Hyatt just a few miles away, in downtown S.D., but I'm sure their prices would be beyond what my company deems appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for $200 a night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for the club level which included parking and breakfast. My husband travels alot and is a gold almost platnuim starwood member. They were remolding the club floor so the upgraded us to a two room suite with two full baths and three tvs. They gave us breakfast buffet at the resteraunt which was excelent with waffles and omlets made to order. That alone would be $30 a person plus $ 14 for parking. Almost everywhere in San Diego you pay to park. I was suprised we did not have internet service which is usually on club floors. After speeking with the manager they let us use the business center for free. I would recomend booking a club room cheeper then all the extras all acart. We stayed 5 nights with close acess to zoo, sea world, downtown events. We did not have any problem with plane noise, my son 8 liked to see the big ships comming and going everyday and the pool was fine to relax after outings.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mv99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina for a long weekend. The hotel is very nice and directly on the water. The rooms was a lot smaller than I expected, a bit cramped (forgot what tower we were in) but still nice. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The hotel is expensive though, but would go back find I found a good a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised – Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LAFamily
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we were very hesitant about staying at this hotel. We had tried Priceline for the first time ever and for $111 we got this room. We usually stay at Lowe’s Coronado retreat, but now that we have a baby, we are trying to save some money. We loved our stay here. The room was super clean and had an awesome view of the harbor. We slept with the balcony door open. Our room was on the seventh floor of the West Tower. It was a nice room (bathroom a little small- but who cares with the view we were given- we didn’t come to bath). The West Tower we are told is not as nice as the East Tower, but we had a great time. We had dinner at the East Tower. Our son was hypnotized by the huge beautiful fish tank in the lobby of the East Tower. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We found the bellman to be the most informative. We just found the whole experience to be a surprise, we expected bad and we got great. We never heard planes, we didn’t have a bad room, we just had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: jaymdennis
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Our room did not overlook the ocean but instead the airport. Airplanes take off from 6:00 AM until 11:00 PM. They are very close and very noisy. Pools were very nice and the conference areas were nice as well. The rooms were good and the beds were very comfortable. Charges for everything from fitness room to delivery of room service (thought that is what room service is for). Stay was not great but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: SAS-Arizona
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel in the weeks leading up to our vacation in late August, I was terrified about what we would encounter. However, since my expectations were so low, due to the other reviews, we were pleasantly surprised. Our check in was very easy with an attentive valet and pleasant front desk staff and the Bellman, Andy was very friendly and quick! (our bags were in our room within minutes of our check-in and even then he was apologetic about the "delay") Self-parking fees are steep, but we never had any trouble finding a space close to our room and our Key Card actually worked, for the whole six days. We were given a room in the East Tower, right over the pool, which could be noisy if the window was open, but it was great for our daughter to be so close to the pool. We only ate in the bar, for dinner, which wasn't any more expensive than any other hotel food. Our room was clean and we had no complaints about the service or our stay. As we had booked our trip through Expedia, we had a nice stay for the price we paid for high season in San Diego. The only complaint we had was that there were very few restaurants close by. It would be tough if you were staying for a conference and didn't have a car. All in all, it was a nice stay at a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four start hotel..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a convention hotel. I and felt like I was just part of their massive operation there.. and as soon as I got there I had to deal with extras that I was not interested.. like the automatic registration for this and that... The first morning I got 3 wake-up calls at 5:30am which I did not request... they even thought it was funny. Its a pity because the area and sorrounding environment is really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Hey - It's a Sheraton! By the Airport! It's Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MrDoof
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Towers Marina for two nights - August 19 and 20. Make no mistake, this can be a very busy place. Especially in August as folks make one last getaway before the start of school, etc. We reserved a nice "cozy" room on the Club Level that had a fantastic view of the harbor and downtown from the 11th floor. Staying on this level also gave you free self parking and a very nice continental breakfast each morning. Worth considering if you compare to their other room rates where these two items could run you an extra $30 to $40 per day. Rooms were very quiet considering you are less than a half mile from the airport. The location is great - you are really only a 10 minute drive from Old Town, Downtown, Sea World, Balboa Park, and other locations. Two lowlights - check-in on a Friday evening (about 6pm) with only one clerk at the desk. It took forever - what were they thinking about staffing on one of their busiest nights of the summer! The other issue was the A/C in the room - it only runs on AUTO mode, so it can be a real sleep stealer if you are a light sleeper. The staff was all very nice and the grounds are certainly pretty. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Paradegirl_nyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed the west tower, which after reading other reviews looks like we lucked out! Although the east tower (the main building in all the photos) has the nicer pool, the west tower was bright, clean and quiet (and has a fine pool and hot tub). Check-in was easy and we were given a very nice, clean (over-sized) king room with a couch and balcony overlooking the bay. We are starwood preferred guests, so we may have received an upgrade and didn't know it. The Sheraton Sweet sleeper beds are heavenly and sooo comofortable. The bathroom was nice, a little small, but still fine. The room did not have an alarm clock...which was weird, but the wake up calls were fine. We did not hear any commerical planes from the airport (which is very close)...by the pool you can hear the navy planes from across the bay. I ate breakfast one day in the restaurant, $18 for a waffle & OJ - so we went to a denny's on pacific highway (very close) for the rest of the week. This was a great location with very easy acces in minutes (literally like 5) to downtown, balboa park and highway 5 if you have a car. They charge $16 for parking a day -- and the gate didn't work right the entire time we were there. (Its $22 a day for valet) I got two days removed by pushing their service guarnatee back on them...and they easily agreed. The bell staff was nice, although we prefer to just wheel our own bags. The elevators at the parking lot end of the hotel need some paint, but it looked like they were in the process of fixing them. We ended up here on a deal from a travel site - and we would stay here again, but we would definitely request the west tower!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hotel. We were there on our honeymoon Aug 15th-20th and had a great stay. Maybe this is because I asked for a nice room at check in? We were in Lania room 5320 of the east tower with a lovely view of the pool and harbor. The spa staff is rude so I didn't book with them, but there is a spa on every corner in San Diego. I recommend Elaine at the Meridian for hair and make-up. I would give the hotel 3-3 1/2 stars. We wanted a clean and safe place to stay and this fit the bill. The key card readers on the self parking gates do not work. This is not a big deal as all you have to do is take a ticket and tell the gaurd your room number when you leave. We had an excellent time with parking. We got a spot directly in front of the elevator to our room the entire stay. The hotel also has a fabulous location. Request the east tower with a pool view and you'll be happy here. :) I only wish my camera had picked up the view in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse, but definitely could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: N1ch0l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton in July. Pros: -The hotel itself is attractive. -The bed was very comfortable. -Our room was clean. (This was the only reason we didn't attempt to find another hotel.) -The pool and hot tub were large and nice. -We had fun playing pool at the sports bar, which is even family friendly. -We had a beautiful view. Cons: -The rooms are worn and outdated. (We changed rooms twice to compare both towers.) -The bathroom was small and unappealing. -The hotel is not far from downtown, but it's still distanced from everything. -The valet was the worse! No one opened my car door for me, or even assisted us with our luggage. Maybe they were busy, but this was not a good impression. Maybe we are just to picky, but there are so many beautiful hotels in San Diego and this was not one of them. For us the actual room we stay in is most important, and this Sheraton offered nothing special in their guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July as was moderately satisfied until about 3am on the first night when I was overwhelmed by a strong methane smell, the hotel said it looked into the problem but the smell got progressivly worse as our stay went on. The hotel expressed concern but did little, if anything, to fix the problem. There are many nice hotels in San Diego and I would strongly recomend avoiding this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlynchWatertown_CT
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here from 7/27-7/30. The room is adequate, but small. If your troom overlooks the marina and pool as ours did, you have a beautiful view. The pool is very nice. There is a reasonably priced restaurant adjacent to the pool, Waterworks. It closes by 4;30/5:00. It would be nice if it stayed open later so that families could enjoy it for dinner as the restaurant in tne hotel is pricey for kids and the pub appeared loud and not kid friendly. The hotel is in a good location...near the airport (you don't hear the planes in your room and they are not offensive if you're outside) and close to downtown...we were probably 10 min from Petco Park, 20 from the zoo and 10 from old town. My only complaint is that they charge $16 to park your car...you are their hostage as there is no where else to park. This was unacceptable to us and after complaining they removed three days of parking. Also they failed to deliver extra pillows and blankets and we received a $50 credit.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe124
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and marins in San Diego. I paid for the club level rooms which included free breakfast in the executive room and free parking. The room faced the marina and bay. Room is small and lacked finer comforts. A basic room, not worthy of a 4 star rating. Small closet and one dresser. Below the room are the loading dock for hotel and parking lot. I was on the 11th floor and every morning, we heard trucks loading and unloading supplies. They were errecting a tent and we heard every hammer and truck. Airport noise is almost non-existent but truck and motorcycle noise was constant. If you are seeking a view in this hotel, ask for side side facing downtown. More scenic and quiet. Parking is a nightmare. Key cards did not work for self parking. I attempted to enter lot late at night and key card did not open the gate. Several cars behind me caused a mini traffic jam while I had to reverse. Found a attendent to assist me. The lot is huge and very dark. Not safe for a woman alone to park a car alone. Paths to the hotel are not marked and we stumbled through bushes and a unexpected 5 foot drop trying to find a side walk. Valet parking, a $8.00 additional charge is almost a necessity. WE complained about parking at desk but clerk did not seemed concerned. No method to test key card until you try to park. To late! Internet is available for $13.25 per 24 hours. Wireless service not available. Outside eating opportunities are very limited. The pool in east tower is very nice and quiet. Overall, service is very good and employees will assist patrons. This is a convention hotel, not designed for families and tourists. The west tower would offer a better view of the bay. Not a four star hotel. Club level rooms not worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. We stayed in the East Tower (the West tower looked nice, also). The hotel is situated on Harbor Island, where there is a marina with yachts, boats, and sailboats. We had two rooms, both were very clean and well-stocked with towels, soaps, shampoo, conditioner, coffee & creamer. It also had a hair dryer and an ironing board with iron. The beds were very comfortable. We had trouble figuring out how to set the alarm clocks, so we just dialed the automated "wake-up" call, which only took a few seconds. We also could not find any pens in the room to write postcards, but did find some next the the pay phones near the lobby. We also had some trouble with the air conditioning controls. The thermostat had a setting to run the fan low, medium, and high. We turned it on high, as we like the humming sound when we sleep. However, it would turn on for about 10 seconds, then shut back off. The room temperature was comfortable, but we couldn't get the fan to stay on. The hotel restaurants were somewhat pricey for us, considering we had children. They offered a breakfast buffet for $18.99 per person. Our children are too old to be offered the children's prices, but also not big enough to eat $18.99 worth of breakfast. Instead, we bought pastries and bagels from the cafe, and that ran about $20.00 total. There were only a few restaurants on Harbor Island, so bring a car or your walking shoes, because you may have to walk about 1 - 2 miles. Even though this hotel is very close to the airport, we didn't notice a lot of noise. Occassionally we would hear a plane flying by, but it wasn't very loud. It was actually a bonus, as we ate at a restaurant down the street late on evening, and the view of the planes flying over the bay was beautiful. The service we received at the check-in counter was average. We paid for our 2 rooms weeks before our trip (via check). However, their records didn't show our room as being prepaid, so they asked for our credit card. I was very concerned that they didn't show us paying $1400 and told them we had a cancelled check, but they didn't seem concerned or even try to help. They just wanted our credit card so they could check us in. After more discussions, I finally got the name and extension of a person in accounting to talk to. However, I could not get ahold of this person and left voice mail. The next day, I still had not heard anything, so I went to the check-in desk and found out it was taken care of. I think they could have at least called us and told us they fixed the accounting error, or apologized. But at that point I was happy that they agreed that we did indeed pay for our rooms already. The concierge was extremely helpful in helping us plan a sightseeing tour. She had very much information and was very knowledgeable. Since there is no beach on Harbor Island, we went swimming the the hotel's pool. However, the evenings were cool, and we didn't realize until the last night of our stay that there is a whirlpool just a little ways down from the outdoor pool. Once we found that, we spent the evening in there. The hotel also says they have a game room. However, all we saw was a couple ping-pong tables, and couldn't find the paddles or balls. We would stay at this hotel again, mostly for the beauty and the comfort. All the other things didn't really matter, because we were there to sight-see, not to spend the day at our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Value. Definitely not a repeat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we booked through Expedia and was originally booked at the Hampton Inn. Somehow we got bumped(!) from the Hampton and moved to the Sheraton. Actually we were happy about it because we thought it was a four star hotel and that we had been upgraded. Ha! For the money this was the worst place we have ever stayed.
